Ella comenzó trabajando para un local de instrumentos musicales y después se decidió por abrir su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a la venta de instrumentos musicales y a la renta de equipos para eventos, diariamente ella abre su negocio desde temprano y necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y así poder comprar artículos como: micrófonos, cuerdas para guitarras, baquetas, parches para baterías, maquinas de humo, etc. Alejandra dice que aun que tiene competencia no se da por vencida y trata de mantener a sus clientes y ganar recomendaciones con los demás dando buenos precios. Sus planes son; poder agrandar su negocio y abrir otro local en otra parte y seguir creciendo como persona.

Los otros tres integrantes se llaman: María de Jesús O. (Venta de ropa para dama), Amado G. R. (Veterinaria) y Marcelino Martínez Hernández (Taller de bicicletas) y aunque es un grupo pequeño tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quieren invertir en su negocio para poder tener ganancias y  cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Fénix de Fuego is a group comprised of two women and two men. They are located on Alfredo del Mazo Avenue in the Santa Cruz neighborhood. This is in the state of Chalco in México. All of them feel pleased being in the group because they know each other and have good communication. Alejandra B. L. represents the group. She is 40 years old, and she went to school up to high school. Her husband works as a driver. They have two children, a girl and a boy. They go to elementary school and high school. She started working for a musical instrument place. Later, she decided to open her own business. She currently sells musical instruments and rents equipment for events. She opens her business very early everyday. She needs the loan to invest in her business. She will buy things like microphones, guitar strings, drum sticks, drum patches, and smoke machines, etc. Alejadra says that even though she has competition, she does not give up. She tries to keep her customers and win recommendations from others by giving good prices. Her plans are to be able to expand her business, open another location in another place, and to keep growing as a person. The other members of the group are: María de Jesús O.: Sells Clothing for Women Amado G. R.: Veterinarian Marcelino Martínez Hernández: Bicycle Shop Even though it is a small group, they have a great desire to improve themselves. They want to invest in their businesses to be able to have income and meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, replacement parts for bicycles, musical instruments, and pet food

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, su esposo es cerrajero ellos tiene dos hijos,  ella es vendedora Yambal (es una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales), comenzó con esta compañía porque quería ayudar en los gastos familiares. 

Sonia vende productos cosméticos por catalogo a sus vecinas y amigas, ella da a crédito los productos que vende y se los pagan después de 15 días. Vende perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, shampoo etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, maquillaje para vender mas productos. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y volver a tener otro hijo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 43 years old. She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her husband is a locksmith and they have two children. She sells Yambal (this is a cosmetics company with catalog sales that helps women in Ecuador to be potential sales representatives). She started with this company because she wanted to help with the family expenses. Sonia sells cosmetic products via catalog to her friends and neighbors. She sells the products to them on credit and they pay her after two weeks. She sells perfume, makeup, creams, shampoo, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy perfume and makeup to sell more products. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and have another child.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfume, cosmetics.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 54-year-old man living in a small town in Uganda called Katikara. He and his wife are farmers and together they have seven children.

Through farming they have been able to raise their children and also meet other needs of their family for the last thirty years though Gerald says now the biggest hurdle he faces is the ever increasing school fees for his children in high school.

Gerald intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his three children who are in high school as the new term is set to begin.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his three children who are in high school

loans.name: Um-E-Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Um-e-kalsoom, a resident of city Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over five years. She is a twenty-five-year old young woman, married with one infant child. She loves her family and takes care of them. She gets up early, manages the domestic chores and prepares from breakfast to dinner for her husband and makes all the necessary preparations for her child. She is not an educated lady but she wishes to give her son a better future with good education. 
Her husband's name is M. R.. He operates a video making business. He is a professional video maker and provides his services on a phone call away. He makes videos at wedding and birthday functions and also takes still photography. He has fifteen years of experience in this profession. 

Um-e-kalsoom is applying for a loan from Asasah, to purchase a digital movie camera for her husband so that he can provide better services to his clients and generate a good income for the family and make their wishes come true.

loans.use: To purchase a digital movie camera for movie-making business.

loans.name: Kasibante

texts.en: Kasibante is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school.  Kasibante doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells charcoal in Katanga, one of the Kampala city suburbs. She works in a semi-urban area  and sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for 20 years. She buys charcoal from the villages of Luwero District and uses public transport to and from Luwero to her home in Katanga.  Besides this charcoal business, she also owns bicycles for hire, which brings in 3,000/= per day.  She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She aspires to educate her children up to University and to invest in second hand clothes.  She decided to work with MCDT because it was giving out loans to poor women.   She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rajani

texts.en:
Mrs. Rajani S., a resident of Sabepa, lives with her husband and her one daughter. Sanepa is located in the Klalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses such as grocery stores. Her husband, Mr. Sunil S., works in a motor workshop. Meanwhile, her daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. Rajani S. opened her meat shop 4 years ago in the town of Sanepa. Primarily, she sells buffalo meat in her shop. Nowadays, in her area, there is a very high demand for buffalo meat and the demand continues to rise, so she is requesting the loan to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy buffalo meat.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years. She is a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of her children attend school. Her husband's name is A. N. and he is a loader by profession. He load different items on his donkey cart and delivers them to the designated places and generates income. He has been doing this work for over five years.  
A very caring lady, Zahida stays at home, manages the household chores and cooks food for her family and takes care of their health. She is applying for a loan from Asasah, to purchase a new donkey cart for her husband. The old cart has become rough and rotted, in different areas, which gives him trouble while loading the items, such as fruits & vegetables and cement as well.

loans.use: To purchase a new donkey cart for transporting goods.

loans.name: Darnell

texts.en: Some people can see the future clearly through a cloudy, chaotic present. That describes our client Darnell. In the midst of the country's financial situation in early 2008, Darnell saw an opportunity to help others move ahead of chaos and began his business consulting practice. As a consultant to small businesses, Darnell’s advice has helped turn businesses around – instead of losing money, businesses become profitable. What is most important to him about his work is that these businesses can keep people from losing their jobs and even generate more jobs. While Darnell certainly enjoys getting paid to help small business owners improve their companies, helping employees keep their jobs is, in many ways, even better. Darnell is also helping his clients’ businesses become socially responsible by “greening” their practices and missions. He helps the less-advantaged parts of his community through donating "pro bono" (without charge) consulting services. He feels that the education his company imparts to others through its consulting is a worthwhile, meaningful contribution to his community. Darnell will use his ACCION USA loan to hire additional employees, expanding his current staff of five. So many clients have been happy with his services, and have referred other clients to Darnell, that he is now able to grow his business. So while helping other companies grow and expand, Darnell gets to do the same. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To hire additional employees

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor tiene 67 años, vive en su propia casa con sus dos hijos mayores, quienes tiene su propia familia, es por eso que Néstor de velar por si mismo. Su fuente de ingreso económico es una tienda, negocio que lleva por más de dos años, en donde pone todo su esfuerzo y dedicación para salir adelante. Es así que todas las mañanas abre su establecimiento y termina alrededor de las 9 o 10 de la noche. Pues la zona en la que vive solo existen dos tiendas una de las cuales es la de Néstor, siendo muy visitado por la clientela. En ocasiones la ayuda su hija cuando él tiene que ir a la ciudad a conseguir más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, asimismo su hijo ha decidido apoyarlo comprando  a su negocio comprándole una refrigeradora para que pueda conservar sus alimentos y en el verano, ofrecer bebidas heladas. Por tal motivo Néstor se siente muy contento porque cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, lo cual le da las esperanzas de salir adelante al lado de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP prometiendo ser muy puntual en este ciclo como lo fue en el anterior. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así poder abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Néstor is 67 and lives in his own home with two adult children, who have their own families. Néstor supports himself by running a small store, a business that he has maintained for two years with great effort and dedication. Every morning he opens the store and keeps it open until 9 or 10:00 at night. In his neighborhood, there are only two stores (one of which is Néstor's), so the business is well-visited by local residents. At times his daughter helps out when he has to bring inventory from the city, and his son has assisted him in purchasing a refrigerator to keep food items and cold drinks fresh. Nestor is very thankful to his family for their support. This is his 2nd small loan from MFP and he intends to repay it punctually as was the case in the prior loan. With these funds, he plans to buy more product inventory to better stock his store.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy product inventory for store

loans.name: Majida's Group

texts.en:
Majida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-five years. Her husband's name is G. F. and he is a salesman by profession. He sells bakery items such as biscuits, chips and bread to different shops and generates income. He has been doing this work for over three years. 

To support her husband financially, the very caring and talented Majida runs a decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses on order and earns income. She earns PKR500 from each embroidered dress, which helps her to meet the urgent needs of her family. They both are very hardworking and utilize their income for the betterment of their family. 

Majida is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her own business so she can purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk. This will allow her to increase her profit by completing more dresses.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material in bulk to make embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en:
Deogratius is the father of four children. He and his wife are farmers while Deogratius is also a driver and also does brick-making. He lives in Hoima, Uganda.

Deogratius is the breadwinner for his family of eight people and his family lives in a house he constructed through his hard work. He dreams of seeing all his children educated to university level and that would make him so happy.

Given the activities he does, Deogratius is an ever-busy man and is generally a promising farmer, having been in the business for eleven years. He faces the challenge of seasonal storms which affect his crops some times but he still maintains agriculture is a good business.

Deogratius intends to use the loan to buy spraying facilities for his crops and also to construct a food store.

loans.use: To buy spraying facilities for his crops and to construct a food store

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a single mother of one child and her child is still young. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a charcoal store at home and sells to all categories of people. She buys this charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from shopping. She has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for five years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she also owns a small retail shop.  Her major customers are her neighbors. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and when her customers who bought on credit take a long time to pay back. She aspires to own a restaurant. Teddy joined MCDT because she needed capital for her business. She  resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosa Místico Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Rosa Mística del barrio San Miguel, actualmente se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Cada integrante se encuentra satisfecha con la actividad que realiza así como la señora Mirta A. quien tiene una despensa donde ofrece varios artículos para la casa. 
Actualmente quiere ampliar su negocio para abastecer a otras despensas de la zona y para ello debe compra mercaderías en mayor cantidad para distribuirlos.
Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de panificados, lácteos, fideos, enlatados, embutidos y otros productos de consumo masivo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Rosa Mistica committee from the San Miguel neighborhood is currently in its fifth loan cycle from the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs). Each member is happy with the work that she does such as Mrs. Mirta Alcarez. She has a shop where she sells articles for the house. She now wants to expand her business to supply other stores in the area and for that reason she wants to buy merchandise in bigger quantities to distribute. She is asking for a loan to buy bread, dairy products, noodles, canned goods, cold cuts and other products of general consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, dairy products, canned goods, cold cuts, noodles, cleaning supplies

loans.name: Lingueres Aynoumane 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Lingueres de Aynoumane 2 regroupe quatre (4) vendeurs de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis 5 ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de cent fracs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe  sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The Lingueres de Aynoumane 2 brings together a group of four vegetable and condiment sellers at the market in the Mbour quarter. The group was created five years ago. Every day that dues are paid, the members give 100 FCFA to a particular member of the group whose turn it is. This sum is put into their business to strengthen the working capital of the group. Faced with insufficient funds to meet their needs and working capital, the group is asking for a loan. The majority of the group members left their villages to live in the city in order to support their families.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commercial Activity

loans.name: C2150 Abadatana Group

texts.en:
Souzan is 23 years old and is single. She has a small grocery business which is fruitful in general, being in a central location. She has an experience of two years in her business. She employs one person as helper so that her business runs smoothly.

Souzan works hard which is the reason why she has been selected as group representative of her group which is called Abadatana in the local language. This group contains five members with various businesses; some of their businesses are: selling foodstuffs; clothes sales; selling green bananas; and so on. The members of this group are well organized and seasoned in their businesses.

Souzan and her group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses. With this loan, Souzan and group expect to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Once this satisfaction is reached, Souzan and group believe they will earn more profits which will allow them to sort out some family and business problems.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva, de 53 años, es una mujer  laboriosa,  y vive en compañía de sus  3 hijos mayores, en su casa propia, que esta echa a base de madera y esta ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad.Se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales (platillo típico hecho a base de maíz molido). Comercializa sus platillos  durante los fines de semana y  varios clientes acuden a su casa, y buscan sus deliciosos tamales. Genoveva atiende amablemente desde muy temprano, durante todos los días, también prepara y vende refrescos helados. Le gusta emprender  todo tipo de negocios porque le va muy bien, es por esta razón que  quiere ampliar su mercado,  y, para lograrlo mandara instalar  electricidad en su casa, ya que sus ventas serán por las noches. Además tiene planeado  iniciarse  en la venta de anticuchos (corazón de res a la parrilla) en la puerta de su casa, y está segura de lograr todos  sus objetivos.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus  cuotas puntualmente. Genoveva organizó su grupo, con la finalidad de acceder a los préstamos para seguir progresando.Tiene pensado destinar una parte del dinero, en comprar  insumos para la preparación  de sus tamales, y la otra parte del dinero, la utilizara en el pago de los trámites de la instalación eléctrica de su casa.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 53 years old and an industrious woman who lives with her three adult children. She has her own house which is made of wood and located in a crowded neighborhood in the southern part of the city. Genoveva makes and sells tamales (a traditional dish made of ground corn). She sells her dishes on the weekends when her customers come to her house to buy her delicious tamales. On the days that she sells food, Genoveva starts early to offer her friendly service. She also prepares and sells cold drinks.

Genoveva enjoys everything about her work because she has done very well. For this reason, she wants to expand her business by having electricity installed in her house so that she can sell at night. In addition, she wants to sell “anticuchos” (grilled beef hearts) on the doorstep of her house. She is confident that she can achieve all of her goals.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete all of her payments on time. Genoveva organized her group so that they could access loans to keep progressing. She plans to use part of her loan to buy supplies for making tamales. The rest of the money will be used to pay the installation deposit so that she can begin receiving electricity in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tamales & pay the deposit to receive electricity service

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-five years. Her husband's name is M. Y.. He is involved in a quilt selling business. His selling is not limited to their area, he also supplies the quilts to different cities such as Islamabad and Lahore and generates income. He has been in this profession for the past fifteen years. He maintains a good reputation amongst his customers because of his good dealing and good quality quilts. 

To share the financial burden with him, a very talented Rafiqan operates a business selling decoration pieces. She specifically sells flower objects, such as flower strips and flower vases, in the gift shops and earns income. She earns approximately PKR5,000 every month, which helps her to pay for the utilities. 

Rafiqan is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business. He will be able to purchase the quilts in bulk and sell them to more customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase quilts in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Boosting the business capital

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia, D. 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal D. todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, debido a que cultiva olluco, zanahoria y papa, y que luego son llevadas a vender al por mayor en L. ciudad D. Tarma.  Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea invertir y sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista D. Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y L. cansan mucho. En adelante espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y asegura que ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil doscientos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celedonia is 36 years old and a hardworking responsible woman. She lives in her own home with her five beloved children who are the main reason behind all of her endeavors. With great effort, she has worked her farmland and achieved extremely productive results. She grows ulluco, carrots, and potatoes and sells them in bulk in the city of Tarma. Her crops proviD. the necessary income to support her family. For this reason, she wants to continue investing so that she can succeed in her business. What she enjoys most about her job is caring for her crops. Celedonia has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the wholesale market in Tarma since the sacks are quite heavy and the work exhausting. In order to get ahead, she hopes to improve her crops so that she can generate a better income.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Celedonia said that she submitted her payments from her previous loans on time, so she hopes to do the same now. In her Communal Bank, she is an active participant and is always aware of the agreements that are reached within her group. With the loan of 1200 PEN that she requested, Celedonia will buy compost and insecticides in hopes of improving her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her sons are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. Her daughters stay at home to help her in her domestic chores and with the making of artificial flower sets. Her husband is involved in the timber selling business. He sells the timber in a shop placed in the main market. People come to him to give their orders for timber. He has been doing this work for over ten years. All of the people of the market knows him well. 

Manzooran makes artificial flower sets to increases the family's income. Luckily, her daughters have also learned this skill and they help her to generate more income. They all do care for each other and enjoy doing their work. 

Manzooran is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchases the timbers in bulk. This will enable him to maintain the good reputation among his customers by completing their orders on time.

loans.use: To purchase timbers in bulk to complete the orders on time.

loans.name: Aramanzani

texts.en:
Aramanzani is a 31-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with three children aged 7, 5 and 3 years. His wife is unemployed, meaning the welfare of the family is charged on Aramanzani. He dreams of seeing his children educated to university level just as many Ugandans now wish, having realized the significance of education.

Aramanzani has been obtaining credit from HOFOKAM through which he has been able to finish building his residential house and also buy a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business. Besides the business, he also deals in produce and farming as he tries to make ends meet.

This is Aramanzani’s fourth loan from HOFOKAM. He intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is married to a newspaper vendor and they have six children together. All her children go to school. Resty doesn’t take care of additional family members. Resty owns a stall in Kalerwe market and sells sweet bananas in clusters. She sells clusters at 800-1500/=. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She doesn’t pay transport costs to and from shopping because she buys from the very place where she works.  Resty has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for one and one half years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t have any other side business.  She sells to all categories of people both at retail and wholesale and works seven days a week. Resty pays monthly market dues of 20,000/=.  Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to open another stall in the same market. She joined MCDT to increase her capital base and it was near her place of work.  Resty resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy generic medical products

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento FORTALEZA esta compuesta D. 8 integrantes 7 mujeres y 2 varones, son del mismo barrio D. conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.
 
La Sra. Miriam es la Presidenta D. Banco D. Emprendimiento  tiene como actividad un  puesto D. comida en la Av. 15 D. abril frente, ella venD. hace 18 años  almuerzos y platos especiales como fricase, sajta D. pollo, fritanga, ranga. Ella tiene dos niños uno en edad escolar y el otro es D. apenas dos años. en su puesto le ayudan su mamá y su hermana,es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su familia, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos y otros ingedientes para la elaboracion D. sus riquisimos platillos. 

La Sra. Rosio es la secretaria D. Actas su  actividad es su principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su hija tiene una tienda D. carteras y zapatos D. cuero en el shoping Corazón D. Jesús,  es una persona muy responsable  ya que con este negocio cubre los estudios D. su hija que esta en la universidad quien estudia y a la ves ayuda a su Mamá, con el dinero dle credito comprara mercaderia. 

Y el Sr.Santos es el tesorero del Banco D. Emprendimiento La Fortaleza  el tiene un kioso D. pan en la Av. 15 D. abril  su venta comienza a las 5 D. la madrugada ya que sus clientes son los viajeros a los Yungas en diferentes rumbos el aún es soltero y apoya con su negocio sus estudios y tambien le ayuda a  su mamá con los gastos del hogar.

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Fortaleza is composed of 8 members. They are all from the same neighborhood. Ms. Miriam is the President. She owns a food stall on Avenue 15 D. abril. Since she was18 years old, she has sold lunch and special plates, such as fricasé (spicy pork meat stew), sajta D. pollo (a chicken dish), fritanga (spicy pork and egg stew), and ranga (tripe). She has two children, one of whom is in school and the other who is barely two years old. Her mother and her sister also help her at her stall. She is a very hardworking and responsible person, always thinking in the wellbeing of her family. With the money from this loan, she will purchase ingredients that she needs to prepare her delicious dishes. Ms. Rosio is the secretary of this bank. She has a wallet and leather shoe store in the shopping area, Corazón D. Jesús, which supports both her and her daughter. She is a very responsible person, having used this business to cover the costs of her daughter's studies, who is studying in the university and also helps out her mother. With the money from this loan, she would buy more merchandise. Mr. Santos is the treasurer and has a bread kiosk on Avenue 15 D. abril. He opens at 5am in the morning, since his customers are travelers going to the Yungas. He is single and spends his earnings on his studies and also in helping his mother with their household costs. Every member of the bank is very grateful to El Banco D. Emprendimiento and to Kiva for their support in offering them loans.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: get a motorcycle registration license

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, a resident of the mid-sized city Vehari, Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. She owns a house of three rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. 

A very hard working lady, Nusrat owns & operates a sewing-clothes business. She loves this work because this gives her a lot. She renovated her living room from the earnings and purchased dinner sets and glasses and other utensils to give shape to her house.  

Her husand is involved in a food selling business. He operates a food stand in the community where he sells specifically Dahi bhalas (lentil dumplings in yogurt). His food is famous among his customers and he earns well from it. He has been doing this work for over five years. 

Nusrat is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s food stand so that he can purchase the required items such as cooking oil, spices, yogurt, and potatoes and give expansion to his food stand business.

loans.use: To purchase required material for food stand.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a youth, aged 30 years, married to a peasant wife and together they have two children aged 3 years and 1 year and 9 months. His family resides in a rented house in Kagadi, Uganda.

Ibrahim is the income earner for the family. He has a shoe business selling shoes on market days in different areas in his home district. He says his business has grown in size over the six years he has operated it having started as a food seller in the capital, Kampala. He faces a transport problem in his business, though, due to poor roads that are common in the upcountry areas of Uganda.

Ibrahim’s purpose in requesting the loan is to buy secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 33 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, en la casa de su madre.Se dedica a  la fabricación de zapatos, botas, sandalias, que luego de un arduo proceso, son  distribuidos a los pequeños revendedores  de la ciudad, y ya lleva 4 años en esta actividad. Trabaja en sociedad con su hermano y también cuenta con personal  que la ayuda en  la fabricación de los calzados. Tiene muchos  clientes, que saben de  la calidad de sus fabricaciones y no dudan en comprarlos, al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta del trabajo es que lo realiza en su casa, sin descuidar las obligaciones de su hogar, y considera que lo más difícil fue encontrar clientes estables. En adelante piensa fabricar zapatos de vestir (formales), en vez de  casuales y de ese modo desea ingresar con sus producciones a las galerías mas reconocidas de su ciudad.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que sabe, que este dinero le será muy beneficioso en su negocio.Elizabeth tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cueros (naturales y sintéticos), suelas, tacones y sierres, para seguir fabricando y atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old and an enterprising woman. She lives at her mother’s house with her husband and young child. Elizabeth manufactures shoes, boots, and sandals through an arduous process and then sells her products to small retailers in the city. She has been in this business for four years. Elizabeth works with her brother and also has a hired staff that helps with the production of the shoes. She has several customers who are familiar with the quality of her work and have no hesitation in buying her products in bulk. What she enjoys most about her work is the ability to be at home so that she can still take care of her household duties. She considers the most difficult part to be finding steady customers. To move forward, she plans to start manufacturing dress shoes (formalwear) instead of casual shoes because she wants her products to be seen in the well-known high end shops throughout the city.

This is her second loan with MFP. Elizabeth promises to complete her payments on time because she knows this money will be very useful to her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of leather (both natural and synthetic), soles, heels, and fasteners so that she can continue making shoes and serving her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making shoes

loans.name: Murehe Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
He has subsisted on a produce-sales business for a timeframe of five years. At the age of 27 years, A. Mariko is a fledgling produce sales business trendsetter whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other youth in his home area of Murehe trading centre, Kihihi. Many youth in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking alcohol and smoking marijuana.

With his hard work, Mariko has managed to take firm root and in a month he apparently makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings. With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business. This has, however, not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as the unpredictable weather patterns which, for the most part, means he has fewer supplies from farmers.

Mariko’s dream is to build his own produce stalls and stores to keep his surplus goods. With this loan he hopes to implement the idea of building business stalls and stores for his produce.

loans.use: To build stalls and stores for his produce

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
ESTA UNIDAD DE DESARROLLO (UDE), SE LLAMA LAS 5 ROSAS, LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES QUE ESTA CONFORMADA POR SEÑORAS LAS CUALES SE CONSIDERAN UNAS ROSAS. LAS UDE ES UN GRUPO QUE TIENEN UN PRESTAMO Y SE REUNEN CATORCENALMENTE EN CASA DE LA REPRESENTANTE PARA REALIZAR SUS PAGOS. TIENE UN REPRESENTANTE Y UN COMITÉ QUE LO GOBIERNA. ESTE GRUPO ESTA  UBICADO EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EMILIANO ZAPATA MUNICIPIO DE TECPATAN CHIAPAS.

 EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA SILVERIA C. G. Y TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO ESTUDIO POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS Y APOYO POR FALTA DE SUS PADRES. ELLA HASTA LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE TRES HIJOS 2 MUJERES Y UN VARON. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE PAN Y EL PRESTAMO LO UTILIZA PARA LA  COMPRA DE INGREDIENTE Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS,  SUS CLENTES LE COMENTAN QUE TIENE UN BUEN NEGOCIO Y LO PREFIEREN POR EL SABOR Y CALIDAD QUE TIENE.

ANGELINA G. G. ES MIEMBRO Y COMITÉ DE GRUPO LAS 5 ROSAS TIENE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA NO ESTUDIO POR QUE SUS PADRES NO TENIAN SUFICIENTE RECURSOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD YA NO TIENE HIJOS EN SU PODER SOLO ESTA EN COMPAÑÍA DE DOS NIENTOS Q DESDE PEQUEÑOS ESTAN CON ELLA. DOÑA ANGELINA SE DEDICA A VENDER TRASTES DE PLASTICOS Y PELTRES LA RAZON DEL PRESTAMO ES COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIAY AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y VENDERLO EN LAS COMUNIDADES, SUS CLIENTES LE COMENTAN QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS DE CALIDAD Y LE VA MUY BIEN DESDES QUE TIENE SURTIDA SU VENTA LA PREFIEREN POR SER  AMABLE Y PACENSIOSA.
LOS OTROS TRES INTREGRANTES SE LLAMAN: BLANCA LETICIA E. H., BLANCA LIDIA H. M. Y BENITA H. S., ELLAS UTILIZAN SU PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR CADA UNA DE SUS ACTIVIDADES, Y ASI PODER TRABAJAR Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS ATRAVES DE SUS ESFUERZOS Y DEL PRESTAMO QUE FUNDACION REALIDAD A. C. LES BRINDA.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Las 5 Rosas” (The Five Roses) because the women of this group consider themselves to be roses. They have taken out a loan and meet every two weeks in the home of the group representative to submit their payments. In addition to having a representative, the group has its own governing committee and is located in the community of Emliano Zapata, which is within the town of Tecpatan Chiapas.

The group representative is 25 year old Silveria C. G.. Unfortunately she was not able to attend school due to limited financial resources and a lack of support from her parents. She currently has three children, two daughters and a son. Silveria makes bread and will use her loan to buy ingredients so that she can generate more income. Her customers say she has a good business and that they prefer the taste and quality of her products.

Angelina G. G. is 63 years old and a member and part of the committee for the Five Roses Group. She did not attend school because her parents did not have enough money. Angelina no longer sees her children because they left her alone to take care of her two grandchildren when they were little. Doña Angelina sells cooking utensils made of plastic and pewter. She will use her loan to buy more merchandise so that she can expand her business and sell in other communities. Her customers say that the products she sells are of good quality. Doña Angelina has done very well because she keeps her business well-stocked and people prefer to buy from her because she is friendly and patient.

The other three members are Blanca Leticia E. H., Blanca Lidia H. Muñoz, and Benita H. S.. Through their hard work and with the support of Fundación Realidad, they will use their loans to expand their businesses so that they can continue working and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sugar and fruit

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married to a builder and they  have four children who all go to school. Hellen doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a sweet and yellow banana stall in Kalerwe market. She works in a semi-urban area and works seven days week. She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. Besides this banana business, she also owns a mini-restaurant. Her major customers are cyclists and the community around her business. Her business challenge is the seasonality (rainy season) because she works from a floody place and this hinders her customers from reaching her. She aspires to see her business grow big and to start going directly to the farmers for her bananas. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital. Hellen resides in and rents her two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water . Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: C2256 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the leader of this group which is called Abadacogora in the local language. This group consists of three people who have various business.

Josephine is 33 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 20. Her husband doesn't work and for that reason she works hard so that she provides all her children’s basic needs.

Josephine has an experience of seven years in her business of selling soft drinks and cakes in her region. She employs one person as a helper and runs her daily activities from 5 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Josephine and her group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products. This loan will help them to satisfy the demands of their clients.

Josephine will be using the extra money expected from her expanded business, to reinvest in her business and to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ata's Group

texts.en:
Ata, a resident of the mid-sized city Vehari, Pakistan, is the wife of I. B. and the mother of six children: three daughters and three sons. Her husband owns & operates a grocery shop. His shop is located in the community which is very famous among the community people. He started this shop five years ago when there was no other shop available at the time. People used to go to his shop to purchase small items when they were far away from their houses. He likes this business because he had three years of past sales experience. 

Ata, a very caring lady, stays at home to manage the domestic chores and to cook for her family. She is fond of cooking and does this with enjoyment. She always keeps a smile on her face, which makes her family relax when they enter the house. They all live together with happiness and share the problems and difficulties with each other and help each other to resolve them. 

Ata is applying for a loan, from Asasah, to invest capital in her husband’s business so he can purchases groceries in bulk and complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, de 37 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marleni de 34 años y sus 5 queridos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Leonardo, es cultivar olluco, papa y habas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposa, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Lima, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren para que se pueda comercializar a un buen precio y de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratar un operario para que le ayude en la siembra.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 37 years old and a responsible hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Marleni, age 34, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to have a better life. Leonardo is a farmer who grows ulluco, potatoes, and lima beans. Together, he and his wife work hard to provide their children with a good education. He found it more advantageous to bring his products to the city of Lima where he can get the best prices. What he enjoys most about his job is caring for his crops and protecting them from pests that can threaten his productivity. Leonardo has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products because the travel can be long and exhausting. Over time, he hopes to improve his crops so that he can obtain better prices and increase his income.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Leonardo feels obligated to submit all of his payments on time because he does not want to cause problems for the other members of his Communal Bank, where he is greatly admired. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Leonardo will buy more compost to apply to his crops and hire workers to help with the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & hire workers to help with planting

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is the 40-year-old father of four children. He and his wife are farmers who live in Hoima, Uganda. Gideon is the breadwinner for his family of four people and his family lives in a house Gideon constructed through his hard work. He dreams of seeing all his children educated to university level and that would make him see his dream come true.

Given the farmer he is, Gideon is an ever-busy man and is generally a hard worker with the zeal to succeed in agriculture. He, however, faces the challenge of seasonal storms which affect his crops some times but he still maintains agriculture is a good business.

Gideon intends to use the loan to pay for manual labor to till his farmland since, in the rural areas of Uganda, mechanized farming is limited.

loans.use: To pay for manual labor to till his farmland

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación de este comité la señora Carolina  P. invitó y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Actualmente cada integrante se encuentra trabajando en forma independiente en sus emprendimiento, pero al mismo tiempo se reúnen y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos y tener un capital en común para cualquier necesidad.
La señora Blásida es una de las integrantes, quien se encuentra muy satisfecha con la actividad que comenzó cuando se integró al comité.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles dulces y salados, ella tiene en mente colocar para comodidad de sus clientes mesitas con sillas en su local para servir los comestibles.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de las mesitas y sillas que necesita para mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Sra. Carolina P. is responsible for the formation of this committee. She invited and organized her friends to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. The members currently work independently in their individual businesses, but at the same time, they come together to conduct fundraising activities and share a common bond – which is their need for capital.

Sra. Blásida is one of the members who is very satisfied with the work that has taken place since she joined the committee. She prepares and sells both sweet and savory foods. Blásida has plans for making her customers more comfortable by providing tables and chairs in her shop where she serves food. Her loan will be used to buy the tables and chairs that she needs to improve her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase new furniture and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Alexandra Del Rocio

texts.es:
Este es el banco comunal Alfa nos pudimos dar cuenta que es un gran grupo de señora bastante trabajadoras y muestra de ello es la socia Alexandra, nos comentó  que se dedica a la venta de ropa en la cual invierte el crédito que recibe de la Fundación.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa para adultos y niños en varias marcas y precios, tan solo lleva 6 meses en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien está contenta con los resultados tanto así que con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en surtir su mercadería, le tocara viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para realizar sus compras y poder obtener mejores ganancias ya tiene varios pedidos por entregar como pantalones, blusas y camisas que son las prendas que mas se venden.

Alexandra está casada tiene una niña de 3 años de edad  el esposo es de profesión albañil, cuenta nuestra socia que la situación económica en  la cual estaban atravesando fue lo que la animo a ingresar al mundo de las ventas, antes solo era ama de casa pero ahora no se arrepiente porque este negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante económicamente y a relacionarse.
texts.en:
This is the Alfa communal bank. We can see that it is a great group of very hardworking women, and Alexandra, one of the members, is an example of that fact. She explained to us that she sells clothing, which she uses loans received from the Foundation to buy. Our member sells clothing for adults and children. She sells various brands and sizes. She has only been in this business for 6 months, and it has gone well for her and she is happy with the results; so much so that she will invest this new loan entirely in stocking her merchandise. She will travel to the city of Guayaquil to make her purchases so she can obtain higher earnings. She already has several orders to fill for pants, blouses, and t-shirts, which are the items that sell the most. Alexandra is married and she has a 3 year-old girl. Her husband is a bricklayer. She explained to us that the economic situation that they were in is what motivated her to get into sales. Before, she was a housewife but now she is not sorry because this business has helped her to get ahead economically, and to socialize more.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, t-shirts, and pajamas

loans.name: Evelin Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Evelyn forma parte del banco comunal Alfa en la ciudad de Portoviejo, la actividad que realiza nuestra socia es el comercio de productos de belleza en diferentes marcas como Yanbal, Esika entre otras, además vende bisutería y ropa, está casada tiene 3 hijos, es de Portoviejo,  vive en la ciudadela San Francisco, tiene su casa propia; en el mundo de las ventas nuestra socia lleva 2 años, el crédito que recibirá en este nuevo ciclo en la Fundación lo invertirá completamente en su mercadería,  una parte en ropa,  por eso viaja hasta Guayaquil ya tiene un local que es donde compra al por mayor su mercadería y a precios con los cuales ella pueda obtener ganancias;  los productos de belleza que se vende por medio de pedidos en las revistas los tiene que comprar a contado para poder darle más tiempo a sus clientas con los pagos, esa es la manera en la cual ella vende dejando a crédito a sus clientas.

El sueño de nuestra socia es superarse como madre para ver realizados a sus hijos, por eso todos los días en la tarde se dedica a visitar a sus clientes;  es una manera de aportar con los gastos en el hogar, hay momentos que el sueldo del esposo no les alcanza y es una gran ayuda lo que ella puede hacer por su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Alfa communal bank in the ity of Portoviejo. Her commercial activity consists in selling beauty products of various brands, like Yanbal and Esika, among others; she also sells costume jewelry and clothing. She is married and has three children, is from Portoviejo and lives in the San Francisco housing project; she owns her own house. She has been in sales for two years. She will use the funds she gets from the Fundación this cycle to buy merchandise, part of it in clothing that she goes all the way to Guayaquil to get from a wholesaler she knows there at prices that allow for higher profits for her. The beauty products she sells from catalogues; however, she has to pay cash for them and then extend credit to her customers. This is how she sells: leaving the items with her customers on credit Her dream is to be an outstanding mother in order to see her children develop to the fullest; this is why she spends every afteroon visiting customers. This is a way to contribute to household expenses because sometimes her husband’s salary isn’t sufficient and what she’s able to contribute is of great help to the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For blouses, shirts, pants, earrings, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Alfa se reúne en la capital manabita Portoviejo en las tardes cada 15 días, la señora Gabriela es socia y su actividad es la venta de ropa de puerta a puerta en la ciudadela donde está su domicilio, ella es de la ciudad de GuayaquL se enamoro de su actual esposos y se radicó en Portoviejo hace 4 años, el esposo es manabita se conocieron en Guayaquil  Y trabajaban juntos.

 Su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una  vulcanizadora de  la localidad, y la señora Gabriela se dedica  a su negocio sin descuidar a sus dos hijos; con este nuevo crédito invertirá en mas mercadería,  le tocara viajar a comprar a los distribuidores;  tiene varios pedidos por entregar, deja a crédito a sus clientas, cobra por semana y una vez que reúne lo invertido vuelve a viajara para surtir su stock, como blusas, pantalones para hombres y mujeres, medias, camisas entre otros.
texts.en:
The “Alfa” communal bank meets in Portoviejo, Manabí province capital, every two weeks in the afternoon. Gabriela is a member and she sells clothing door-to-door in her neighborhood. She is originally from Guayaquil but fell in love with her current husband and moved to Portoviejo four years ago; her husband is from Manabí but they met in Guayaquil where they worked together. Her husband works in a local tire shop and Gabriela tends to her business while caring for her two children. She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise. She will need to travel to see the various distributors but she has several pending orders to fill. She leaves goods with her customers on credit; she collects paymets weekly and when she has recovered her investment she travels again to refill her stock with items like: blouses, men’s and women’s pants, hosiery, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For underwear, blouses, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy foam

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Jessica es madre de 4 hijos está formando parte del banco comunal Alfa desde hace 6 ciclos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita.

Casada tiene 1 hijo, 27 años, el esposo es pintor trabaja pintando escuelas, edificios y mas 12 horas diarias, nuestra socia es ejecutiva del hogar pero también tiene su negocio fuera de casa,  vende ropa de una manera informal, compra ropa al por mayor  para damas caballeros y niños; como medias, blusas Y  pantalones; en los actuales momentos está embarazada de 8 meses está a la espera de su segundo bebe pero eso no ha sido impedimento para que ella realiza sus actividades con total normalidad, desde hace 3 años visita  puerta a puerta con su negocio a sus clientas en diferentes localidades de la ciudad;  para poder surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil, le acompaña el esposo; con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir en mas mercadería como lo ha venido realizando, utilizara todo el crédito.

La señora Jessica está muy motivada con el trabajo que sostiene y le está muy agradecida a la Fundación porque ha sido un gran aporte en su diario vivir;  su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa, por ahora vive en un  departamento que la mamá de ella le ha dado para que vivan, ya son 9 años que lleva casada y poco a poco han ido adquiriendo sus cosas; su esposo con su trabajo y mas el de ella están ahorrando para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Jessica, 27, is married and the mother of one child and has been a member of the Alfa communal bank for the last 6 cycles; the bank meets in Portoviejo, Manabí province capital. Her husband works painting schools and buildings, etc. for 12 hours a day. She is a housewife but also has a business outside the home: she is an informal clothing merchant. She buys women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, like hosiery, blouses and pants, at wholesale. She is currently 8 months pregnant, expecting her second child but this hasn’t been an obstacle for her and she continues with her work completely normally. For the last three years she has gone door-to-door seeing her customers in various locations throughout the city. In order to stock her business she must travel to the city of Guayaquil; her husband accompanies her. She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise like she’s been doing to date; she will spend the entire loan amount this way. Jessica is very motivated with the work she does and is very grateful to the Fundación because it’s been of immense help for her daily survival. Her greatest wish is to have her own home because she currently lives in an apartment that her mother has provided for them to live in. She has been married for nine years now and has gradually acquired things. With her husband’s work added to hers they are saving up to make their dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pants, blouses, hosiery, shirts, t-shirts.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen, es una mujer casada D. 62 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 30 a 48 años y vive en el barrio la Unión al sur D. Barranquilla. 
Ella es una mujer muy espiritual y solidaria,  participa en un grupo D. oración en su barrio, donD. con sus vecinas  disfrutan  D.  las celebraciones que hacen a final D. cada año  producto D. los ahorros comunes.

DesD. el año 1986 está dedicada al arte D. la confección D. ropa quirúrgica, inició su trabajo en una clínica como confeccionista quirúrgica, allí fabricaba la ropa D. los pacientes, batas, ropa D. camas y para médicos y personal auxiliar, perfeccionando  su arte porque anteriormente se dedicaba a la confección D. ropa casual para damas y caballeros, en un mercado doméstico entre sus amigos y vecinos. 19 años después fue pensionada y desD. el 2005  continuó trabajando en la costura quirúrgica en forma independiente, como en la actualidad lo hace en su negocio desD. su casa,  sus clientes son laboratorios y centros D. rehabilitación; con su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante muchos proyectos, especialmente lo relacionado con el estudio D. sus 3 hijos y adquirió una casa propia. Como Carmen  requiere comprar  materias primas como telas e insumos quirúrgicos para su producción, está solicitando su cuarto crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque constantemente tiene que afrontar el desafío D. tener efectivo disponible , pues estas instituciones, o sea sus clientes,  pagan sus facturas a 60 días; Con  Fundación  como aliada, ella ha logrado mejorar sus procesos administrativos a través D. capacitaciones a las que ha asistido y también formalizó su negocio desD. que se vinculó  al programa D. legalización y formalización empresarial que en esta organización se lleva a cabo.
texts.en:
Carmen is 62 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 30 and 48. She lives in the neighborhood of La Unión in southern Barranquilla. Carmen is a very spiritual and responsible woman. She participates in a prayer group in which her neighbors enjoy the year-end celebrations that are paid for using their joint savings. Since 1986, Carmen has been manufacturing surgical garments. She began working at a clinic as a surgical clothing seamstress making bed sheets and gowns for patients, doctors, and medical personnel. Carmen perfected her skills through her previous work making casual clothing for women and men from a domestic market where she could catch up with her friends and neighbors. She quit that job after 19 years, but has worked as an independent surgical seamstress since 2005. Carmen currently operates her business out of her home. Her clients incluD. laboratories and rehabilitation centers. Through her business, she accomplished several goals, specifically ones related to the education of her three children and acquiring her own home. Since Carmen needs to buy materials, such as fabric for producing surgical clothes, she is requesting her fourth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she is constantly facing challenges related to cash flow. These institutions that are her clients take up to 60 days to pay for their orders. With the Foundation on her siD., Carmen has been able to improve her business processes as a result of the training classes she has attended. She also was able to formalize her business through a registration and legalization program that the Foundation offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making surgical clothing

loans.name: Lucelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lucelina es socia muy activa del banco comunal Alfa, desde hace 2 ciclos está trabajando con la Fundación con los créditos y su negocio ha ido incrementando.

La señora Lucelina está comprometida,  la actividad que realiza es la venta de pescado por libras,  tiene un puesto en el mercado central  de la  ciudad de Portoviejo compra por gaveta en un puerto pesquero de la provincia de Manabí, este en un sitio donde llegan las embarcaciones y se comercializa el pescado para diferentes partes del país, este negocio lo mantienen el esposo de nuestra socia desde hace 27 años.

 La señora Lucelina se dedica en los momentos que le quedan libre a pintar uñas y desde hace 6 meses a vender productos naturales; ella cuenta con sus clientes fijos que le llaman para hacer los pedidos, por el momento nuestra socia tiene que dejar de salir a recorrer porque se le ha presentado un problema  salud, pero desde su casa estará atendiendo.

  Estos esposos son muy trabajadores,han pensado con este crédito invertir en un nuevo negocio, que seria una mini granja para pollos, sin dejar la venta de  pescado, con una parte del crédito tendrán que invertir en comprar las vitaminas, los alimentos y todo que se necesita para empezar con el negocio.
texts.en:
Lucelina is a very active member of the Alfa communal bank. She has been working with the Foundation for 2 loan cycles and her business has been growing. Lucelina is very involved in her business. She sells fish by the pound. She has a place in the central market in the city of Portoviejo. She buys by the container in a fishing port in the province of Manabí. This is a place where fishing boats dock and sell their fish, destined for different parts of the country. Her husband has been in this business for 27 years. Lucelina works doing manicures in her free time, and for 6 months she has been selling natural products. She has regular customers who call her to place orders. For the moment she has to give up leaving the house to work because she has a health problem, but she will tend to her business from her home. This couple is very hard working. They plan to invest this loan in a new business, which will be a small chicken farm (without abandoning the fish business). With part of the loan they will have to buy vitamins, feed, and everything that they will need to start the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed, medicines

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 44 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flaviana de 45 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Cuando era niño, le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, se fue encargando él solo de las tierras de sus padres, ya que su hermano mayor decidió dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensos campos de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha alverja y papa, para luego venderlos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas de insectos que afectan su producción. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un carro, para que pueda facilitar el transporte de su cosecha a la ciudad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Victor is 44 years old and a cheerful hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Flaviana, age 45, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to provide the best education. As a boy, his parents taught him everything about farming and as time passed he was given the responsibility to take charge of their land when his older brother decided to pursue other activities. Victor now has vast plots of farmland where he grows peas and potatoes, which are later sold at the wholesale market in Tarma. What he enjoys most about his job is cultivating the land since the work helps to feed his family. Victor has been in business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from plagues of insects that impact his production. His greatest wish is to buy a vehicle so that he can easily transport his harvest into the city.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Victor has always been punctual with his payments and hopes to continue to do the same with this loan. In his Communal Bank, he is one of the members who gets along well with the rest of the group. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Victor will buy seeds for planting peas since it is the crop that currently sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting his next crop of peas

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Pilar

texts.es:
Nuestra Socia Mariuxi es Fundadora del banco comunal Alfa que se viene reuniendo desde hace varios años en la ciudad de Portoviejo, la actividad en la que ella trabaja es la venta de productos naturales y medicinales, además trabaja en una boutique es experta en saber dividir el tiempo, con su  negocio ya lleva  6 años, a ella siempre le han gustado el comercio de diferentes productos, lo que la motivó a vender esta clase de productos es porque tiene su propio testimonio; el esposo estaba al filo de la muerte y le recomendaron que los tome y se curo, ahora es un hombre sano y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

 La hija de esta pareja de esposos es la que se encarga de hacerles probar los  productos como aloe, té y batidos a los clientes, en un club que tiene. La señora Mariuxi sale a recorrer para entregar el producto en frascos sellados, con este nuevo crédito la señora Mariuxi podrá invertir en su nuevos productos que tiene por entregar a sus clientes, la manera de vender es  a contado,  con la otra parte del crédito lo compartirá en el negocio que tiene su esposo que es la venta de carne al por mayor, tiene un congelador pero en los actuales momentos se les  a dañado y necesitan  uno nuevo urgente, este negocio del esposó lo ha  mantenido por 23 años.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is the founder of the Alpha Communal Bank which was established several years ago in the city of Portoviejo. She sells natural health products and also works at a boutique, so she is an expert at managing her time. Mariuxi has been in business for six years and has always enjoyed selling different types of products. She began selling health products as a result of her own experience. Her husband was near death and these products were recommended to him to take for its curative properties. Now he is a healthy man and since then her business has done very well.

Her daughter is responsible for preparing products such as aloe, tea, and smoothies for customers who have joined a club that she established. Sra. Mariuxi delivers her products in sealed jars. With this loan, she will invest in new products that she can deliver to her customers. Most of her sales are made on a cash basis, but with some she extends credit. Her husband manages a meat wholesale business. He has a freezer, but at the moment it is not working and he needs to get another one as soon as possible. His business has been operation for 23 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aloe vera & medicinal teas

loans.name: Marsel

texts.es: Marsel, de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora, y vive en su casa propia,  junto con su esposo y  sus 2 hijos pequeños.Con mucha perseverancia, sube y baja los cerros empinados de su distrito, ofreciendo diversas prendas, pues se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, que son muy solicitadas por sus amistades y conocidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es ser cumplida en la entrega de sus pedidos, sólo que a veces no cuenta con dinero suficiente para atender todos sus pedidos, perdiendo así, buenos clientes. Lleva 3 años en esta labor, y  es muy conocida por  la zona donde vive. Con este negocio, y junto al esfuerzo de su esposo, han construido su casa,  y en la actualidad  planean  contar con electricidad,  pues  piensa mejorar  la condición de vida de su familia.Es el primer crédito de  Marsel con MFP, y  se compromete a pagar oportunamente sus cuotas pues esta muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todos los integrantes  trabajan responsablemente.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  la compra de mercadería, además pagará la  instalación de  una caja eléctrica en su casa, pues necesita contar con este  servicio básico en su hogar.
texts.en:
Marsel is 34 years old and a hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. With great perseverance, she travels up and down the steep hills in her district selling various types of clothing that are requested by friends and acquaintances. What she enjoys most about her job is fulfilling and delivering her orders, but sometimes she does not have enough money to complete all of them. As a result, she has lost good customers. Marsel has been in business for three years and is well-known in the area where she lives. With her income, together with that of her husband, she was able to build a house and is now looking forward to receiving electricity which will help improve her family’s living conditions.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marsel promises to submit her payments promptly because she is happy with the work of her group. All of the members work responsibly. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of merchandise. Marsel will also pay for the installation of an electrical box in her house, which she needs in order to receive electricity service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & pay for the installation of an electrical box in her house

loans.name: Angela Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Ángela de 34 años de edad es casada tiene  4 hijos ella dedica gran parte de su tiempo  a su casa y también a su negocio, es lo que llena su vida, siente que eso la hace importante y útil, Ángela tiene un negocio de ropa, vende blusas, pantalones, es un negocio que le gusta mucho,  lleva 2 años con su negocio de ropa, esta ubicado en su casa ella tiene sus clientes fijos que le hacen  los pedidos lo que más le piden es pantalones su mercadería la compra cada mes y la inversión depende de la demanda que tenga su producto.

Las compras para fortalecer su negocio las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil con este crédito hará  compras para surtir su negocio, también la inversión  depende del efectivo con el que cuente,  su esposo trabaja en la pesca  viaja en barco , cuenta que su esposo es muy responsable, y cada viaje que hace para pescar lo hace seguro de que su sacrificio es por el bien de la familia, ella sufre mucho cuando su esposo tiene que salir, el mar guarda muchos secretos y peligros, Ángela siempre ruega a Dios proteja a su esposo e hijos.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su casa, es una de las pocas cosas que faltan para sentirse más a gusto con la vida que tiene, sabe que parte de su estabilidad laboral se la debe a la Fundación Espoir.
texts.en:
Sra. Ángela is 34 years old, married, and has four children. Even though she spends most of her time at home, she also has a business to fill the rest of her life since it helps her feel important and useful. Ángela sells clothes, such as blouses and trousers, and enjoys this business very much. She has been selling clothes for two years and operates her business from home. Ángela has several established customers who place their orders with her. Most of what they order are trousers, so she has to buy merchandise every month based on the demand for each product.

Ángela buys her merchandise in the city of Guayaquil in order to strengthen her business, so she will use this loan to buy additional inventory based on her existing orders. Her husband works on a fishing boat and is very responsible. Each fishing trip is a sacrifice that is made for the good of the family, but it still pains her whenever her husband has to leave. The sea holds many secrets and dangers, so Ángela always prays to God to protect her husband and children.

Her greatest dream is to improve her home since there are still a few things missing to make the living conditions more comfortable. Ángela knows that part of her job security is attributed to the support she receives from Fundación ESPOIR.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for women & men

loans.name: Aura Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Aura tiene  22 años de edad , es casada tiene 1 hijo,  ella es ama de casa, un ama de casa muy dedicada su familia, pero que también se dedica a un negocio que sabe que le reporta beneficios económicos para salir adelante con su familia,  tiene un negocio de ropa que normalmente ocupa su tiempo, pero no desmaya en seguir adelante, por eso dedica tiempo para todo lo que ama, su familia, su trabajo, su casa y para ella misma, Aura vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil en cada compra que realiza invierte 500 dólares su forma de vender es dejar a crédito, cada semana un día especifico  sale a cobrar,  lleva 5 años en su negocio,  su esposo se dedica a lavar carros, labor que realiza por mucho tiempo, el también sabe que sus sacrificios son por el bien de la familia,  ellos son de Montecristi,  su felicidad esta remontada en esa ciudad, la ciudad del viejo luchador.( Eloy Alfaro)

 Para Aura el mayor sueño es seguir y seguir sin desmayar  con su negocio, sabe que trabajando y esforzándose conseguirá lo que tanto ansia, confía en la Fundación Espoir, por eso no se rinde en el trabajo, lo único que quiere es seguir trabajando por hacer realidad su sueño y brindar días mejores a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura is 22 years old, married, and has a son. She is a homemaker who is dedicated to her family, but also has a business that helps benefit her family financially so that they can move forward. Aura has no reservations about selling clothing in order to get ahead. She does everything with love, whether it be her family or her work, and treats everything the same.
