Aura sells clothing for women, men, and children. She buys her inventory in the city of Guayaquil and invests 500 dollars on each trip. Aura extends credit to generate sales and sets aside a specific day of the week for collecting payments. She has been in business for five years. Her husband has a job washing cars, which takes up much of his time. He knows that these sacrifices are for the good of the family. They are both from Montecristí. They fell in love in this city, which is known as the “City of the Old Warrior” (the nickname for one of Ecuador’s Presidents, Eloy Alfaro).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Julia tiene 48 años es casada tiene hijos, son una familia muy unida, por eso aparte de compartir ese sagrado amor familiar, Julia también  junto a su  familia  comparten un negocio,que tiene por algún tiempo, y que ha ayudado para que todos sigan adelante; ellos se dedican a la venta  de ropa,  venden blusas, pantalones y demás prendas de vestir;  sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo, sabe que hay ciertos lugares donde venden ropa de buena calidad, y ella ofrece eso a sus clientes, ropa de buena calidad para que ellos y ellas estén satisfechos.

 
Esta familia lleva con este negocio desde que ella ingreso a la Fundación Espoir, Aura  junto a su cuñada venden la mercadería,  cada mes hace sus compras.
Su esposo es albañil, dedicado y responsable en su hogar y trabajo, por eso su vida matrimonial ha sido positiva, los dos entregan todo de sí para seguir adelante, sobre todo su dedicación al trabajo y a la familia.

Su mayor sueño es poder seguir trabajando, para seguir aportando en su hogar, económica y amorosamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 48 years old and married with children. Her family is very close, so sharing is more sacred than family love. Julia and her family have been working together in business for some time and help each other so that they can succeed. They sell clothing such as blouses, trousers, and other types of garments. Their merchandise is sold in the city of Portoviejo. Certain areas are known for selling good quality clothing, so she goes to these places to offer goods to her customers. They are satisfied because they know the clothing they buy is of good quality.

Julia’s family started their business after she joined Fundación ESPOIR. Together with her sister-in-law, she sells merchandise and buys inventory every month. Her husband works as a bricklayer and is dedicated and responsible at home and at work. For this reason, married life has been positive. The two of them give their all in order to move forward and are extremely dedicated to their work and family.

Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can have a home that is both loving and financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, and pajamas

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  María del Carmen es viuda , pero esto no le ha impedido ser una mujer luchadora y forjadora, Y  quiere brindar un gran futuro a sus hijos, sabe que poco a poco se consiguen las cosas,   ella se dedica  a su casa y a sus 6 hijos, y adicionalmente  a  vender  frutas,  este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de alquiler, ahí  vende frutos de la costa  como guineo, naranjas, mandarinas, mangos,  el dinero que solicita es para invertir en su negocio, sus compras Las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en el mercado numero 2, María del Carmen  invierte de 200 a 300 dólares, aparte de la inversión por cada compra  tiene que pagar el carro que le transporta sus frutos, cada semana o quince días compra frutas frescas y  tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, lo que más vende es el mango , mandarina, naranjas, su negocio lo atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Desde que quedo viuda, ella tiene un solo objetivo, que ahora se podría deducir en su sueño, pero que con los años seguramente se realizara, su sueño  es poder tener su casa propia, para que sus hijos tengan un futuro,  que estudien para que algún día le puedan ayudar, son lo único que tiene. Sus hijos son su razón de vivir y la Fundación Espoir su esperanza para seguir trabajando con orgullo.
texts.en:
Sra. María del Carmen is a widow, but her circumstances have not prevented her from pressing forward and persevering. She wants to provide a great future for her children and knows how to gradually obtain the things that she needs. María is dedicated to her home and her six children. From the house that she rents, María sells fruits such as bananas, oranges, tangerines, and mangoes. The money that she requested will be invested in her business. She buys her inventory at the Number Two Market in the city of Portoviejo. María spends between $200 to $300 per trip and also pays to have the fruit transported by car. She buys fruit either weekly or every fifteen days and experiences high demand from her customers. The products that she sells most are mangoes, tangerines, and oranges. Her business is in operation from 7am until 8pm.

Since becoming a widow, María’s only goal is to have her own home. She has been dreaming about this moment for many years in hopes that her children will have a future and consider someday helping her since they are all that she has. Her children continue to be her reason for living and Fundación ESPOIR has given her hope to continue working with pride.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, tangerines, and mangoes

loans.name: Maria Luz Del Alva

texts.es:
La señora María es casada tiene 3 hijos ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, vende ropa como blusa, pantalones,etc; sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo su forma de vender es a crédito,  invierte 200 dólares,  según lo que cobre por semana,  su esposo es albañil trabaja en la ciudad de Manta.

María es nacida en la provincia de Esmeraldas pero desde muy pequeña se crio en Montecristi, tiene  su vida en la provincia de Manabí, provincia a la que ama,  sus padres fallecieron hace mucho tiempo, ella solo estudio la primaria; decidió quedarse en Montecristi por que se enamoro y así realizo su vida, al lado de un hombre que es su felicidad, el padre de sus hijos.

El sueño de María es poder tener su propio almacén y seguir con su familia, el trabajo y su familia son el complemento perfecto  en la vida y no los cambiaría por nada, agradece a la Fundación Espoir ser parte importante de ese equilibrio en su vida. Porque sin su trabajo no podría salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. María is married and has three children. She works as a street vendor selling clothes such as blouses, trousers, and other items. María buys her inventory in the city of Portoviejo. Her sales are made on credit, amounting to $200 each week. María’s husband is a bricklayer and works in the city of Manta.

María was born in Esmeraldas Province, but grew up in Montecristi. She now lives in Manabí, the province she loves. Her parents died a long time ago, so she was only able to complete elementary school. She decided to stay in Montecristi and eventually fell in love with the man who makes her happy and is the father of her children.

María’s dream is to have her own store and continue to raise her family. Her work and her family are the perfect complement in life and she does not want to change anything. She thanks Fundación ESPOIR for being an important part in helping her find balance in her life because without her work, she would not be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and pajamas

loans.name: Roxana Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Roxana P. tiene 23 años es felizmente  casada,  ella orgullosamente cuenta,  que su esposo es un buen hombre, que la ama y es muy dedicado al trabajo, a ella y a su hijo,   un solo hijo producto de aquella bendita relación, sin dudar su hijo y esposo son todo para ella.
Roxana  se dedica a cocinar, otra de sus actividades que le representa ingresos  es el  vender cosas de plásticos  como baldes tinas, vasos, es tan responsable que también dedica parte de su tiempo a vender ropa.

 Ella vive con su mamá,  su esposo es albañil trabaja en Manta de lunes a sábado, los días que ella sale a vender son los días sábados y domingo, deja a crédito y  cada ocho días sale a cobrar.

Para esta joven mujer su sueño es tener su casa, ahora mas con la ilusión de un segundo hijo, su vida sigue siendo bendecida,  ella está embarazada y tendrá una niña, por eso sueña con tener su casa propia, y  ver crecer felices a sus hijos, sabe que lo lograra gracias a sus esfuerzos y a los de su esposo, también al gran apoyo que recibe de parte de la Fundación Espoir.
texts.en:
Sra. Roxana P. is 23 years old and happily married. She is proud that she married a good man who loves her and is dedicated to his work and family. They have a son that resulted from their blessed relationship. Without a doubt, her husband and her son mean everything to her.

Roxana works as a cook, but she also earns income selling plastic products such as buckets, basins, and cups. She is so responsible that she also spends part of her time selling clothes.

Roxana lives with her mother. Her husband is a bricklayer and works in Manta from Monday to Saturday. The days she sells her products are Saturdays and Sundays. She extends credit for an eight day period before collecting payment.

For this young woman, her dream is to own a home. Now that she is expecting her second child, her life continues to be blessed. She hopes her next child will be a girl and dreams of having a house where her children can grow up happily. Roxana knows that if she and her husband work hard, they can achieve their goal. She also relies on the great support from Fundación ESPOIR.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buckets, basins, and cups

loans.name: Bella Aurora

texts.es:
Tiene 60 años, casada y  5 hijos. Trabaja 10 años de cocinera en una quinta, es jefa del área de cocina; también  se dedica una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa en la ciudadela nuevo paraíso de la parroquia nuevo colon, es de Chone y  vive en Portoviejo hace 30 años, tiene casa propia; su esposo trabaja en la quinta de su hermana en varios oficios y le va muy bien.Compra jabón y azúcar al por mayor.

 Tiene 6 nietos y   todo el dinero que se gana es para ayudar a  sus nietos, que se los dejo un hijo que se fue a vivir a España y nunca mas regreso.

  Vende también útiles de escuela, se dedica a tratar las piscinas del negocio es de su hermana, una quinta recreacional.

Lo que le queda de vida quiere dedicarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Bella is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She has worked ten years as a cook at a boarding house, where she heads up the kitchen. Bella also operates a small grocery store out of her home in the city of Nuevo Paraíso in Nuevo Colon Parish. She is from Chone, but has been living in Portoviejo for the past 30 years and owns a home there. Her husband performs various jobs at her sister’s boarding house and is doing very well. She will buy soap and sugar in bulk.

Bella has six grandchildren and all the money she earns goes toward helping them. One of her children moved to Spain and has never returned. She also sells school supplies and maintains the swimming pools at her sister’s business, since it is a recreational boarding house.

She wants to remain devoted to her family for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Jessenia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Jessenia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, pero también tiene junto a al esposo una lubricadora, el se encarga de administrar el negocio, 8 años trabaja en una empresa privada, invierte por semana todo, lubricante, liquido de freno,y repuestos para carros, en su casa tiene un pequeño local, cerca de ellos hay una mecánica eso le ayuda mucho para que en el negocio le vaya bien.

 Quiere incrementar su negoción con baterías y llantas, y en el futuro le gustaría tener el local mas amplio en el centro de la ciudad, en la casa de sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo,
y su esposo a la lubricadora, con el crédito quiere invertir en aceite para carros, liquido de frenos, en especial repuestos para carros, quieren surtir bien su negocio.

Tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad. Y lleva casada 15 años.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessenia sells beauty products through catalogs, but she and her husband also own an oil change station where she is responsible for managing the business. They have owned their business for eight years. Every week they invest in lubricants, brake fluid, and spare parts for automobiles. They operate their small business out of their home, which is located near a mechanic, so this helps them to do well.

Jessenia wants to expand her business by offering batteries and tires. In the future, she would like to move to a larger location in the central part of the city at her parents’ house. With this loan, she will invest in motor oil, brake fluid, and custom automobile parts so that she can keep her business well-stocked. She and her husband have two children (ages 12 and 13) and have been married for 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil, brake fluid, and custom automobile parts

loans.name: Estrella Natividad

texts.es:
El banco comunal Los Gemelos se reúne en la ciudadela del mismo nombre en las afueras de la ciudad d Portoviejo en la parroquia el Guabito.

Se Dedica a la venta por catalogó de productos de belleza, alhajas brasilera y una tienda de productos de varios que tiene en su casa,   hace 10 años quien la motivo con una cola fue su  mamá le dio una botella y de a poco fue comprando mas hasta que ahora tiene 4 jabas de colas.

 Tiene 5 años en el banco esta casada tiene 3 hijos vive en una parroquia urbana; compra en una distribuidora a precio de negocio, gana el 25 % de ganancias, tiene una refrigeradora para sus colas, aguas y jugos, sus clientas son por el sector donde ella vive.

 Su esposo es empleado publico, tiene su propia casa, tiene 45 años, quiere invertir en cosas para la tienda y surtir el negocio, le gustaría tener un negocio mas grande, completo una tiene con todo,  una vitrina con varios productos de bazar,  invertir según lo que se vaya vendiendo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Gemelos” (The Twins) gathers in the area of the same name and is located on the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo in Guabito Parish.

Estrella sells beauty products through catalogs, Brazilian jewelry, and also manages a store in her home where she offers a variety of products. She started her business ten years ago when her mother challenged her by giving her a bottle of cola to sell. Gradually she began buying more and now sells four cases of soft drinks at a time.

Estrella has been a member of her Communal Bank for five years. She is married, has three children, and lives in an urban parish. In her business, she receives distributor prices and achieves a profit margin of 25%. Estrella has a refrigerator for storing colas, water, and juices. Her customers come from the same area where she lives.

Her husband is 45 years old and works as a public employee. They have their own home. Estrella wants to invest in items for her store so that her business remains stocked. She would like to have a larger business that has everything, including a display case containing different products found in a bazaar. Her plans include investing in items according to what is sold.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase colas, water, rice, sugar, milk, and flour

loans.name: Estrella Margarita

texts.es:
Del banco  comunal Alfa es socia la señora Margarita está pasando por momentos bastante crítico ha sufrido la pedida de dos seres queridos para ella, hace un mes perdió a su hijo y su mamá, está muy triste pero a pesar de todo lo que está pasando nuestra socia tiene que seguir luchando por sus otros hijos.

La actividad que realiza la señora Margarita es el comercio de ropa de prendas intimas, ya son 3 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien, está casada, su esposo es técnico en refrigeración, ella sale a vender  su mercadería por el sector y cuando el esposo esta libre le acompaña.

 El crédito que recibe en la Fundación lo invierte en surtir su stock de prendas como bóxer, medias, tangas y más.  Nuestra socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar a los mayoristas para poder obtener mejores ganancias, nos ha comentado que su negocio en este último mes ha bajado porque ella lo descuido con todos los problemas que ha tenido que enfrentar,  pero ella está convencida que lo retomara con muchas fuerzas y le ira muy bien acotó con una sonrisa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Alfa communal bank. She is going through a pretty devastating period due to the loss of two loved ones: she lost both her son and her mother a month ago. She is very sad but despite all she has to continue on for her other children. Margarita sells intimate wear. She has been in this line of work for three years now and does very well. She’s married and her husband is a refrigeration technician. She goes out to sell door-to-door in her area and when her husband is free he goes with her. She will use the funds she gets from the Fundación to buy stock items like: boxer shorts, hosiery, thongs and other items. She travels all the way to Guayaquil to buy from wholesalers so that she can get better profits. She tells us that business has fallen off a bit this last month because all the problems she’s had to face have caused her to neglect it a bit. However, she’s sure that she will retake it firmly and do well, she added with a smile.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brassieres, boxer shorts, thongs, hosiery.

loans.name: Blanca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, es licenciada de enfermería, trabaja todos los días, en sus ratos libres  se dedica ala costura,  hace camisetas, pijamas; toda la vida le ha gustado la  costura, es profesional en bolsos, y tomo  cursos de artesanía.

 Sale a las ferias de cada pueblo, los fines de semana y lleva su mercadería, y le va muy bien. Ella compra las telas a los distribuidores, las que tiene falla para que le salgan mas baratas, y  se las ingenia para que le salga  bien hecha; hace una docena de blusas hasta las 11 de la noche, y en el día se dedica al hospital, donde hace turnos con sus compañeros.

 Nació en Quito, vino a vivir en Manabí desde hace varios años, su es esposo es de profesión joyero. El sueño de ella es viajar a otros países, se graduó de licenciada en enfermería, le gusta hacer de todo en costura y artesanía, cuando tiene tiempo libre se dedica a las ferias, en esta época del año están bajas las ventas; por semana hace una docena de blusas y una docena de interiores, depende de los   turnos; hay días que trabaja toda la noche, y al día siguiente esta libre.

Esta radicada aquí 22 años, y en su casa tiene el taller de joyas su esposo .
texts.en:
She’s 50 years old and has 5 children. She has a nursing degree and works every day. In her spare time she is a seamstress; she makes shirts and pajamas. She has enjoyed sewing all her life. Her purses are professional and she has taken crafts courses. On weekends she goes to the various town markets to sell her wares and does quite well. She buys fabric from distributors, usually the irregular or imperfect ones so they are less expensive, and figures out how to make the items so that they are well-made. She makes a dozen blouses until 11 at night and during the day she works in the hospital where she works shifts with her coworkers. She was born in Quito but came to live in Manabí several years ago; her husband is a jeweler. Her dream is to travel to other countries. She graduated with a degree in nursing and enjoys all kinds of sewing and crafts. When she has free time she goes to the markets; this time of the year sales are low. In a week’s time she can make a dozen blouses and a dozen shells depending on her work shifts; sometimes she works all night and has the next day off. She has resided here for 22 years and her husband’s jewelry workshop is in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric, buttons, zippers.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es una excelente socia del banco comunal Dulce Amistad que se reúnen en un bello cantón que es reconocido por propios y extraños como el mas dulce de todos, aquí es donde se preparan los mas deliciosos dulces en diferentes sabores y colores, además es una tierra bendita muy productiva para sembrar arroz estamos hablando de Rocafuerte en la provincia de Manabí.

Nuestra socia es una profesional en administración de empresa, por ello a decido tener su propio negocio que consiste en la venta de maquinarias para el agro, el esposo es el que se encarga de llevar a los clientes las maquinas, pero el trabajo de nuestra socia no termina ahí, junto a su hermana han decidió abrir un restáurate en su propia casa han tenido que hacer unos arreglos y acondicionar el lugar para brindarles una mayor comodidad a los posibles clientes, aun no se ha inaugurado pero con este nuevo  crédito que recibirá nuestra socia terminara de hacer los arreglos del lugar y adquirirá sillas y mesas.

La señora Angélica ya tiene definido como administrar su negocio, solo atenderá con almuerzos y en la tarde comida rápida como hot dog, hamburguesa y fritada( plato típico ecuatoriano echo con carne de cerdo);  nuestra socia esta muy animada y tiene la certeza que todo le ira muy bien.
texts.en:
Angélica is an excellent member of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) communal bank which meets in a beautiful canton that is known by residents and visitors alike as the sweetest of them all. This is where the most delicious candies of different flavors and colors are made. It is also a very blessed land for rice cultivation. We are referring to Rocafuerte, Manabí province. Our member is a professional in the business administration field. She decided to have a business of her own which consists in agriculture machinery. Her husband brings customers for the machines but our member’s work isn’t over there. Together with her sister she decided to open a restaurant in her home. She has had to make some alterations to the place and equip it to provide more comfort to her diners. It hasn’t opened yet but this new loan will allow her to finish the last details: she will be able to buy tables and chairs. Angélica has already determined how the business will be run. She will open only for lunch but then will provide fast food, like hot-dogs, hamburgers, and “fritada” (a typical Ecuadorean dish made with pork) in the afternoon and early evening. She is very excited about this and sure that everything will turn out well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tables, chairs, tablecloths, cutlery, drinking glasses, plates, kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Diana Marina

texts.es:
La señora Diana es una madre soltera de 27 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Dulce Amistad en el cantón Rocafuerte desde hace 4 ciclos,  nuestra socia tiene como actividad un Karaoke en la misma localidad, ya son dos años que está dedicada a su negocio es una mujer independiente de sus padres pese a que es madre soltera ha sabido desenvolverse sola en la vida con su hija de 4 añitos, lo que la motiva a Diana a invertir en este tipo de negocio es que en la localidad no lo había y se mantiene como el único sitio de esta clase para distraerse.

La señora Diana es una persona muy responsable en lo que hace hasta ahora no ha tenido inconveniente alguno con los pagos a la fundación, con los créditos que ha recibido ha ido incrementando su negocio como en sillas, meza, congelador, computadora, mescladora, micrófono, y bebidas, aparte del Karaoke nuestra socia es dueña de un pequeño restaurante donde solo vende almuerzos  de lunes a viernes, y el fin de semana en las noches abre el karaoke, la acompañan a trabajar dos personas que ha contratado, ella nos comentó que la venta de bebidas son altas de 30 a 35 jabas y con el crédito que recibe podrá invertir en ellas y pagar los permisos de funcionamiento del local.
 
Diana es de licenciada en ciencia de la educación además ejercía de psicóloga orientadora de una escuela,  pero al ver que no le sale ningún trabajo sigue con su negocio sin parar, el sueño de ella es poder regresar a dar clases le gusta mucho su profesión, pero no le gustaría cerrar su negocio eso le ayuda mucho económicamente.
texts.en:
Diana, 27, is a single mother and has been a member of Rocafuerte canton’s Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) communal bank for 4 cycles. She’s had a karaoke bar in town for the past two years. Despite being a single mother, she’s independent of her parents and has been her 4-year-old daughter’s sole source of support. This motivates Diana to invest in this business because there is no other like it in town and it is the only place where people can go for amusement. Diana is a very responsible person and to date has had no problem repaying her loans to the foundation. She has used prior loans to provide her business with chairs, tables, a freezer, a computer, a sound mixer, microphone and beverages. Besides the karaoke, she’s also owner of a small eatery where she sells lunches Monday through Friday. On weekends she opens the karaoke bar and she hires two employees to help her. She tells us that beverage sales are very high, between 30-35 cases. She will use the funds to buy them as well as for the locale’s operation permit. Diana is a graduate in Education and also worked as a school psychologist but, since no jobs in her area are forthcoming, she continues non-stop with her business. Her dream is to return to teaching because she likes her profession very much but she wouldn’t like to close her business because it helps her a lot economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cases of Colas.

loans.name: Pastora Dolores

texts.es:
Las señora Dolores forma parte del banco comunal Dulce Amista nos abrió su corazón para conocer más de ella, es casada madre de 2 niños, en los actuales momentos su actividad es la venta de víveres en una  pequeña tienda que tiene en su domicilio, ya lleva 3 meses en esta nueva actividad, Dolores solo se dedicaba ser ama de casa y  al cuidado de sus hijos pero al ver que la situación económica de la familia no andaba bien decide poner un negocio, cuenta nuestra socia que le va muy bien, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar más productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y demás víveres para ver mas surtida su tienda.

El esposo de la señora Dolores es mecánico trabaja desde hace 3 años en un taller de carros de propiedad del hermano, cuando la señora Dolores empezó en su tienda lo hizo invirtiendo200 dólares y poco a poco fue aumentando su capital, ya creció más su tienda cuando empezó a trabajar con los créditos de la Fundación y ahora se siente muy feliz con su negocio tanto así que no piensa en cambiarlo, quiere seguir surtiendolo con carnes y diferentes marcas de bebida..
texts.en:
Dolores is part of the community bank Dulce Amista and has opened her heart to us to help us get to know her. She is a married mother of 2 children. She currently sells supplies in a small shop in her home—she has already been doing this new activity for three months. Previously, she worked solely as a housewife and caretaker for her children, but in light of her family's difficult economic situation she decided to open a business. Dolores tells us that it is doing very well, and with this loan she will be able to invest in more products such as rice, sugar, oil and other supplies to increase her store's selection. Her husband is a mechanic and has worked for three years in his brother's garage. When Dolores opened her store, he invested 200 dollars and bit by bit it has grown. When Dolores started working with credit from the Fundacion the store grew further, and she is now so happy with her business that she will not consider changing it. She wants to continue stocking it with meats and different brands of drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat, rice, sugar, oil, colas, juices, liquor

loans.name: Filerma Narciza

texts.es:
Filerma se considera una gran socia responsable del banco comunal Dulce Amistad que se reúne desde hace varios ciclos en el cantón Rocafuerte en la productiva y fructífera costa manabita, nuestra socia tiene como actividad confeccionar ropa para todas las edades.

La señora Filerma viene ejerciendo la profesión de modista desde hace 30 años para ello se preparó en varios cursos que se han dictado en el sector donde vive, para poner en practica lo aprendido estuvo por varios meses trabajando en un taller de creaciones donde solo trabajó con materiales de felpa para realizar manualidades, esto le sirvió de mucho para poder dedicarse de lleno a la costura y hacer de ella su sustento.

En los actuales momentos la señora Filerma esta muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene que dedicarle mucho tiempo porque la demanda es alta, se dedica a confeccionar licras, pijamas y ropa deportiva, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar telas y todo lo necesario para coser, tiene que trasladarse hasta la capital manabita Portoviejo a realizar las comprar donde están los grandes almacenes con todas la novedades y de esta manera seguir con éxito en su labor y no quedar mal en los pagos de la Fundación.
texts.en:
Filerma is considered a great and responsible member of the communal bank Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship). She has attended since a few loan cycles ago in the Rocafuerte canton in the productive and fruitful Manabita coast. Our member makes clothes for all ages. Filerma has been in the profession of clothes making since 30 years ago. She prepared for this in various courses in the area where she lives. To put in practice what she learned she worked for a few months in a tailoring workshop where she worked with plush to make handicrafts. This served her greatly to be able to dedicate herself fully to sewing and use it to make her living. Currently, Filerma is very dedicated to her work. She has dedicated a lot of time to it as the demand is high. She focuses on making Lycras, pajamas, and sportswear. With this new credit, she could invest in buying fabrics and everything necessary to sew. She will have to move to the capital of Manabita, Portoviejo, to be able to buy where there are large warehouses, and in this way successfully continue in her work and not default in the payments to the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloths, zippers, buttons, and thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Y Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujres Organizadas y Activas” se formó con la unión varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, fotografía, cotillón y preparación de comidas rápidas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
 Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
Una de  las madres es la señora Virginia, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería confeccionadas por ella.
Sus confecciones son muy solicitados por la buena calidad de sus productos y por ello quiere aumentar la cantidad confeccionada, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de encajes en carios colores, gomas, telas de sedas y licras.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Organizadas y Activas” ("Organized and Active Women") group was formed when various neighbors joined forces. All of the members make a living independently, for instance in sales, photography, party supplies or food preparation. They formed a united group very capable of working together for everyone's benefit. All of the group members are mothers who dedicate themselves to their work with the goal of strengthening their household finances. One of these mothers is Virginia, who makes a living selling lingerie that she makes herself. Her items are highly sought-after because of their high quality, and for this reason she wants to increase the quantity she produces. She is requesting the loan to purchase lace in various colors, elastic, silk fabrics and spandex.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Genny Dinora

texts.es:
La actividad de nuestra socia Jenny es preparar dulces y comida para fiestas, ella pertenece al banco comunal Dulce Amistad en el cantón Rocafuerte en la zona norte de la provincias de Manabí, la señora Jenny tiene 49 años de edad con tres hijos dos de ellos ya son jóvenes, a pesar que tiene una profesión de repostera ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa desde hace 6 años y se encarga de atender a sus clientes, con los créditos que ha recibido en la Fundación ha podido invertir para surtir su tienda.

El esposo de la señora Jenny trabaja en la Municipalidad del Cantón, ya llevan 29 años de casados son felices al tener una gran familia, la actividad de repostera la aprendió solo viendo, lleva cinco años preparando estas delicias de dulces, mientras que su hija es la encargada de atender la tienda cuando la señora Jenny se encarga de entregar los dulces a las dulcerías y tiendas de la localidad.

Con este nuevo crédito que recibe nuestra socia podrá invertir en el material para preparar mas dulces como el azúcar, los colorantes, harina y mas, al igual que utilizara parte del crédito en surtir su tienda de  víveres, cuenta la señora Jenny que le va muy bien en todo lo que viene realizando. Le gustaría reunir un dinero y completar para comprarse un congelador que le esta haciendo falta para su tienda; considera un gran sueño ver realizados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Our member Jenny makes sweets and food for parties. She belongs to the communal bank Dulce Amistad in the Rocafuerte canton in the northern part of the Manabi provinces. Jenny is 49 years old and has 3 children, two of whom are already young adults. Although she is a pastry chef she also has a small general store in her home where she has been serving customers for 6 years. With the loans that she has received from the Foundation she has been able to invest in stocking her store. Jenny's husband works in for the municipality. They have been married for 29 years and are happy to have a great family. She learned to make pastries just by watching. She has been making these delicious sweets for 5 years. Her daughter is in charge of taking care of the store when Jenny takes the sweets to the pastry shops and stores in town. With this new loan, Jenny will be able to purchase ingredients to make more sweets, such as sugar, food coloring, flour, etc. as well as to stock her shop. Jenny says that her business is going very well. She would like to save a bit of money to purchase a freezer for her store. Her greatest dream is to see her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour, sugar, food coloring, oil, eggs, milk

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es una de la socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad en el cantón Rocafuerte en la provincia de Manabí  ya lleva 4 ciclos como socia se dedica al comercio tiene un almacén de artefactos para el hogar, ropa  deportiva y una tienda de víveres, la encargada de administrar los negocios es su hija, debido a que la señora Josefa ejerce su profesión de maestra en una pequeña localidad llamada San Roque en la misma provincia de Manabí
.
Nuestra socia desde hace 3 años se vino a radicar desde Pedernales a Rocafuerte ya son 25 años que brinda sus conocimientos como maestra en las meterías de Ciencias Naturales Estudios Sociales tiene que viajar todos los días hasta su trabajo, los fines de semana se encarga por entero a sus negocios, le va muy bien.

Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia Josefa podrá invertir todo en sus negocios, viaja su hija hasta la capital manabita para realizar las compras de las telas, elástico, hilos, y todo lo necesario para confeccionar los uniformes ,y por otra parte el yerno se encarga de los víveres y electrodomésticos, el oficio de confeccionar ropa lo aprendieron en cursos que se dictaban en la localidad y decidieron poner su propio taller de ropa, todos hacen de todo nadie se encasilla en una sola cosa enfatizo.

La señora Josefa nos comentó que durante estos cuatros ciclos que lleva como socia del banco comunal le ha ido muy bien porque gracias a los créditos recibidos ha podido ir incrementando sus negocios, el sueño para ella es que su hija termine su universidad y se gradué de economista.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the Communal Bank Dulce Amistad in the Rocafuerte canton of the Manabí province. She has been a member for 4 loan cycles. She is a businesswoman and has a shop that sells housewares and athletic clothing. She also has a small grocery store. Her daughter is in charge of managing the businesses, since Josefa is a teacher in the small town of San Roque, also in the Manabí province. Three years ago Josefa moved to Rocafuerte from Pedernales. She has been sharing her knowledge as a teacher in science and social studies for 25 years. She has to travel every day to her job. On the weekends she is totally dedicated to her businesses, which are going well. Josefa will invest this entire loan in her businesses. She travels with her daughter to the capital Manabita to purchase fabric, elastic bands, threads, and everything necessary to make uniforms, and her son in law is in charge of the groceries and household appliances. She learned to sew in courses that were given in her town and she decided to open her own tailoring business. Everyone does everything; nobody is limited to only one thing. Josefa told us that the four cycles that she has been with the communal bank have gone very well because thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to grow her businesses. Her dream is for her daughter to finish college and graduate with a degree in economics.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, thread, elastic bands, bottons, fasteners

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Dulce Amistad, ubicado en el cantón Rocafuerte a media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, en esta bella localidad contamos con la producción de arroz y con los mas deliciosos dulces de la región, nuestra socia es madre de dos niños, casada desde hace 8 años, a sus 25 años se siente muy feliz con la actividad que realiza, ella es dueña de la venta de joyas de plata, se dedica a su negocio de dos a tres veces por semana y el resto del tiempo es madre a tiempo completo, la mayoría de sus clientas la buscan en casa cuando necesitan alguna de sus joyas como regalo para sus compromisos, hay un día a la semana que la señora María viaja a 20 minutos a su tierra natal que es Charapoto ahí tiene muchos clientes fijos.

La señora María con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo el capital en mas joyas, hay una persona que le trae directamente desde Cuenca y le vende al contado, ya lleva un año y medio con sus ventas y le ha ido muy bien, cada tres meses renueva su mercadería e invierte de 200 a 300 dólares, con las ganancias que ha obtenido ha podido ayudar al esposo en casa ya que no es mucho lo que el gana como técnico de  equipos de música de disco móviles y orquestas, y es una gran ayuda para sus hijos siendo el mayor sueño de nuestra socia es ver a sus hijos realizados.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) Community Bank located in the community of Rocafuerte, a half hour from the city of Portoviejo. This beautiful spot is known for its rice production along with having the most delicious sweets in the region. María is a mother of two children and has been married for the past eight years. She has been happy with what she has accomplished in her 25 years. She is the owner of silver jewelry business to which she dedicates herself two to three times a week, and the rest of her time she spends as a full-time mother. The majority of her customers visit her at her home when they need some piece of jewelry for their loved ones. One day a week María travels 20 minutes to her native town of Charapoto, where she has many established customers. With this new loan, María plans to invest all of the capital into more jewelry. There's a person who brings it directly from the city of Cuenca and sells the items for cash. María has a year and a half of experience in this work and it has gone very well. Every three months she renews her merchandise and invests $200 to $300, and with the profits she has made she has been able to help her husband with household expenses since he doesn't earn a lot as a mobile music technician. It is a big help to her children, and María's biggest dream is for her children to become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver rings, necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Jenny Annabelle

texts.es:
El banco comunal 22 de Julio se reúne en la parroquia de Picoaza, es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en diferentes ramas, como la venta de productos de material plástico, ropa, accesorios de teléfonos y muchos mas, los habitantes de esta bella parroquia se caracterizan por ser hombres y mujeres de grandes tradiciones y costumbres.

La señora Jenny  tiene  su hogar, el esposo se dedica al comercio ambulante de dulces, se caso cuando apenas tenia 18 años, ahora a sus 20 años ya es madre de un niño, con gran responsabilidad ha tomado el hecho de ser madre y es por ellos que se ha dedicado a la venta de joya en plata como collares y anillos, para abastecerse de las joyas tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Cuenca, una vez que tiene las joyas va a recorrer por el sector donde vive, ya tiene sus clientes fijos y muy responsables, cada fin de mes viaja para surtir su negocio.

En las tardes se dedica a vender y lo hace en compañía de su bebe que apenas tiene dos añitos, trata de estar siempre cerca de el.

 Con el nuevo crédito que recibirá la señora Jenny podrá hacer un nuevo viaje hasta la Ciudad de Cuenca para comprar más joyas ya que se acerca el mes de las madres y se incrementan las ventas.
texts.en:
Jenny has a home. Her husband sells sweets on foot. She married when she was only 18 years old, and at 20, she has a son. She has been very responsible about becoming a mother and for that reason she has started a business selling silver jewelry such as necklaces and rings. To purchase the jewelry she has to travel to the city of Cuenca. Once she has the jewelry she sells in the area where she lives. She already has established customers who are responsible. At the end of every month she travels to stock her business. She sells in the afternoons, accompanied by her baby, who is barely 2 years old. She tries to always be near him. With the new loan that she will receive, Jenny can make a new trip to the city of Cuenca to purchase more jewelry, since the month of Mother's Day is approaching and sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, chains, and bracelets

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
Esta casada el esposo esta radicado en Ibiza, hace algún tiempo decidió irse a vivir allá y pudo conseguir un trabajo  como albañil, se quedo pero sin perder la costumbre de cada diciembre viene a visitar a su esposa y su hijo de 12 años que quedaron en la parroquia de Picoaza en la provincia de Manabí, pero ni la distancia ni los malos tiempos han hecho que dejen de estar en contacto nos comentó Nancy.

El estar sola para doña Nancy no le ha sido nada fácil y se ha tenido que enfrentar a momentos difíciles, además de que es una gran ama de casa y excelente madre a ella no le gusta estar con los brazos cruzados, por eso ha decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza  de Avon, desde hace ya varios años, los prestamos de la Fundación le ha servido de mucho porque así ha podido tener su propio capital e invertir en los productos, teniendo su propia inversión la cual le ha ayudado económicamente en su hogar.

Cuenta la señora Nancy que cuando su esposo viva acá el trabajaba en el Diario Manabita, y ella se dedicaba a la casa, pero ahora que el emigro las cosas han ido cambiando, su hijo de 12 años requiere de muchas cosas principalmente en los estudios y ella trata de que nada le falte porque el sueño de nuestra socia es verlo realizado, por ellos se ha metido de lleno a la venta, aun con lo difícil que es vender estos productos debido a la competencia que hay, ha sabido manejar las ventas. Trata en lo posible ayudar al cliente, que puedan cubrir sus pagos, les deja por semana los cobros.

 Lo que más vende son los perfumes y maquillaje que es justamente en lo que invertirá su crédito. Entre los sueños de nuestra socia esta poder terminar sus estudios cuenta que solo termino los estudios secundarios y le gustaría estudiar parvularia.
texts.en:
Nancy is married but her husband lives in Ibiza. Some time ago he decided to move there and got a job as a construction worker. He stayed but comes every December to visit his wife and 12 year old son who remained in the parish of Picoaza in the Manabí province. Neither the distance nor bad times have prevented them from staying in contact, Nancy says. It has not been easy at all for Nancy to be alone, and she has had to face difficult moments. Besides being a great homemaker and an excellent mother, Nancy doesn't like to be idle, so she decided to sell Avon beauty products. For a number of years now, the loans from the Foundation have helped her because she has been able to have her own capital to invest in the products. Having her own investment has helped her financially. Nancy tells us that when husband lived here, he worked for the Diario Manabita and she was a housewife, but once he emigrated things changed. Her 12 year old son needs many things for school and she tries to ensure that he has everything he needs, because her dream is to see him be successful. For this reason she has thrown herself into sales. Even with how difficult it is to sells these products due to competition, she has been able to generate sales. She tries to help the customer whenever possible. She lets them pay weekly so that they can make their payments. Her biggest selling products are perfumes and makeup, which is what she will purchase with this loan. One of Nancy's dreams is to complete her education. She only finished high school and she would like to study early childhood education.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Avon products such as perfume, makeup, cosmetics

loans.name: Wirman Iraldo

texts.es:
Wirman de 54 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda en la tienda (aparece en la foto), con ella tiene dos hijos de 3 y 9 años, por la falta de oportunidades y la idea de tener su propio negocio el invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y construyo un local afuera de su casa para ubicar su tienda. 

Poco a poco el fue comparando víveres, como aceite y arroz para su tienda, con ayuda y dedicación de su esposa ha podido salir a adelante, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende aceites a $ 1.60, azúcar a $ 0.25. Con el préstamo quiere comprar útiles escolares para sus hijo ya que entraron a clases. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Wirman is 54 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. His wife, who appears in the photo, helps him tend to his store, and together they have two children, ages 3 and 9. Due to a lack of opportunities and the idea of having his own business, Wirman invested his savings in some supplies and built a shop outside of his home for his store. Little by little he went on buying supplies, such as oil and rice, for his store, and with the help and dedication of his wife he was able to make headway. He works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day, selling oil for $1.60 and sugar for $0.25. With the loan he plans to purchase school supplies for his children since they are enrolled in classes. In the future he wants to build a better home and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies (notebooks, books, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: install electricity in his house

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith B. is a trained and qualified nurse who operates a pharmacy located in the eastern part of the city. She has been in this business for about 10 years. She is married with one son and three other dependants. Judith is married and her husband is currently unemployed. As she is the only one operating a pharmacy in her area, there is increased demand for the drugs she sells. As a result, she is seeking a loan to buy more drugs and hopes to expand her pharmacy with the proceeds from this loan.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Ramona Asuncion

texts.es:
Al estar trabajando junto a la Fundación Espoir la señora Ramona ha podido surgir en el mundo de las ventas de la cual ha sabido obtener gran experiencia en este campo.

Nuestra socia que pertenece al Banco Comunal 22 de Julio en la parroquia Picoaza se dedica al comercio, su actividad se basa en la venta de productos naturales, además vende lotería  recorriendo en el centro de las ciudades de Portoviejo y Manta, actualmetne mantiene una relación  de 14 años con el padre de sus 3 hijos, cuenta la señora Ramona que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas durante estos 5 ciclos que lleva de socia.
Con este nuevo crédito la señora Ramona invertirá en sus negocios y a la vez compartirá con el esposo el  dinero del crédito  pues el también necesita invertir algo de capital en el negocio de las legumbres, trabajo que lo ha sabido mantener por varios años. El  sueño de nuestra socia se basa en poder ver realizados a sus hijos y  poder darle un techo en que vivir. 

Con el nuevo crédito podrá incrementar su negocio, tiene que hacer la entrega de varios pedidos de los productos naturales quiere que su negocio cada día sea mas rentable.
texts.en:
Working with [the field partner] Fundación Espoir, Ramona has risen in the world of sales and gained a great deal of experience in this field. Ramona is a member of the "22 de Julio" Communal Bank in the Picoaza district. Her business is based on the sale of natural products, while she also sells lottery tickets around the city centres of Portoviejo and Manta. She has been in a relationship for 14 years with the father of her three children. Sales have been going very well throughout the 5 loan cycles she has undertaken. With this new loan, Ramona will invest in her business and will share the money with her partner, as he too needs capital to invest in the vegetable business he has held for several years. Ramona's dreams are based on seeing her children do well and being able to provide a home for them. With this new loan, she will be able to grow her business, paying installments on orders of natural products. She wants to see her business become more profitable every day.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 'Omnilife' natural products

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
In the small town of Hoima in Uganda there lives a 41-year-old man named Zaki. He is the father of seven children. He is a proud poultry farmer while his wife deals in local brew so as to maximize avenues for family income.

Despite the challenges of substandard chicken feeds on the market, Zaki says he intends to enlarge his farm to a bigger one because the poultry business is so gainful for him.

Having visited some other poultry farmers across the district, Zaki has decided to access this loan to buy chicks and feeds of better quality to boost his farm.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feeds of better quality

loans.name: Komi Séraphin

texts.en: Monsieur Komi Séraphin H. owns a restaurant in Lomé, Togo. He is 38 years old and married with one child. Komi, whose first name in the Ewe language means that he was born on a Saturday, is from Lomé and works in the Adidogomé quarter of the city. His restaurant is called "CAREBACH." This is Komi's first loan from WAGES. He has requested 500,000 XOF to purchase some equipment for his restaurant as well as supplies to help expand his menu.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia F. P. es una mujer  que vive con su cónyuge en el barrio Boyacá de la ciudad de Bogotá. Ella tiene dos hijos en las edades de 23 y 24 años, que a este minuto están en la universidad estudiando ciencias sociales y matemáticas. Adelia y su   cónyuge trabajan  en la tapicería, restaurando y fabricando muebles hechos de maderas y telas. Ellos llevan 24 años en este sector, su negocio es familiar e inició  solamente  con el tapizado de muebles, pero después fue creciendo e incluyeron la fabricación de estos, para finalmente adicionar las cortinas tipo isabelina que hoy fabrican. 
Ella está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $600.000, para que esta empresa siga creciendo y  piensa comprar materias primas como tela y madera. Este es justamente su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su próximo financiamiento Adelia  planea hacer la adecuación de un local, para poder exhibir sus productos como cortinas, muebles para el hogar, exhibidores domésticos, mesas, juegos de comedor, y hasta Puff  o almohadas de gran tamaño que se usan para sentarse, pues en la actualidad   solo cuenta con su taller de fabricación. Su sueño es ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio, tener un punto de venta  y diversificar los productos que ofrece para incluir otros tipos de muebles y cortinas. Ella también espera comprar una casa, por eso está haciendo su ahorro programado, para poder acceder al subsidio que otorga el estado y es que esto es precisamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Adelia F. P. is a woman who lives with her spouse in the Boyacá neighborhood of the city of Bogotá. She has two children who are 23 and 24 years old and who, at this time, are studying social sciences and mathematics at the university. Adelia and her spouse work in upholstery; restoring and making wood and fabric furniture. They have been in this line of work for 24 years. It is a family business, and they began solely upholstering furniture, but the business grew to include making the furniture, and finally added Elizabethan style curtains which they now make as well. She is applying for a loan worth $600.000 so that her business can continue to grow and to purchase raw materials like fabric and wood. This is just her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With her next loan, Adelia plans to acquire a place of business to display her products: curtains, household furniture, household displays, tables, dining room sets and even Puffs (large pillows used for sitting on), because for now she only has her workshop. Her dream is to expand the infrastructure of her business, to have a point of sale and to diversify the products that she offers to include other types of furniture and curtains. She also hopes to buy a house, the reason for her scheduled savings, and to be able to take advantage of the subsidy granted by the state, and that, precisely, is her biggest challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like fabric and wood.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra conformada por varias vecinas quienes tienen muchos deseos de progresar y brindar lo mejor posible en cuanto alimentación y vivienda a sus familias y agradecen mucho a las instituciones que de alguna manera ayudan para que ella puedan concretar sus proyectos.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, ella ofrece a muchos cliente y posteriormente de acuerdo a los pedidos compra los productos de una empresa que le ofrece a un costo bajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de maquillajes, cremas para la limpieza de cutis, para la piel, manos, cabellos, aceites, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of several neighbors who have a strong desire to improve and bring the best possible in nutrition and housing to their families. They are very grateful to the institutions that, in their own ways, help make their projects possible. Mrs. Norma sells cosmetics via catalogues. She shows her catalogues to many customers and then, after receiving the orders, she buys the products from a business that offers her a low price. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy make-up, cuticle cleaning creams, skin and hand lotions, hair oils, perfumes etc.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy body lotion, oils, make-up, hair creams, perfumes etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de  40 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores.Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y a la preparación de salchipapas (platillos hechos a base de papa y pollo  frito), que vende todos los días en la puerta de su casa. Tiene varios clientes, que saben de la modalidad de la preparación, y  no dudan en  comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que es un  negocio propio y no depende de nadie, por ello atiende con mucha cordialidad e higiene a sus compradores.  Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad, y lo que no le gusta es que  a veces no termina de vender todos los platillos. En adelante  seguirá trabajando con la misma emoción de siempre, para lograr el progresoEs el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas, y en su grupo,  desea  contribuir con su responsabilidad para que logren alcanzar el progreso en conjunto.Elizabeth tiene planeado destinar el dinero solicitado en la  compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas y de ese modo desea seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, of 40 years, lives in her own house with her husband and 3 young children. She is dedicated to the sale of carbonated drinks and to the preparation of salchipapas (a fried dish made from potatoes and chicken), that she sells every day from the door of her house. She has several clients that know about her way of preparing the dish, and they do not hesitate to buy it. What she likes most about her work is that it is her own business and she depends on no-one. Because of this she attends to her clients with much cordiality and cleanliness. She has been doing this activity for seven years, and what she does not like is that at times she does not sell all the plates. She will continue on working with the same emotion as always, in order to move forward. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments and, in her group, she wants to contribute with responsibility so that they manage to progress as a group. Elizabeth plans to use the requested money to purchase supplies to make her dishes and in that way she hopes to continue attending to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks and ingredients to make Salchipapas which she sells

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico, de 23 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos menores y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Federico trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su madre siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y papa, los cuales venden en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtienen., lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le gusta cuidar sus siembras de plagas, sin embargo lo más difícil, es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así obtener mejores ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprara más abono y fertilizantes y con eso mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Federico, of 23 years, is a happy and very industrious young man. He lives in his mother's house along with his smaller brothers. What he wants most is to improve his quality of life. He works arduously every day in his fields. Federico tries to change the life that he has at present. Along with his mother he sows beans, corn, maize and potatoes bi-annually, which he sells in the markets of Tarma and la Merced, since it is there that he obtains better profits. He has been doing this activity for 15 years and considers that he likes to protect his crops from plagues. Without doubt, the most difficult thing is to carry his crop to the markets where he sells them, since the bags that he carries are very heavy. His hope is to improve the quality of his products and thus to obtain a better income. This is his second loan with MFP. He feels that this loan will be very beneficial for him in his growth as a farmer. In his communal group he is a supportive and very active associate. With the two thousand new soles that he requests, he will buy more pesticides and fertilizer in order to improve the productivity of his small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve the productivity of his farm

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.en: Madame Tchotchovi A. is 41 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. She is married and has three children. She sells oil, rice, beans and other products at her food stall. Madame A. has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA to purchase general products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase products for sale

loans.name: Sapo Ben Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of "Sapo Ben II" group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Abdul T. K.. Abdul is age 38 and was born in Magburaka. He is married with four children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary school.

For eight years now, Abdul has sold used clothes and shoes. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying a bale of shoes and clothes to add to his current stock.

Attached to the group photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy a bale of shoes and clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Fight For Shameness Group". They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu K., who is pictured on the left. Isatu is age 40 and was born in a village called Robuga. She is married with two children. Her husband is an architect and her children are attending primary school. For many years now, Isatu has been selling fried food: potatoes, fish and plantains mixed with stew and breads. With her share of this loan, she will buy working materials like frying oil, fish, plantains, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy frying oil, fish, plantains, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Five Traders Group

texts.en:
Mamusu F. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mankay village about 22 years ago. She is married to a security guard and the couple has two children who are not of school-going age. For over two years now, Mamusu has been selling fish.

This is the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mamusu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Pictured here is Fatmata S., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This woman is seeking a loan of SLL 4,000,000 from SMT/Kiva in order to expand her business, make more sales, and consequently improve on her standard of living.

Fatmata is 40 years old and is married with six children – five in secondary school and one in primary school. She was born in Yele village. For many years now, she has been selling dried fish. With the help of this loan, she will be able to get at least four more baskets full of dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy at least four more baskets full of dried fish to add to her business

loans.name: Top Up Group

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are the members of the “Top-Up” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each in order to expand their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Unisa K., pictured on the left. He is age 38 and was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. He now lives in Makeni, where he owns a kiosk and sells mobile phone accessories, top-up cards for all four mobile phone companies, and recharges mobile phone batteries for a fee of SLL 1,000.

With his share of this loan, Unisa will buy more top-up cards and mobile phone accessories to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy more top-up cards and mobile phone accessories to add to his business

loans.name: On Time Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “On Time” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Finnah J.. She was born 45 years ago in Kabala town and is married and has three children. Two of her children are already married and living on their own and one is attending secondary school.

Finnah sells fabrics, charcoal, firewood, and rubber bowls. She will invest her share of the loan in her business, buying more fabrics, firewood and rubber bowls in large quantity to add to her current stock.

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics, firewood and rubber bowls in large quantity

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa, junto a sus 3 menores hijas a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas comienza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le gusta cuidar sus cultivos de papa y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes, sin embargo lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus productos y aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, asimismo comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Rufina, of 44 years, is a hard-working and very happy mother. She lives in her own house, along with her 3 small daughters to whom she desires to offer a better quality of life. The products that she has managed to cultivate with so much effort and dedication have helped her a lot in the progress of their life. Every morning she begins to work on her lands, since she knows that the quality of the products will depend on the care that she gives to her fields . She has been performing this activity for 20 years and considers that she likes to take care of her potato crop and feels very happy when she sees them large and abundant. Without a doubt the most difficult thing is to carry her harvest to the market of Tarma, which is the place where she sells it, since the bags that she carries are very heavy. Her hope is to improve her products and to enlarge her profits. This it is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all her payments promptly and is willing to do so. In her communal group she is a responsible and very supportive associate. With the thousand new soles that she requests, she will buy alverja seeds (a type of peas) to sow, as well as fertilizer and pesticides.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alverja seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio es un padre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a dos hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján de la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (motocicleta que tiene anexada una cabina para ofrecer servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) el cuenta con dos vehículos de los cuales maneja uno y el otro lo alquila a un chofer de la zona. En el distrito de Paiján este medio de transporte es muy usado debido a que es barato. Adicionalmente el posee ganado vacuno del cual comercializa la leche que producen a un acopiador. Los ingresos que le proveen estas actividades los utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido al constante uso, la mototaxi que suele manejar ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas que requieren de urgente solución para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo el ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Leoncio es una persona trabajadora y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir desarrollandose como ganadero y llegar a tener su propio establo, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Leoncio is an older parent and lives with his wife and two children in the Licapa sector in the district of Paiján, Ascope province, in the region of La Libertad, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than two years he has provided a mototaxi transportation service (a motorcycle that has a cab attached to provide transport service for cargo or passengers). He has two vehicles, one of which he drives and the other he rents to a local driver. In the district of Paiján this mode of transport is very popular because it is cheap. Additionally, Leoncio owns cattle and he sells the milk that they produce to a distributor. The income that these activities provide Leoncio uses to sustain his family. Under constant use, the mototaxi that he usually drives has begun to suffer a few technical failures that require an urgent solution to guarantee that it will function correctly. This motive has led him to seek a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he plans to invest in the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. Leoncio is a hardworking and responsible person, his greatest desire is to continue developing dhis herd of cattle and to eventually have his own barn. He has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in fulfilling his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the costs of repairing and maintaining his mototaxi

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es: Hebert, de 37 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.Se dedica a  la distribución de pescados, chorizos, langostinos (productos marinos) que luego de comprar y acomodarlos en la acopiadora en su carro, los  distribuye a todos los mercados del sur de la ciudad. Tiene varios clientes,  que saben de la prontitud  de las  entregas, y lo esperan ansiosos en sus puestos,  para recibir  y solicitar  los próximos pedidos. Ya  lleva 7 años realizando esta labor  y considera que su mayor dificultad, es cuando su carro sufre averías en pleno trabajo, pero trata de solucionar el problema lo más pronto posible. Para el futuro desea comprarse otra movilidad más moderna, para continuar ofreciendo lo mejor a sus clientes.Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual como siempre. En su grupo, es un integrante responsable y  muy querido por sus compañeras de crédito.Hebert tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  llantas para su carro y de ese modo seguirá  trabajando productivamente como hasta hoy.
texts.en:
Hebert, 37 years old, lives in the home of his parents-in-law with his wife and two sons. He buys fish, sausages, and prawns—seafood—that, after properly storing them in his car, he distributes to all the markets in the south of the city. He has several customers who trust the promptness of his deliveries, and they wait for him eagerly in the market to receive and place orders. He has done this work for 7 years. Hebert's main difficulty arises when he has car trouble in the middle of work, and he is trying to fix this as soon as possible. In the future he wants to buy a more modern vehicle in order to continue offering his clients the best. This is his fifteenth loan from MFP, and he will continue to be punctual as always with repayments. He is a responsible bank member and is well-liked by his peers. He plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of tires for his car. This way he will be able to continue working productively as he always has.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of new tires for his car

loans.name: Haja Balkisu

texts.en:
Haja Balkisu is a trader dealing in arts and crafts items. She has been in this business for about four years. 

She is married with four children who are all in school. In addition to her children, she has two dependents staying with her. Haja was a group leader of a united group with very good credit history. 

She is in dire need of a loan to be able to buy raw materials to produce more arts and crafts products, which will increase her profit margin. She hopes to use proceeds from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Zoa Marlene

texts.es:
Zoa de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana de la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene un hijo de 20 años, hace años atrás ella estudio enfermería para poder sustentar su hogar, aunque en Ecuador no es muy remunerado esta profesión ella lo hace para sustentar su hogar. 

Trabaja como enfermera en diferentes lugares, lo que mas hace cuando la contratan en las  casas es poner inyecciones, sueros y toma de presión. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y arena para construir mejor su casa, (en la foto aparece  con los instrumento para construir su casa). 

En el futuro quiere que su hijo termine los estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Zoa is 58 years old. She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has a 20 year old son. Years ago she studied nursing to be able to support her home. Even thought the profession isn't well paid in Ecuador, she does it to support her home. She works as a nurse in different places. What she does the most is when they hire her to go to homes and give injections and IV's and to take blood presure. With the loan, she wants to buy cement, blocks and sand to improve her house (in the photo she appears with the tools to build her house). In the future she wants for her son to finish his studies and be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, blocks, sand

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, que son menores de edad. La señora Karla tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en la cual además vende electrodomésticos y cosméticos, este negocio está localizado en su casa de habitación. Ella ya tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio cuando ella no tenía trabajo. Ahora en día, ella trabaja como secretaria en Managua, y el negocio en el día es atendido por su mama, los fines de semana ella está a cargo del negocio. La señora posee buena clientela sus ventas son más o menos un 70% a contado y un 30% a crédito. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería, ya que se acerca la fecha del día de la madre y quiere surtir con producto nuevo el negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener un negocio grande para tener las disponibilidades para que sus hijos puedan tener una educación universitaria en la universidad y que se preparen bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla is a thirty-four year old, single mother of two young kids. Mrs. Karla has a home-business selling new clothes, appliances, and cosmetics. She began this business seven years ago when she was unemployed. She works as a secretary in Managua while her mother takes care of the business during the week. She takes care of it on the weekends and has many customers and sells about 70% cash and 30% on credit. She is taking out a loan to buy merchandise since it's almost Mother's Day and she wants to stock her business. Her dream has always been to have a large enough business to pay for her kids' university education so they will be prepared for life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working captial

loans.name: Mirador De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La sra. Zenaida, tiene 44 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos y junto son su esposo trabajan cada uno en su rubro para poder sacar adelante a su familia. La sra.
