Zenaida es integrante del grupo "mirador D. carabayllo", formado por 10 personas muy trabajadoras que residen en la zona D. la flor en el distrito D. carabayllo, ellos la eligieron como presidenta D. la junta directiva del grupo.
La sra. Zenaida se dedica hace cinco años a la venta D. joyería, es dedir aretes, pulseras en oro 14 y relojes en variados modelos, cuenta con 2 vendedoras que la ayudan en la venta, la cual la realizan ofreciendo al público D. casa en casa o a sus conocidos, familiares y amigos.inició con un pequeño capital, con los prestamos obtenidos su negocio ha ido creciendo, aumentando su clientela y su stock.

Con éste trabajo ha podido ayudar a pagar la educación D. sus hijos y avanzó con la construcción D. su casa y acabados.
El prestamo solilcitado  lo utilizará para aumentar su mercadería, es decir su joyería.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 44, has four children and works along with her husband, each one in his/her sphere, to proviD. for their family. Zenaida is a member of the Group “Mirador D. Carabayllo” [Carabayllo Scenic Viewpoint] which is maD. up of ten very industrious persons who live in the La Flor zone in the Carabayllo district. They elected her to be president of the group’s Board of Directors. For five years Zenaida has been selling jewelry as her main line of business, that is, earrings, 14-carat gold bracelets and watches in a variety of models. She has two saleswomen who help her sell the jewelry door-to-door to the public or to their acquaintances, family members and friends. She began with a small amount of capital and, with the loans that were obtained, her business has seen an increase both in the number of customers and stock. With this work she has been able to help pay for the education of her children and move forward with the construction of her house and its finishings. She will use the requested loan to add to her merchandise, that is, her jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene 52 años. Su esposo trabaja y le ayuda a sufragar los gastos del hogar y sirve de apoyo para el ingreso de la familia. Aduce la señora que ha logrado progresar aun más, ya que siempre ha invertido los créditos para lo que solicita. Por lo que esto le ha ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida en que vive, pues su actividad que es una pulpería, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio. Su sueño ahora es condicionar el local y hacerlo más grande. Además, en lo familiar desea apoyar más a sus hijos y brindarle siempre la ayuda.
texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old. Her husband works and she helps with the household expenses and serves as a support for the family income. She states that she has been able to progress even further, since she has always invested the loans in what she asks them for. That is why she has been able to improve her living conditions. Her activity is a grocery store. She has been doing this for more than 7 years. The financing that she is asking for is to buy raw materials for her business. Her dream now is to improve the locale and make it bigger. In addition, in her family she wants to support her children and always offer them her help.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts to make red palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty forma parte de las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército, banco que se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo dos veces al mes.

La señora Betty de 54 años de edad se dedica al comercio ambulante de comida rápida como Hot Dog, Hamburguesa  y Salchipapas, en su carro junto a sus hijos y  esposo, ya son 15 años que lleva trabajando y le ha ido muy bien, la idea de poner este negocio vino del esposo de nuestra socia y no se arrepienten porque cada día las cosas están mejores.
 
Un día decidió el esposo de la señora Betty  comprar un carro acomodarlo tipo bar y empezar con el negocio,  son 40 años que llevan de casados y siempre han querido mantener unida la familia, han sabido trabajar tanto así que también tiene un disco móvil que lo trabaja uno de sus  hijos  y un sobrino ellos se encargan de salir a las fiestas.

Con este nuevo crédito que recibirá la señora Betty podrá incrementar su negocio con todo lo necesario para salir a recorrer con sus ventas, ahora que se vienen varias fiestas en diferentes cantones de la provincia podrá trasladar su vehículo para vender.
texts.en:
Señora Betty is one of the members of the communal bank Av. Del Ejército, which meets twice a month in the city of Portoviejo. Señora Betty, 54, has a business as a street vendor selling fast food, such as hot dogs, hamburgers, and salchipapas, from her car with her children and her husband. She has already been working 15 years and it has gone well for her. The idea to start this business came from her husband, and they have not regretted it, because things are better every day. One day Señora Betty's husband decided to buy a vehicle that could accommodate a sort of bar and start the business. They have been married 40 years, and they have always wanted to keep the family together. They have known how to work hard, and they also have a mobile disco manned by one of their sons and a nephew who take it out to the festivals. With this new loan, Señora Betty will be able to supply her business with everything necessary to continue to get around with her sales. Since several festivals in different areas of the province are coming, she will be able to move her vehicle around to make sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Flora Isabel

texts.es:
L a señora Flora es una de las socia que lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército en la bella capital manabita.

La señora Flora es fundadora de este banco comunal y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos obtenidos, es ama de casa y el crédito que solicita es para ayudar al esposo es su trabajo Y en el mantenimiento de su volqueta, el trabaja en fletes de arena, piedras a diferentes ciudades del país, tiene que invertir 20 dólares diario y trabaja toda la semana y además de pagarle a las personas que trabajan con el y cubrir los gastos de alimentación.
 
Cuenta nuestra socia que en los actúales  momentos el esposo no se ha sentido nada bien de salud y son sus hijos los que le ayudan a trabajar, es muy rentable el negocio, a diario le salen de dos a tres fletes y por cada salida cobra 40 dólares.
 
Las volquetas son de el, ellos trabajan solo en la ciudad de Portoviejo hacen fletes de piedras, arena, solo trabajan cuando lo contratan, invierten por semana 20 diarios, aparte del mantenimiento de la volqueta;  en cada flete cobra 40 y cuando es arena 20 dólares.

 Su sueño es poder ayudarle a su nieta para que tenga su negocio de ropa
texts.en:
Señora Flora has been a member for 4 cycles of the communal bank Av. Del Ejército in the beautiful capital Manabita. Señora Flora is the founder of this communal bank, and she has been very satisfied with the loans she has obtained. She is a homemaker and the loan she is requesting is to help her husband in his work and in the maintenance of his dump truck. He works for hire hauling sand and rocks to different cities in the country. This costs him $20 per day and he works all week long, as well as paying the people who work with him and covering the food expenses. Our member tells us that recently her husband has not felt well in his health, and his sons are helping him with his work. The business is very profitable, they haul two or three loads in a day and each load is charged $40. The trucks belong to him, they are working alone in the city of Portoviejo hauling stones and sand. They only work when they have a contract, his expenses are $20 per day, apart from the maintenance of the truck. Each haul pays $40, or if it is sand, $20. Her dream is to be able to help her granddaughter to have her own clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 53 años,  es una mujer muy trabajadora,  vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y cigarros, durante todos los días se ubica en la puerta de un casino, ubicado a 6 cuadras de su casa.  Es así que todas las tardes se avoca a esta labor que le gusta mucho, y por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar  en la casa de una vecina. De esta manera con el desempeño de su trabajo y su  negocio de golosinas Cirila, ha sido un gran apoyo  para su esposo, y  juntos  han construido un sólido hogar. La labor que más le gusta  es la comercialización pues se distrae bastante, y para más adelante tiene pensado adquirir un kiosco y de ese modo mejorar la condición de su negocio.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y asegura que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas pues ha sido beneficioso  en el desarrollo de su negocio. En su grupo, es una socia muy responsable, por lo que se ha ganado el respeto de sus compañeros.Cirila tiene planeado  incrementar su mercadería en golosinas, y de ese modo quiere ofrecer lo mejor  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cirila is 53 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children. For six years, she has sold snacks and cigarrettes. Every day she sells in the door of a casino, located 6 blocks from her house. Every day she does this work that she likes a lot and mornings she works as a house employee in a neighbor's house. This way, with her job and her snack business, Cirila has been a big support to her husband and together they have been able to build a solid home. The work that she likes the most is selling; it is interesting to her. In the future, she plans on having a kiosk and in this way improve her business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she assures us she will make the payments on time since the loans have been beneficial to the development of her business. In her group, she is a very responsible member. She has earned the respect of the other members. Cirila is planning on increasing her snack merchandise, and in this way offer the best to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise and snacks for her business

loans.name: Mariuxi Agustina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Mariuxi es una joven madre de 20 años  tiene una niña de apenas año y medio, mantiene una bonita relación con su esposo, ya tiene en el Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejercito dos ciclos.

Mariuxi junto al esposo tienen un negocio de Flores naturales en el sector del mercado central de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ha transcurrido un año desde que iniciaron con su negocio y les ha ido muy bien se siente muy contenta nuestra socia, con los créditos que ha venido recibiendo por parte de la Fundación ha ido incrementando su local y ahora está bien surtido, ella por semana invierte 200 dólares en flores que les las traen directamente desde la sierra, en este local atiende de lunes  a domingo y aparte tiene otra venta de flores en las afuera del cementerio central de la localidad, en ese día es el esposo que se traslada hasta el lugar desde la 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde que termina su venta.

Nuestra socia comenta que para fechas especiales como el día de los enamorados y día de la madre es cuando más se vende por eso con este nuevo crédito invertirá el total del dinero para surtir su florería.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is a young mother, age 20, with a daughter who is just a year and a half old. She and her husband have a beautiful relationship. She has been in the "Av. del Ejercito" ("Army Avenue") communal bank for two loan cycles. Mariuxi and her husband have a business selling flowers in the central market area of the city of Portoviejo. They started the business one year ago; it has gone very well for them, and Mariuxi is very happy. With the loans she has received from the Foundation, she has expanded her shop, and now it is well-stocked. Each week, she invests $200 in flowers, which are delivered to her directly from the mountainous part of the country. She works in her shop from Monday through Sunday, and she also maintains another flower stand outside her town's main cemetery. On that day, her husband is the one who travels there, working from 7 in the morning until he closes the stand in the evening. Mariuxi tells us that she sells more flowers on special dates such as Valentine's Day and Mother's Day. She will invest all of the funds in stocking her flower shop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flowers (roses, carnations, daisies, chrysanthemums, etc.)

loans.name: Marleg España

texts.es:
La señora Marleg  forma parte del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella es padre y madre para sus hijos ya que  hace 17 años enviudo y ha tenido la ardua tarea de salir adelante con su familia.

Marleg es una mujer llena de fortaleza y junto a sus hijos ha trabajado, en los actúales momentos nuestra socia tiene una tienda de víveres y la venta de helados, el local lo tiene en la esquina de su casa en la ciudad de Portoviejo, pero no es suficiente para ella,  tiene también la venta de productos de belleza Avon, cuenta Marleg que sus hijos le ayudan a trabajar, cuando sale a recoger los productos,  son ellos los que se quedan en la tienda.

Ya son 8 ciclos que nuestra socia forma parte de la Fundación Espoir y con cada uno de los créditos que  ha recibido ha invertido en sus negocios, y eso le ha permitido mantenerlos firmes. Con este crédito invertirá en incrementar su stock de productos en la tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y más víveres, por otra parte también adquirirá productos de  belleza como maquillaje, bisutería y perfumes todos esto a base de pedidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marleg is part of the “Avenida del Ejército” Community Bank located in the city of Portoviejo. For the last seventeen years she has been both mother and father to her children after she was widowed. She has had the difficult task of progressing with her family. Marleg is a strong woman. Together with her children she runs a grocery store. She also sells ice cream from her house that is located on a corner in Portoviejo. But this isn’t enough for Marleg. She also sells Avon beauty products. Her children help her with her work. When she goes out to get her products, her children take care of the grocery store. This member of the “Espoir Foundation” has participated in eight loan cycles. She has invested the money from the loans in her businesses. This has allowed her to keep them stable. With this loan she will stock her store with products that the people like to buy such as rice, sugar, oil, and other groceries. She also will buy beauty products such as makeup, imitation jewelry and perfumes. She will purchase these products according to customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, flour, oil, sodas, meats...

loans.name: Rina Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Rina es una excelente socia muy responsable del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército, se desempeña como comerciante, desde hace 2 años tiene   cabinas telefónicas a cargo de un sobrino, mientras que ella se dedica a su restáurate que lo tiene desde hace 10 años en la terminal terrestre de la ciudad de Portoviejo, sus dos negocios quedan juntos y desde muy temprano en la mañana empieza atender.

Nuestra socia Rina es una mujer que le encanta trabajar y que no importa todo el sacrificio que  tiene que hacer para mantener sus negocios, a las 4 de la mañana ella va al  mercado central de la ciudad para comprar todo lo necesario para su restaurante y a las 7 está atendiendo a sus clientes con el desayuno, y una vez que termine de vender el desayuno empieza a preparar los alimentos para el almuerzo, a las 5 de la tarde está desocupada de sus actividades.

La señora Rina se mantiene desde hace dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y con los créditos a sabido mantener sus negocios, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en comprar productos como víveres, legumbres, embutidos y carnes para preparar los diferentes platos a sus clientes, además quiere invertir en un nuevo negocio que sería un bar, donde pueda vender batidos, tostadas en el mismo sector que tiene sus otros dos negocios.

Todo lo que ella hace es por el bienestar de sus hijos, cuenta la señora Rina que una hija estudia en la Universidad y sus otros hijos están con el papá en Quito, el sueño para ella es tener una finca y disfrutar de la vida.
texts.en:
Rina is an outstanding and very responsible member of the "Av. Del Ejército" ("Army Avenue") communal bank. She works as a businessperson; for the past two years, she has operated telephone call booths, which are managed by her nephew. At the same time, she also runs a restaurant, which she has operated for the past 10 years in the bus station of the city of Portoviejo. Her two businesses are next to each other, and she starts work there very early in the morning. Rina is a woman who loves to work, and she does not mind all the sacrifices she has to make to maintain her businesses. At 4 in the morning, she goes to the city's central market to buy everything she needs for her restaurant, and at 7, she is already serving breakfast to her customers. Once breakfast is over, she begins preparing the food for lunch, and at 5 in the evening she ends her workday. Rina has been a member of her communal bank for two loan cycles, and she has been able to maintain her businesses with the loans. With this new loan, she will invest in buying products such as fruits, beans, meats, lunch meat, and other grocery items to prepare the various foods she offers her customers. She also wants to invest in a new business: a snack bar where she can sell fruit smoothies and toasted sandwiches in the same area where she has her other two businesses. Rina reports that everything she does is for the well-being of her children; one daughter is studying at the university, and her other children are with their father in Quito. Her dream is to have a farm and enjoy life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, rice, beans, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Bella Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas en progreso que se reúne cada quince días  en la ciudad de Portoviejo provincia de Manabí.


Nuestra socia es comerciante de productos de belleza Yanbal y a la vez tiene un negocio de comida, el crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en incrementar sus negocios, ya son 3 años que esta dedicada a la venta de Yanbal y le va muy bien, se dedica la mañana a  visitar a sus clientas. Desde hace 3 meses ha invertido junto a su hijo en un negocio de comida, en una de la avenidas con mayor movimiento comercial de la ciudad,  la idea fue de su hijo quien le dijo que trabajen juntos y que ella se encargue de preparar los alimentos junto a la esposa de el, y desde entonces les ha ido muy bien , abren su local desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche.


A nuestra socia Bella le va excelente con los créditos que recibe por parte de la Fundación
Ahora con este nuevo crédito  compartirá en sus dos negocios,  por una parte en los productos de Yanbal, tiene que comprar algunos pedidos como perfumes y maquillaje, y en el restaurante necesitara comprar los alimentos  como; carnes, arroz, legumbres y bebidas, para prepara los diferentes platos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bella belongs to the Women’s Community Bank. They meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo in the province of Manabî. Our member sells Yanbal beauty products. She also has a prepared food business. The loan that she requesting will be used to expand her businesses. She has been selling Yanbal beauty products for the past three years. Business has been good. Each morning she visits her customers. Three months ago she invested, with her son, in a prepared food business. It is located on one of the major commercial streets in the city. The idea was that she and her son would work together. Bella would be in charge of preparing the food along with her son’s wife. It has been going very well. The restaurant is open from five in the afternoon until ten at the night. Bella has been very responsible with the loans that she has received from the foundation. She will split the proceeds of this new loan between her two businesses. With the part of the loan that is dedicated to Yanbal she will buy some requested items such as perfume and makeup. For the restaurant she will buy food supplies such as meat, rice, beans, and drinks. These items will be used in her prepared meals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yambal imitation jewelry

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Bertha viene formando parte del Banco Comunal Damas en Progresos desde hace 7 ciclos y con los créditos ha salido adelante junto a su familia, ya que le ha tocado enfrentar la vida como madre soltera de 4 hijos.

El negocio de la señora Bertha es  la venta de mangos, grosellas, papitas fritas y dulces, en un triciclo, ya son 7 años que viene realizando esta labor, la manera de trabajar es salir de casa desde muy temprano, sola en su triciclo siendo ella misma quien lo conduce,  al preguntarle el porque decidió por este negocio, esto fue lo que nos comentó:” cuando era niña sus padres por el hecho de ser de bajos recurso no le pudieron dar los estudio,no tenia educación y no podía trabajar en ningún otro negocio, es por eso que decidió por este trabajo.”

El negocio de nuestra señora Bertha lo realiza de lunes a viernes a la salida de clases en las escuelas, y los fines de semana. Con ella vive su nieto quien lo tiene a su cuidado, ella se las ingenia para poder llevar a cabo su  trabajo.

 Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia Bertha podrá incrementar su negocio, comprando todo lo que vende, como lo son los mangos, grosellas y golosinas en general.

 En la mañana se dedica a la casa, sábado y domingo sale todo el día a vender, compra lo que necesita en un lugar especifico, trabaja todos los días para poder hacer realidad su sueño que es tener su casita propia.
texts.en:
Our member, Bertha, has been a part of the Progressive Women’s Community Bank for the past seven loan cycles. With these loans she has progressed with her family. She is a single mother with four children. Bertha sells mangos, gooseberries, French fries, and sweets from a tricycle. She has been doing this for the past seven years. She leaves the house early in the morning on her tricycle. She herself rides the bike. When asked why she decided to do this business, this is what she said. When she was young her parents, lacking resources, were not able to educate her. She is is not educated and therefore cannot work in another business. This is why she decided to do this business. She works from Monday to Friday after school gets out and also works on the weekends. She also cares for her grandchild. She carries out her business in a creative way. With this new loan Bertha will grow her business. She will buy everything that she sells such as mangos, gooseberries and sweets in general. In the mornings she takes care of her household chores. Saturday and Sunday she sells all day. She buys everything she needs in a specific place. She works all these days in order to achieve her dream of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mangos, bananas, gooseberries and papayas

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Mayra es socia del Banco Comunal Damas en Progreso desde hace 2 ciclos, es madre de dos niños, tiene de casada 4 años se conoció con su esposo en la provincia del Guayas,  luego se casaron y se radicaron en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Nuestra socia Mayra fue motivada por una amiga para que ingrese al Banco Comunal, esta muy satisfecha trabajando con los créditos en su negocio, que consiste en la venta de arroz por saquillos, en su propia casa tiene un pequeña bodega, el esposo es el que se encarga del negocio, el viaja hasta la provincia del Guayas a comprar a los distribuidores los quintales el arroz, desde hace 1 año están dedicados a este negocio y les ha ido muy bien, la manera de vender de estos esposos es la siguiente, todos los días ponen una mesa en las afuera de su casa y ahí venden por libra el arroz o como el cliente pida.

La señora Mayra con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en mas quintales de arroz, todas la semanas tiene el esposo que viajar e invertir en 30 sacos de arroz, una vez que tiene el arroz lo pesan y lo comparten en diferentes saquillos, dependiendo de la exigencia de sus clientes, todo se  vende.

Para nuestra señora Mayra es maravilloso saber que las cosas en su negocio marchan bien y que se da tiempo para poder cuidar a sus hijos que están de 2 y 4 años y es por ellos que trabaja,  para poder cumplir el sueño de obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra has been a member of the Damas en Progreso community bank for 2 loan cycles. She is a mother of two and has been married for 4 years. She and her husband met in Guayas province, got married and settled in the city of Portoviejo. A friend encouraged her to join the community bank, and she is very satisfied with working with credit in her business. She sells rice in little sacks and has a small store in her own home. Her husband takes charge of the business, and travels to Guayas to buy rice in quintals (100 kg measurements) from distributors. They have done this for 1 year and it is going very well. Every day they set up a table outside of their house and sell rice by the pound, or however the client requests it. With this loan, Mayra will be able to invest in more rice. Every week her husband has to travel and invest in 30 bags of rice; once they have it, they weigh it and divide it into different bags, depending on demand. They sell it all. It is wonderful to know that her business is going well. It gives Mayra time to take care of their children, who are 2 and 4. She works for them: to be able to achieve the dream of owning their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Rossi Melva

texts.es:
Rossi tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Chocope D. la provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas D. dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Rossi es cocinera, se vale D. esta actividad para percibir ingresos y ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento D. su familia. Ella trabaja en una pollería (restaurante en donD. se venD. pollo a la brasa – Pollo aderezado y cocinado en brasas D. carbón) en la ciudad en donD. vive desD. hace mas D. dos años, ella está encargada D. preparar los pollos y despacharlos. 

Adicionalmente todos los dias venD. muy temprano visceras D. cerdo en el mercado D. la ciudad, ella las compra ya limpiadas a los carniceros D. la zona y las revenD. a los comerciantes D. comida, las visceras D. cerdo son muy consumidas, ya que se utilizan para preparar chicharrones y pancitas (ambos son platos preparados en base a frituras, los primeros se fríen en una olla común y los ultimos se fríen en brasas D. carbón).

Rossi desea ampliar su negocio D. venta D. visceras para empezar a distribuir su mercadería en restaurantes mas grandes, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1400 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. mas visceras.

Rossi es una mujer optimista y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es llegar a formar su propio restaurante. En la zona donD. vive y en su trabajo ella es muy querida y estimada.
texts.en:
Rossi is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband in the district of Chocope, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region. The area she lives in is located more than 2 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. Rossi is a cook; she relies on this work to earn income and help her husband support their family. She works in a pollería (restaurant offering charcoal-roasted, seasoned chicken) in the city where she has lived for more than 2 years. Rossi is in charge of preparing and serving the barbecued chicken. In addition, early every morning Rossi sells pork offals at the city market. She buys entrails from local butchers and cleans them, then resells to food vendors. Pork offals are in high demand because they are used to prepare chicharron (fried pork rinds) and pancitas (tripe). Both are fried dishes; the latter is fried over red-hot coals and the former is prepared in a normal pot. Rossi wishes to expand her business selling offals to distribute to larger restaurants. For this reason she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,400 PEN, which she plans to invest in buying pork entrails. Rossi is an optimistic and hardworking woman. Her greatest dream is to start her own restaurant. Rossi is very beloved and respected in the communities where she works and lives.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork offals to expand business sales.

loans.name: Jessenia Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel es una joven madre y comerciante de primera, forma parte  del banco comunal Damas en Progreso que se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días.

La señora Mabel esta casada desde hace 6 años, tiene una niña de 5 años, el esposo se dedica a la venta de fármacos, es visitador medico, y ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza Yanbal, se viene dedicando a este  negocio desde hace dos años y le gusta lo que hace, con este nuevo crédito ella podrá invertir una parte del dinero en comprar los productos y con la otra parte para mejoramiento de su vivienda.

Nuestra socia Mabel aparte de ser una excelente comerciante también le dedica tiempo a sus estudios, actualmente esta estudiando idiomas en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí, el sueño de nuestra socia es terminar sus estudios y llegar hacer una maestra en idiomas.
 
Mabel le dedica el tiempo de la mañana a las ventas de sus productos, aprovechando que su niña esta en la escuela, sus clientas por lo general son las oficinistas en el centro de la ciudad y además de las ejecutivas del hogar que están en diferentes sectores de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Mabel is a young mother and businesswoman. She is a member of the Women in Progress comunal bank which meets in the city of Portoviejo every 15 days. Mabel has been married for 6 years and has a 5 year old daughter. Her husband is a pharmaceutical salesman and medical sales representative. She sells Yanbal beauty products. She's been doing this for 2 years and likes what she does. With this new loan, she'll be able to invest some of the money to purchase new products, and with the rest she'll improve her home. Our partner Mabel, aside from being an excellent businesswoman, is also dedicated to her studies. She's currently studying languages at the Technical University of Manabi. Her dream is to complete her studies and become a language teacher. Mabel spends her mornings selling her products, taking advantage of the time that her daughter is in school. For the most part, her clients are office workers downtown, and also home makers in different parts of Portoviejo.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yanbal Products

loans.name: Ercilia Julisa

texts.es:
La señora Julissa tiene 40 años esta casada desde hace 10 años, es tan dedicada a su trabajo que consiste en la venta de confitería, snack, stikers, etc trabajo que lo realiza en un triciclo al igual que su esposo en las afuera de esuelas y colegios, de lunes a viernes, sale de casa desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y regresa ya cansada, cuenta que es ella quien maneja su triciclo y que el esposo tiene otro y trabajan por separado, nuestra socia es nacida en la capital de los ecuatorianos y desde que se caso se radicó en la ciudad de Portoviejo hace 10 años, tiene 4 hijos, solo uno vive con ellos y los demás viven en Quito, ya son independientes; aparte de la venta en triciclo la señora Julissa tiene otro negocio una tienda de víveres y su hijo es el encargado de atender mientras  ella esta fuera de casa.


La señora Julissa con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en sus dos negocios, surtirá cada uno de ellos,  en la venta de confitería, en esta época escolar le va muy bien y tiene que incrementar sus productos, y por otra parte a la tienda la tiene que surtir, nuestra socia esta muy contenta porque podrá seguir manteniendo firme sus negocios. El sueño para ella es tener su casa propia y ya no seguir alquilando.
texts.en:
Julissa is 40 years old, and has been married for 10 years. She is very dedicated to her work, which is the sale of sweets, snacks, stickers, etc. She does this work on a tricycle, as does her husband, outside of schools from Monday to Friday. She leaves the house at 6:00 in the morning and works until 6 in the evening, when she returns home tired, since she drives her own tricycle while her husband has another and they split up. Our partner was born in the Ecuadoran capital but since her marriage 10 years ago, she has lived in Portoviejo. She has 4 children, but only one of them lives with her. The rest live in Quito and are already on their own. Aside from tricycle sales, Julissa has another business; a food store which her son watches while she's out. With this new loan, Julissa will be able to invest in her two businesses and advance them both. During the school year, confectionery sales are very successful and she needs to increase her stock, and the store also needs investment. Our partner is very happy to be able to keep both her businesses stable. Her dream is to have her own home and stop renting.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy, gum, potato chips, oil, rice, sugar, soda pop

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una gran mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, pese a que es una persona con capacidades especiales, nos comentó que se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, que consiste en la venta de comida rápida,  para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor que es quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Desde hace varios ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal Damas En Progreso, con los créditos que ha recibido por parte de la Fundación su negocio ha ido en aumento, ahora podrá invertir en arreglar el lugar donde tiene su negocio y poder comprar mas alimentos como plátanos. Queso y aceites.


A sus 58 años es una mujer bastante activa, es viuda hace 13 años y sus hijos han sido el apoyo, ellos ya son adultos y tienen sus familias; el sueño de nuestra socia es poder seguir ayudando a sus dos nietos que ella tiene a su cargo, ya que son huérfanos, y ella es la que les ha brindado el cuidado y quiere que sigan estudiando para verlos realizados.
texts.en:
Rosa is a great lady, and very hard working. She is a person with special skills - she told us she feels satisfaction in her work, which is the sale of fast food. She is helped by her eldest daughter who prepares the food. For some time, she has been a member of the Women in Progress Communal Bank. Through the loans she has received from the Foundation, her store has grown. Now she'll be able to invest in improvements to the space where she operates her shop and buy more food such as bananas, cheese, and oils. At 58 years of age, she is a very active woman. She has been a widow for 13 years and her children have provided a her with lot of support, as they are grown with families of their own. Her dream is to be able to continue helping her two orphaned grandchildren, who are in her care. She is the one who has supported and cared for them and she wants them to pursue their studies and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, meat, potatoes, bananas, cheese, vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: La Joya Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "LA JOYA  " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, en todo este tiempo demostraron ser  personas responsables, puntuales  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Sandra  quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. salchipapas  en el mercado 10 D. febrero  por las noches ella es  casada  y tiene 4 hijos pequeños, su esposo es taxista juntos trabajan por el bienestar D. su familia, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para poder realizar sus salchipapas y tambien la compra D. garrafa D. gas licuado. 

Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Nilda quien es madre soltera  y tiene 4 hijos pequeñas y su negocio es una tienda D. barrio en su propio domicilio esta señora a pesar D. ser su segundo ciclo a demostrado ser     una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor

La Tesorera  es la Sra.  Luisa quien es casada  y  tiene 5  hijos es separada y tiene su pequeño taller D. costura dentro se su domicilio pero ella  sale a vender ambulando por los mercados D. Cochabamba especialmente en las ferias zonales, es una persona  activa y amable con sus compañeras, con el dinero del credito comprara tela para la confeccion D. sus productos. 

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO: En la foto se encuentran los integrantes por separado, ya que una D. las socias no pudo venir a la reunion y tuvieron que sacarle despues una foto.
texts.en:
The La Joya Communal Bank is in its eighth cycle. In all of that time they have shown themselves to be responsible, punctual, and hard-working people. This group is represented by the following members: Sandra is the president. She is the leader and founder of the group. She has a business selling “salchipapas” (a traditional dish maD. from fried potatoes, fried sausages and condiments). She sells in the 10 D. Febrero market in the evenings. She is married and has four small children. Her husband is a taxi driver. They work together for the well being of their family. She will use the loan to buy supplies to be able to make salchipapas. She will also buy a cylinder of liquid gas. Nilda is the secretary. She is a single mother with four small children. Her business is a neighborhood store, which is in her house. Even though this is her second cycle, she has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person who is punctual with her payments. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Luisa is the treasurer. She is married and has five children. She is separated. She has a small seamstress shop in her house. But, she leaves to sell as a street vendor at the Cochabamba markets and especially in the fairs in the area. She is an active person who is kind to her colleagues. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric to make her products. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan. Note: In the photo the members are separated because one of the members could not come to the meeting. They had to take her photo afterward.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell cornmeal porridge, fresh produce and school supplies.

loans.name: Juan Emidio

texts.es: Juan Emidio tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y venta de plátanos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar la situación de su familia, siempre le ha gustado ser un hombre responsable, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano y realizar la comprar de los plátanos. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima que será invertida en su negocio. Su deseo es establecer otro negocio para diversificar lo que el ofrece.
texts.en:
Juan Emidio is 47 years old. He makes a living as a pork butcher and banana vendor. He has dedicated himself to this business for more than three years, and he is always looking for a way to improve his family's situation. He has always enjoyed being a responsible man, which means he needs to get up early and buy the bananas. He is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials that will be invested in his business. His dream is to establish another business to diversify what he offers.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel Ernestina

texts.es:
Isabel de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos. Isabel era vendedora de carnes hace 12 años pero por cargar carnes tuvieron que operarla de la apéndice de urgencia, y tuvo que abandonar esa actividad por lo riesgoso que era. 

Isabel en la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta de pollos fuera de su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, comprar los pollos en criadero y ella se encarga de pelarlos y tenerlos listo para la venta. Cada pollo los vende desde $ 8.00 según la librar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para su negocio también una parte la quiere utilizar para adecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener una avícola (venta al por mayor de pollos).
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old, lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil, and has three children. Isabel has sold meats for 12 years but while loading the meats they had to do an emergency operation on her appendix so she had to abandon this activity because of its riskiness. Currently, Isabel has a chicken stand outside of her house where she works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She buys the chickens from a farm, and she is in charge of plucking them and getting them ready to be sold. Each chicken is sold for a minimum of $8.00, according to their weight. With this loan, Isabel would like to buy chickens for her business. She also wants to use a part of the loan to improve her house. In the future she would like to have her own poultry (sell chickens at wholesale).

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Mujeres Comprometidos Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina Mujeres Comprometidas y todas las integrantes se encuentran trabajando y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Una de las señoras muy trabajadoras que esta dentro del comité es la señora María quien se dedica a  Repostería para generar ingresos y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
En su actividad actualmente le va muy bien y ya que cuenta con este ingreso pero no lo suficiente para el proyecto que tiene que es la de ampliar la habitación de sus hijos solicita del  préstamo para concretar la idea.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres Comprometidas and all of the members work and help each other to prosper. One of the women who is very hardworking is María. She dedicates herself to baking to make a living and help her family with the household expenses. Currently, this is going very well for her since she has this income, but it is not enough for the project she is working on, to expand her children's room. She is requesting this loan to make the idea a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Janneth Margoth

texts.es:
Janneth Margoth T. G. tiene 52 años, es soltera, y vive con su mama de 85 años de edad. 
Ellas viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
Janneth es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas del Cantón  Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.
Janneth tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas  y bazar.  Ella compra sus productos en Guayaquil y en Bucay y vende en Santa Rosa de Agua Clara.
Janneth solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio.  Su meta es agrandar el negocio o tener una microempresa.  Los desafíos que ella enfrenta en el negocio es la competencia y el desafío en su familia es la salud.
Por lo tanto, su familia es bien católica y unida.
texts.en:
Janneth Margoth T. G. is 52 years old, single, and lives with her 85-year-old mother. They live in Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar. Janneth is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, which is located 2 hours away from Chillanes canton. There are 15 members of the group, and most of them have small businesses. Janneth’s business consists of a small general store with phone booths. She purchases her products in Guayaquil and Bucay and then sells them in Santa Rosa de Agua Clara. Janneth is asking for a loan so that she can increase her business. Her goal is to enlarge her business or to have a small company. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is competition, while the biggest challenge in her family right now is health issues. Therefore, her family is devoutly Catholic and very close.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business at her small general store

loans.name: Adeilada

texts.en:
Adeilada is a 46-year-old mother of seven who lives in Calle Blancos, San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She lives with her husband, colleague and son.

The loan officer that has been working with Adelaida describes her as a woman with a fighting spirit. Despite difficult circumstances, she has managed to raise her children independently, harnessing her sewing skills to earn an income. She has worked as a seamstress for the past eighteen years and has great ambition to improve her standard of living and that of her children.

Adeilada currently works with three sewing machines, which she has acquired one by one over the years. These machines have served her well in the past; however, they are now dated and no longer suit her production needs. For this reason, she is applying for a loan with Fundacion Mujer, to purchase two new sewing machines in an effort to increase her productive capacity.

Adeilada has a sewing workshop that she runs out of a rented house in Calle Blancos. Her main client is a local business named Greenbag that calls her when it has work for her to do. A company representative arrives at Adeilada´s workshop and explains to her the details of the work to be carried out. When Adeilada has finished the agreed upon work, she calls the business to arrange a pick up.

Adeilada's longterm goal is to have a sewing workshop outside of her home, with many machines and employees. Her main obstacle at the moment is her lack of quality sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase two new sewing machines

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel A. G. tiene 44 años de edad, es viudo desde hace 9 años, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con el padre y ya tiene propia familia formada.
El señor Miguel tiene un ingreso fijo ya que trabaja como fletero  para una empresa privada.
El desea mucho terminar con la construcción de la muralla de su casa ya para el resultará mas segura su casa despues de la construccion, para este proyecto solicita un préstamo y agradece a la Fundacion Y Kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
Miguel A. G. is 44 years old and has been a widower for 9 years. He has 1 son, who lives with him and has already started his own family. Miguel has a fixed income from his work as a freight driver for a private company. He really wants to finish constructing the wall of his house, since finishing the construction will make his home more secure. He is asking for a loan for this project, and is grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bricks to finish building the wall of his house

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena G. O. tiene 28 años de edad. Ella es casada, y tiene 2 hijos: Danita de 5 años y Patricio de 9 meses.  Viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

María Elena es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.

Al momento, María Elena se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su domicilio y tiene una mini tienda. Ella compra los productos  para su pequeño negocio en Bucay. Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio.  Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elena G. O. is 28 years old, married, and has two children: Danita (age 5) and Patricio (age 9 months). They live in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. María Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. At the moment, María Elena devotes her time to performing her household chores and managing a tiny store. She buys products in Bucay for her small business. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her business

loans.name: Hernán Leónidas

texts.es:
Hernán Leónidas P. H. tiene 20 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Hernán es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios. Hernán se dedica a la venda de productos que compra en Bucay cada semana pero eventual los domingos. 

Su sueño seria de poder formalizar un negocio de una tienda y de poder incrementar su negocio. Por el momento, no encuentra ningún desafío mayor.
texts.en:
Hernán Leónidas P. H. is 20 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. Hernán sells products that he buys in Bucay every week, mostly on Sundays. His dream is to have a formal location for his store and increase his business. At the moment, Hernán does not face any major challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase his business

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
PERCY ROBERTH, TIENE 38 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO Y VIVE EN LA ZONA D. LA LIBERTAD EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS AL IGUAL QUE SUS 8 COMPAÑEROS DEL GRUPO "MANOS FORJADORAS", QUIENES LO ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTE D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE TRES AÑOS, UN AMIGO LO ANIMÓ A PONER SU PROPIA BOTICA, EMPEZÓ CON MUY POCO CAPITA, SÓLO VENDÍA LO QUE SON MEDICAMENTOS BÁSICOS Y QUIE NO COSTABAN MUCHO.
CON MUCHO TRABAJO HA CONSEGUIDO QUE CRESCA SU BOTICA Y A LA VEZ CON LAS GANANCIAS D. SUS VENTAS HA REMODELADO LA CASA QUE LE DEJARON COMO HERENCIA SUS PADRES.
SU PRÓXIMO PROYECTO ES APERTURAR OTRA BOTICA Y MAS ADELANTE TENER UNA CADENA D. BOTICAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA LA COMPRA D. UNA COMPUTADORA YA QUE LE SERÍA D. MUCHA UTILIDAD PARA EL CONTROL D. SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
Percy Roberth, 38, is single and lives in the La Libertad zone in the Comas district along with his 8 companions in the group “Manos Forjadoras” [Forging Hands], who elected him to be president of the group’s Board of Directors. Three years ago, a friend encouraged him to set up his own pharmacy. He began with very little capital and sold only some very basic medicines that did not cost much. Through much work he has maD. his pharmacy grow and with the profits from his sales he has remodeled the house that his parents left him as an inheritance. His next project is to open another pharmacy and down the road to have a chain of pharmacies. He will use the requested loan to purchase a computer since it would be very useful in the management of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his pharmacy

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Roxana P. es una de  las 10 integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal Nueva Esperanza actualmente  casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años es por ellos que la motiva a seguir luchando. Decide emprender hace 5 años  en el negocio de una pequeña librería que acondiciono en su domicilio, empezó con una pequeña vitrina en donde exhibía  los útiles (cuadernos, papel  bond, entre otros). Sus ingresos fueron mejorando  con el tiempo, logrando adquirir  2 stantes grandes, 5 computadoras y  una fotocopiadora con el transcurrir el tiempo, hoy en su librería brinda el servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet y fotocopias.
Ella notaba que su ingreso iba mejorando  y en un  momento apropiado  por intermedio de una amiga  llego a Edaprospo , Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en  la mercadería de su librería  productos que  se venden  a menudo,  el préstamo actual que  recibió de Edaprospo lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería tanto en útiles escolares como también 3 cajas grandes  de hojas blancas que utiliza constantemente en su fotocopiadora.
Las metas que se ha propuesto es de ofrecer la venta de libros de distintas editoriales y sobre todo lo esencial de toda persona  el de apoyar a sus menores  hijos en todo.
texts.en:
Roxana P. is one of the 10 members of Alcanía Comunal Nueva Experanza (New Hope Community Bank), is now married, and has two children ages 7 and 5 who motivate her to continue fighting. She decided 5 years ago to start a business: a small book store out of her home, that began as a small shop window in which she exhibited school supplies (note books, bond paper, among others). Her profits improved with time, allowing her to buy 2 big shelves, 5 computers and a photocopier with the passing of time, today in her book store she offers the service of renting internet booths and photocopiers. She noticed that her profits were improving and at the right moment by way of a friend, she came to Edaprospo. She invested her first loan in the merchendise of her book store products that are sold frequently, the loan that she received now from Edaprospo she will invest in the purchase of her merchandise as well as in school supplies such as 3 large boxes of white papers that she constantly uses in her photocopier. The goal that she has proposed is to offer the sale of books from different publishers and above all the essential of every person - the support of her young children in everything.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EN LA COMPRA DE SU MERCADERIA COMO UTILES ESCOLARES

loans.name: Edy De La Mar

texts.es:
La Sra Edy D. la Mar R. tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con la misma, ya tiene propia familia formada.
DesD. hace 5 años atrás empezó con el negocio D. Venta D. Comida para algunos personales D. empresas cercana a su domicilio.
Con el crédito obtenido D. la fundación estará comprando una cocina eléctrica D. 6 hornallas y horno, por que la cocina que tiene ya no le es suficiente para la demanda D. clientes. 
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Edy D. la Mar R. is 65 years old, married, and has an adult son who lives with her and has his own family. Five years ago, she started selling food to people who worked at businesses located near her home.

The loan she obtained from Fundación Paraguaya will be used to buy an electric stove that has six burners and an oven. The current stove she has is not sufficient for meeting the demands of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electric stove

loans.name: Mirla Macrina

texts.es:
Mirta tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en el distrito pesquero de Santa Rosa, un distrito que pertenece al circuito turístico de playas de la región Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, su negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que se genera mas ingresos, las ganancias que posee de estas actividades son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, por lo que trata de mantenerlas siempre.

Mirta desea captar mas clientes para poder percibir mas ingresos y salir adelante, para ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que desea invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Mirta es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior. Anteriormente ella ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución, demostrando ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos
texts.en:
Mirta is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the fishing district of Santa Rosa, which is part of the circuit of tourist beaches in Lambayeque region. The district is located 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Mirta has been selling basic necessities and groceries out of a store in her home for more than six years. Her business has earned a good reputation thanks to the excellent service she provides to her customers. In addition, Mirta owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle attached to a cabin used for transporting cargo or passengers) that helps generate extra income. The earnings from all of her business activities have been a great help in supporting the family and maintaining the household finances. Mirta wants to attract more customers so that she can improve her revenue and get ahead. In order to do this, she hopes to expand her business by acquiring more products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve her goal. Mirta is a hardworking woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. Her greatest wish is to grow as an entrepreneur and provide her children the opportunity to study for a college degree. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is prompt and responsible when submitting her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen Patricia E. M. tiene 35 años de edad y vive sola con sus 2 hijos, John de 20 años y Francisco de 17 años, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Carmen es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.

Se dedica a la cría de cerdos y aves.  Compra en almacenes distribuidores en el cantón Bucay y comercialízalos en su hogar.
Carmen solicita el préstamo para la crianza y el engorde de cerdos. Su meta es superar las metas propuestas. Cuando Carmen no trabaja, pasa el tiempo con sus hijos y cuida de sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia E. M. is 35 years old and a single mother of two children, John (age 20) and Francisco (age 17). They live in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. Carmen raises pigs and poultry. She buys her animals from the distribution warehouses in the canton of Bucay and then sells them from home. Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can raise and fatten her pigs. She hopes to exceed the goals she has set for herself. When she is not working, Carmen spends time with her children and cares for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising and fattening pigs

loans.name: Grecia Edith

texts.es:
Grecia Edith P. L. tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Erika de 22 años y Fernando de 20 años. Ella vive son su marido y 2 hijos el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Grecia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.

Se dedica a la crianza de pollos y también tiene otro trabajo por el fin de semana. Grecia compra sus pollos y las vitaminas que ellos necesitan en Bucay. Grecia solicita el crédito para la crianza de pollos. Su meta es incrementar más galpones para poner más pollos. Su mayor desafío es la competencia para vender el pollo: el problema es que en esta temporada hay demasiados pollos y por eso baja el precio.
texts.en:
Grecia Edith P. L. is 39 years old, married, and has two children, Erika (age 22) and Fernando (age 20). She lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. Grecia is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. Grecia raises chickens and also has another job on the weekends. She purchases her chickens and the vitamins they need in Bucay. Grecia is requesting a loan for raising her chickens. Her greatest challenge is the amount of competition selling chickens. Since there is a large supply of chickens available at the moment, prices are lower.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising chickens

loans.name: Rosado Karina

texts.es:
Karina de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, hace ocho años atrás invirtió sus ahorros en una cabina telefónicas en su casa, para prestarle el servicio a sus vecinos, con los ingresos poco a poco incremento su negocio. 

Karina a hecho un pequeño Cyber en su casa y ha ubicado las cabinas conjuntamente para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También vende chip para teléfonos, y recargas para teléfonos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar dos computadoras para su Cyber, una de sus metas es tener una linea de Cyber en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Karina is 39 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. Eight years ago, she used her savings to install telephone booths in her house so that she could provide calling services to her neighbors. With her earnings, she was able to gradually increase her business.

Karina has also established a small cybercafé in her home next to the phone booths so that she could provide better service to her customers. She also sells single use and rechargeable calling cards. With her loan, Karina wants to buy two computers for her cybercafé. One of her goals is to have a chain of cybercafés throughout Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two computers

loans.name: Xenia Jaquelin

texts.es:
La sra. Xenia G. es una mujer joven emprendedora que se dedica al negocio de pulperia,
Xenia es bien dedicada a su familia y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a sus estudios, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para atender a sus clientes, Xenia vive con su madre y toda via Xenia no tiene esposo, es soltera 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor para su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Xenia G. is an enterprising young woman who manages her own store. She is dedicated to her family and attends classes in her free time. Every day, she wakes up early so that she can attend to her customers. Xenia is single and lives with her mother.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise in bulk for her business so that she can generate additional income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Renacer En Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo REnacer en Cristo esta compuesto por tres socios, Roberto (venta de pollitos) Elba (venta de Comida) y Blanca (carpinteria), la mayoria de los socios venden sus productos en una aldea del municipio de Villa Nueva. Roberto tiene un año de vender pollitos se vio en la necesidad de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que antes se dedicaba a la albañileria pero por falta de trabajo y la necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante para brindarles un mejor futuro ahora es comerciante y ha tenido incremento en sus ventas. El sueño de Roberto y de las demas socias es poder crecer como empresarios y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que allos puedan ser persona de bien, tambien esperan tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer en Cristo” (Revived in Christ) consists of three members: Roberto (who sells chicks), Elba (who sells food), and Blanca (who engages in carpentry).

Most of the members sell their products in one of the neighborhoods in the town of Villa Nueva. Roberto began selling chicks a year ago out of necessity. He previously worked as a mason, but due to a lack of jobs he needed a way to support his family and provide them a better future. Roberto is a businessman now and needs to increase his sales. He and the other members want to grow as entrepreneurs and provide a better future for their children so that they can develop into good people. They also hope to gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising & selling chicks

loans.name: Eddy Arnulfo

texts.es:
El señor Eddy Arnulfo G., es mayor de edad y habita con su mujer en el Barrio Buena Vista, su esposa es comerciante y tiene un taller de madera, realiza muebles mediante órdenes de trabajo, así se ganan el sustento diarios de la familia, fue hace 25 años que con su esfuerzo propio logro la apertura de su propio negocio.

A futuro desea realizar unas mejoras a la infraestructura de su taller, pero primero solicita un préstamo la compra de un mayor inventario de materia prima para la ejecución de muebles que pueda llevar a ofertar a los mercados capitalinos. Un apoyo económico a la familia García aportara a un cambio significativo a la economía de hogar, en el desarrollo de nuevas inversiones que representen  fuentes de ingresos y la estabilidad de las comodidades de la familiares.
texts.en:
Sr. Eddy Arnulfo G. is an older gentleman who lives in the neighborhood of Buena Vista. His wife is a merchant while he operates a woodworking shop where he makes furniture based on orders that he receives. This is how he earns money to meet the daily needs of his family. Eddy has invested 25 years worth of effort into maintaining his business.

In the future, he wants to make improvements to the infrastructure of his workshop. His first loan was used to buy a large inventory of raw materials for making furniture to sell in the capital markets. Subsequent financial support to the G. family will bring about a significant change in their household finances. The development of new investment opportunities represents new sources of income that will help his family become more stable and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase woodworking materials

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel B. B. tiene 24 años, y vive con sus padres y su hijo Diego en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
María es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Se dedica al comercio. Compra y vende sus productos en Bucay cada fin de mes. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio. Su sueño seria de tener su proprio negocio. Ahorra el desafío que enfrenta es la competencia.
Le gusta pasar junto con su familia. Su mama también solicita un crédito para su negocio.



Maria Isabel is 24 years old and lives with her parents and her son Diego in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra).
Maria Isabel is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops
She dedicates herself to commerce. She purchases and sells her products at the end of the month in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her dream would be to have her own shop. The main challenge she faces today is competition.
She likes to spend time with her family. Her mother is also asking for a loan for her own business.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 24 years old and lives with her parents and her son Diego in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). Maria Isabel is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops She dedicates herself to commerce. She purchases and sells her products at the end of the month in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her dream would be to have her own shop. The main challenge she faces today is competition. She likes to spend time with her family. Her mother is also asking for a loan for her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
El señor Pánfilo es un comerciante joven de 34 años de edad, está en pareja hace 7 años con la sra Daniela Morel Báez , juntos tienen dos hijos una nena de 6 años y un varón de 2 años.  

Sus padres fueron los que desde chico le inculcaron y le enseñaron todo lo relacionado al comercio,  pues siempre tuvieron negocio, es más dice que toda la familia tienen su propia microempresa.

Cuando empezó a ser independiente, era distribuidor de huevos en las distintas despensas y comercios de los barrios , más adelante junto con su pareja decidieron tener un negocio propio y es así que puso una despensa bien surtida con, ventas de bebidas y productos a granel, además de carnes y mercerías.

El crédito que retira es para ellos un gran apoyo porque de esa manera puede acceder a mejores precios a la hora de la adquisición de sus mercaderías (bebidas, arroz, azúcar, carnes, yerba, productos a granel).
texts.en:
Pánfilo is a young 34 year old merchant. Daniela Morel Báez has been his life partner for seven years. They have two children, a six year old girl and a two year old boy. His parents were the ones who ever since he was a boy initiated him and taught him everything having to do with commerce. They always had a business. He further adds that the whole family has their own small business. When he started to become independent he was an egg distributor in different grocery stores and businesses in the neighborhoods. Later, he and his life partner decided to have their own business. That is how they set up a grocery store that is well stocked with drinks, Granel products, meats, and notions. The loan he takes out is a big help to them because that way he is able to get better prices when it is time to get his merchandise (drinks, rice, sugar, meat, yerba mate, and bulk products).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks, rice, sugar, meat, herbs, and bulk products

loans.name: Primitiva Del Carmen

texts.es: Primitiva del Carmen tiene 53 años, sus 4 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella realiza con Fundación. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy amable y cariñosa. El financiamiento es utilizado para la compra de cerdos ya que tiene que recorrer la comunidad en busca de los mejores cerdos y encontrarlos a buen precio. El deseo de ella es mejorar cada día en su actividad pues así lograría generar ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Primitiva del Carmen is 53 years old and has 4 children who work independently. This is not the first loan that she has received through Fundacion. She makes a living selling by butchering pigs, a business which she has done for over 12 years. She has always been characterized as a very friendly and caring person. This loan will be used for the purchase of pigs, since she has to travel around the community searching for the best pigs at a good price. Her goal is to improve each day in her activity, which will allow her to generate greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Nidia Encarnación

texts.es:
Nidia Encarnación P. V. tiene 42 años.  Es casada, tiene una hija Aina Maldonado de 7 años y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
Nidia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Nidia tiene su negocio proprio de cabinas telefónicas. Las compras las realiza en el cantón de Bucay. Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio. Su sueño seria de tener una empresa. Por el momento no enfrenta desafío mayor.
texts.en:
Nidia, 42 years old, is married and has a daughter Aina, who is 7 years old. They live in the county of Chillanes, in Bolivar province. Nidia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops. Nidia has her own business of phone booths. She buys them in the county of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to expand her business. Her dream would be to have a company. For the time being, she is not to facing any major challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
LAS MARGARITAS
El Grupo solidario Las Margaritas integradas por tres socias,  Francisca M.  A.,  Maria Florinda I. J.. Bilma Yesenia M. A.. Se dedican a distintas actividades venta de ropa típica, como güipiles típicos, fajas delantales típicos y venta de amueblados.  Francisca es soltera tiene 42 años de edad, Maria tiene 34 años,  y Bilma de 33 años de edad.  Tienen diferentes actividades pero el mismo proposito y un  mismo sueño. Bilma Yesnia tiene una venta de amueblados de sala, y comedor,   ella es una mujer emprendedoras reúne a dos compañeras para formar este pequeño grupo con el fin de aumentar su negocio y el sueño es que tengan màs capital  y mercadería para la venta para llevar a cabo sus sueños de cada uno, pero la que mas resalta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, y la  alimentación y tener vestuario.   El negocio vienen trabajando por cuatro y ocho años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, "Las Margaritas" is made up of three members: Francisca M. A., Maria Florinda I. J., and Bilma Yesenia M. A.. They make a living from various activities, including selling traditional clothing, aprons, and furniture. Francisca is 42 years old; Maria is 34; and Bilma is 33. Although they perform different activities, they have the same purpose and dreams. Bilma Yesnia has a store where she sells living room and dining room furniture. She is an enterprising woman who gathered two other partners together to form this small group with the purpose of expanding her business. Her dream is to have more working capital and more merchandise for sale, so that they can all achieve their dreams. However, the thing that stands out the most is to continue supporting their children, and to keep them well-fed and clothed. They have been running this business for 8 years now.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traditional dresses and aprons

loans.name: Alicia Berthilda

texts.es:
Alicia Berthilda C. B. tiene 49 años de edad y es casada, tiene  2 hijos, Luis de 10 años y Miguel de 8 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
Alicia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Alicia se dedica a la crianza de pollos que compra y venda en el cantón de Bucay. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio. Su meta seria seguir adelante.
En su tiempo libre, a Alicia le gusta preparar comidas.



Alicia is 49 years old, married and live with her husband and 2 children Luis (10) and Miguel (8) in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra)
Alicia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.
Alicia raises chicken she buys and sells in the canton of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her objective would be to go ahead.
In her free time, Alicia likes to cook.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old, married and lives with her husband and 2 children Luis (10) and Miguel (8) in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). Alicia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small businesses. Alicia raises chickens that she buys and sells in the canton of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her goal is to get ahead economically. In her free time, Alicia likes to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her business

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Diana Elisa P.  P., vive con su compañero de vida en el Barrio La Borgoña, su esposo labora como Maestro de Obra, apoyando con sus ingresos a los gastos que se incurre en el hogar, la señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene 16 años de trabajar en este rubro, siendo su madre quien la ayudo económicamente a ganarse la vida de esta manera.
