Uno de los principales problemas que posee en su hogar, es la escases de agua que le abastece solamente 2 días a la semana, uno de los planes para contrarrestar esta dificultad, es la adquisición de  un tanque de almacén de agua para los días de racionamiento, a futuro comprara un tramo para lograr una ampliación y mayor ofrecimiento de sus productos, por ahora solicita este préstamo para la  compra un mayor inventario de abarrotes y utensilios con el fin de surtir un poco más la venta, este apoyo les ayudara a futuro para subsidiar proyectos que sean de beneficio para toda la familia. Ellos son una familia muy humilde, pero que gozan del prestigio ante su comunidad como una familia responsable que se ha ganado su sustento con el trabajo honesto del día a día.
texts.en:
Diana Elisa P. P. lives with her life partner in the La Borgoña neighborhood. Her husband is a master builder, and his income helps to support the family's household expenses. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this line of work for 16 years; her mother helped her economically to be able to make a living in this way. One of the main problems they have in their house is the lack of water, which is supplied only 2 days a week. One plan to counter this difficulty is to acquire a water storage tank for the days of rationing. In the future she will buy a stand so that she can expand and offer more products. For now she requests this loan to buy a larger inventory of groceries and utensils with the objective of supplying more products for sale. This support will help them to afford future projects that will benefit the whole family. They are a very humble family, but they enjoy prestige in the community as they are a responsible family that has made its living with honest work, day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a larger inventory of products

loans.name: Alan Jhonatan

texts.es:
Alan tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Motupe, conocido por sus festividades religiosas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de viaje desde la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, el negocio le brinda la posibilidad agenciarse de su propia fuente de ingresos con los cuales solventa sus gastos personales y apoya al sostenimiento de su familia. Aunque tiene poca experiencia como empresario el sabe que para seguir manteniendo su pequeño negocio debe brindar productos de primera calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Alan desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que se vea surtido y pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alan es un joven emprendedor que trabaja arduamente para lograr sus metas, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su bodega para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran un joven honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Alan is 19 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in the Motupe district, known for its religious festivities. Motupe is in Lambayeque province, about an hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For one year, Alan has been working selling groceries and necessary goods in a store in his house. This business brings him the opportunity to have his own source of income for his personal expenses, as well as helping to sustain the family. Although he has little business experience, he knows that to continue his business, he needs to offer good quality products and treat his customers well. Alan would like to enlarge his business by purchasing more products to satisfy the demands of his clients. He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles to achieve this goal. Alan is a young entrepreneur who works hard to achieve his goals. His greatest desire is to continue enlarging his store to obtain a better quality of life. In his community, his neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem, and consider him an honest and hardworking young man.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory for store

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo  Nueva Esperanza  se conforma  por tres señoras  quienes se dedican  a diferentes negocios  viven en la aldea llamada Vista Hermosa  la señora Carolina T.   tiene su negocio de tortillería y a la vez tiene una venta  de regalos  que se encuentran  ubicados en su domicilio en el tiempo que le queda libre  después  de atender  su tortillería, atiende a sus 3 hijos  que estudian en la  Escuela de la misma aldea ella tiene  10 años  de dedicarse en sus negocios  , Hortencia  T.   se dedica a la venta de ropa típica  desde hace 6 años  la venta lo tiene ubicada en su casa, Angélica T.  tiene una tortillería  y tienda en su domicilio la cual ha trabajado desde hace 15 años ha trabajado muy duro y cuenta que su mamá le ha apoyado y animado para seguir con su negocio.  Cada una de ellas manifiesta que su objetivo es poder invertir en su negocio para que puedan tener todo lo necesario que piden los clientes y que puedan salir adelante con su negocios y con sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) is made up of 3 women who have different businesses. They live in a village called Vista Hermosa. Carolina T. has a tortilla business, and at times also sells gifts from her home in the free time that remains after she attends to her tortilla business. She has 3 children who attend school in the same village. She has had these businesses for 10 years. Hortencia T. has sold traditional Guatemalan clothing from her home for 6 years. Angélica T. has a tortilla business and store in her house, where she has worked very hard for 15 years. She tells us that her mother supported her and motivated her to continue with her business. Each of these women state that their objective is to be able to invest in their businesses so that they can have everything that their customers ask for, and can continue to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for businesses selling tortillas, gifts, and traditional clothing

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Antonio B. G., vive acompañado de su pareja de vida y su hijo de 2 años en el Barrio Raúl Roja,  él labora como maestro de obra siendo este la principal fuente de ingresos familiar. Su esposa realiza las labores domesticas.

El ha tenido desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, tiene problemas con el sistema eléctrico de su hogar y es por esta razón solita un préstamo para la compra de matariles eléctricos que le permitan realizar las reparaciones necesarias para el bien de los miembros de su hogar, debido a que un cortocircuito amenaza con la seguridad de la familia y la pérdida del hogar, ya que amenaza una amenaza de incendio se encuentra latente de no haber una reparación rápida.
texts.en:
Edgar Antonio B. G. lives with his life partner and their two year old son in the Raúl Roja neighborhood. He works as a master builder, and this is the primary source of income for the family. His wife does domestic work. For a long time he has had problems with the electrical system in his house. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy electric materials, which will allow him to make the necessary repairs. This is for the good of the members of his household because a short circuit threatens the safety of his family and the loss of his home. There is a potential threat of fire if the repairs are not done quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the electrical system in his house

loans.name: San Bernardo Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Bernardo esta ubicado en la Aldea San Bernardo en la ciudad de Choluteca, son cuatro mujeres las integrantes del grupo, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la sra. Damaris C. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en varios lugares de la comunidad de San Bernardo  Es madre de 3 hijos los cuales uno esta en la escuela y los demas en casa por ser pequeños de edad.
todos dependen de ella, es madre soltera y muy dedicada a su familia. Su mama vive cerca y le cuida sus bebes, una tiene de 45 dias de nacida el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa usada.

la sra. Gladis O. se dedica  a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, Gladis es madre de 5 hijos los cuales le ayudan en su negocio en hacer y vender las ricas tortillas, Gladis y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante  a su familia, ellos son bien unidos para trabajar. 

la sra. Catalina P. se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el kinder de su comunidad. Catalina es una sra. que se levanta a las 5 de  manaña para hacer sus  bocadillos para venderlos en el kinder. 
 Catalina  y su esposo que trabaja en una camaronera son bien unidos, los dos sacan adelante a sus hijos.
Tienen 6 hijos. el credito lo utilizara para comprar alimentos para hacer las golosinas.

la sra. Gladis C. es madre de un niño de 2 años,  se dedica  a la  venta de  golosinas y tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.  Gladis se levanta muy tempreno para atender a sus clientes.
 Gladis y su esposo trabajan duro para hacer su propia vivienda. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para su pulperia.
texts.en:
The San Bernardo group is located in the village of San Bernardo in the city of Choluteca. The group is comprised of four women. What follows are details of the different activities they do. Damaris C. sells used clothes in various places in the San Bernardo community. She has three children. One is in school, and the others are at home because they are so young. All of them are dependent upon her. She is a single mother, and she is very devoted to her family. Her mother lives close to her, and she takes care of the babies. One is 45 days old. She will use the loan to buy more used clothes. Gladis O. makes and sells tortillas. Gladis has five children, who help her in business of making and selling delicious tortillas. Gladis and her husband work hard to get their family ahead. They are very united in order to work. Catalina P. sells sweets at the kindergarten in her community. Catalina is a woman who gets up at five in the morning to make her snacks to sell at the kindergarten. Catalina and her husband work in a shrimp store, and they are very united. The two of them get their children ahead. They have six children. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for making the sweets. Gladis C. has a two year old son. She also sells sweets. She has a small mini-market in her house. Gladis gets up very early to tend to her customers. Gladis and her husband work hard to make their own house. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her mini-mart.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, water, churros, bread, bundle of clothes, rice, beans, tortillas, toilet paper, soaps, soups, shortening, oil, meats, sausages, and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es: El señor José Enrique C. es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo para sostener los gastos de la familia. José es padre de 3 pequeños por quienes sale adelante y desea darles una mejora calidad de vida, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos para darles una mejor atención. La protección es primordial en esta familia es por ello que el quiere un crédito para comprar un portón en su casa.
texts.en:
José Enrique C. is a man who is dedicated to his work in order to support the family expenses. José has three little ones for whom he gets ahead and wishes to give a better quality of life. His wife devotes herself to taking care of their children to give them better attention. Protection is fundamental in this family. That is why he wants a loan to be able to buy a gate for his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a metal gate

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El cliente es propietario de una despensa el cual lo maneja con su señora.
 Es padre de 2 hijos menores de edad, estudiantes. Don Miguel también es constructor, y albañil, es una persona trabajador, sacrificada y emprendedora, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo apoyado por su familia han llevado adelante el negocio, la educación de sus hijos y un nivel de vida bueno.
Miguel accedió al préstamo para invertir en la ampliación de su casa donde el mismo se encarga de realizar la construcción.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción y agradecimiento por la confianza al trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su negocio y la de su familia.-
texts.en:
This client owns a grocery store, which he manages with his wife. He has two minor children; they are students. Miguel is also a builder and a bricklayer. He is a hard-working, self-sacrificing, and enterprising person. Through sacrifice, effort, and support from his family he has gotten ahead in business, been able to educate his children, and has achieved a good standard of living. Miguel got the loan to invest in expanding his house. He personally will be in charge of the construction. The client expresses his satisfaction and gratitude for the trust shown in working with the Fundación. He is also grateful for the help in the development and growth of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks, wood, cement, and other things

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro José L., es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y alimentos  variados, ellos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a los estudios, ellos son una familia de limitados recursos, la cabeza del hogar labora como guarda de seguridad desde hace 7 años.

Ha sido con el apoyo de su esposa que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura del hogar, hace poco tuvieron un  préstamo con Afodenic con el fin  de realizar unas reparaciones en su vivienda es para este mismo fin que nuevamente solicitan un préstamo para continuar con los cambios, con el crédito compra los materiales de construcción que le permitan las edificaciones de dos cuartos, este apoyo les ofrecerá  una mejor independencia, para los hijos debido a que el mayor que ya cumple 19 años y les demanda su propio espacio, tras la culminación de este proyecto les brindara  la tranquilidad de poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor hogar donde habitar. Ha sido gracias a los fondos kiva que la familia ha mejorado las condiciones y comodidades en las que ellos habitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro José L. is married and his wife sells nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) and different prepared food. They have 3 children who are in school. They are a family with limited resources and the head of the family has been working as a security guard for the past 7 years. With the support of his wife, he has succeeded in improving their living conditions. A short time ago they had a loan from Afodenic so that they could make some repairs to their home. They are now asking for loan so that they will be able to continue with the improvements, and buy the construction materials that will allow them to build two rooms. This support will give more independence to their oldest son since he is turning 19, and needs his own space. With the fulfillment of this project they will be able to offer their children the tranquility of having a better home to live in. It's been thanks to the Kiva funds that this family has improved their living conditions and the comfort where they are living.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two rooms

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier González tiene una vivienda de interés social la cual quiere ir haciéndole reparaciones para que este en mejores condiciones. El crédito que solicita es para pintar las paredes por dentro y por fuera, también el desea levantar una barda en la parte de atrás del patio para dividir la casa del vecino y así no tener problemas en un futuro. Francisco y su esposa son personas trabajadora que la mayor parte del día se la pasan en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco has a home that he would like to renovate so that it is in better condition. With the loan that he is requesting he would paint the walls inside and outside. He would also like to erect a fence in the backyard in order to separate his home from the neighbor’s property. In this way he would avoid any potential problems with the neighbors. Francisco and his wife are hard workers that spend most of the day working at their jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his home

loans.name: Xiomara Magalis

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Magalis G. G., es una joven de 27 años de edad, soltera sin hijos que a su corta edad labora desde hace 15 años en la agricultura.

Uno de sus principales objetivos es la edificación de su propia vivienda, pero uno de los obstáculos que ha tenido en su carrera como agricultora, ha sido el robo de las cosechas que afecta de sobremanera sus ingresos. Fue con el apoyo económico y moral de su padre, que se inicio en este negocio, ahora ella solicita  de un préstamo para la diversificación de siembras que se consumen en masa, ya sea en la capital o sectores aledaños, con el crédito realizará las compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, que aporten a este fin , y le permitan a futuro la planificación de la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is a young person that is 27 years old, single and without children. Despite her young age, she has worked for fifteen years in agriculture. One of her main goals is to have a home. One of the obstacles she faces, that she has experienced in her agricultural career, is the way the theft of crops greatly affects earnings. It is with the economic support of her parents, who began this agricultural business, that she is requesting this loan. The loan will be used to provide a greater variety of plants that are generally utilized in the capital city or the outskirts. With this loan she will buy supplies, plants, fertilizers and pesticide, which will help her reach her goals. This will allow her to plan the construction of her house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy pesticides, fertilizers and growing supplies

loans.name: Greys Beatriz

texts.es:
Grey de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo es chofer de un bus ellos tienen dos hijos. Hace 15 años atrás ella vivía en la Sierra del Ecuador, pero como no tenia mucho dinero decidió vivir en la costa de Guayaquil e invertir sus ahorros en vivires y venderlos a los vecinos.   

Grey poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar aceite, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un negocio mas grande, con vitrinas y perchas.
texts.en:
Grey is 40 years old and lives in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her husband is a bus driver, and they have two children. Fifteen years ago she was living the mountains of Ecuador, but since she didn’t have much money, she decided to live on the coast of Guayaquil and invest her savings in basic provisions, selling to her neighbors. Grey gradually expanded her store, and although she does not have a number of items, she continues to work to increase her stock. She sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy provisions such as rice, sugar, and oils for her store. In the future she would like to have a larger business, with display windows and clothes racks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Casimiro Refugio

texts.es: El señor Casimiro es un señor dispuesto a sobresalir a pesar de su edad el no quiere ser ninguna carga para su único hijo, desde hace 40 años tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura de automóviles llamado “Z.”, de esta manera es como el percibe ingresos para mantener a su esposa y los gastos del hogar. Casimiro en este momento requiere de un apoyo económico para seguir trabajando en su taller actividad que realiza desde que el era muy joven, este crédito lo quiere para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Casimiro is a man who is ready to get ahead despite his age. He does not wish to be a burden for his only child. For 40 years, he has had an automobile body shop, called “Z..” This is how he has derived income to support his wife and cover household expenses. At this time, Casimiro needs financial support in order to continue working in his shop. He has been working in this business since he was very young, and wants a loan in order to stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Oscar Rafael

texts.es:
Oscar en un joven emprendedor que hace mas de un año se inicio en el mundo comercial habilitando una local donde se vende todo tipo de bebida, el mismo se encarga de la atención al cliente en su negocio, es soltero y vive con sus padres quienes lo apoyan en su emprendimiento, recurrió a la institución .
Oscar opto por el crédito con la Fundación para adquirir mas más mercaderías(vinos, cervezas, licores y otros) con el fin de ir aumentando el margen de su negocio.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su negocio.-
texts.en:
Oscar is a young entrepreneur that more than a year ago started working in the commercial world by opening a store where he sells all kinds of drinks, client service is provided by himself, he is single and lives with his parents who support his entrepreneurship. Oscar requested a loan with the Foundation to acquire more merchandise (wine, beer, liquor and other) with the purpose of increasing the profit margin in his business. He manifests the satisfaction he gets by working with the Foundation because of the support he receives for the development and growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks such as wine, beer and liquor

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio P. V., es un hombre de 38 años que habita con su pareja de vida en el Barrio Buenos Aires, su señora labora en las tareas del hogar y apoya en los trabajos de la finca, debido a que el señor se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 18, ellos tienen 4 hijos que estudian y apoyan también a los trabajos de la siembra.

Uno de los problemas que más ha afectado las cosechas ha sido la infección de plagas, que en la cosecha pasada redujo significativamente la producción, ocasionándoles problemas económicos, es por esta misma razón que él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizants y pesticidas  que aporten un mantenimiento optimo a los sembrados, y a futuro le generen los recursos monetarios para  la planificación de proyectos que aporten al mejoramiento  de los niveles de vida da la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio P. V. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. His wife, who is his partner in life, does the household chores and helps with the work around their farm. Manuel has been farming for 18 years. They have four children who are in school and also help with the farm work.

One problem that has impacted his crops is the infestation of pests. His previous harvest was reduced significantly and resulted in financial problems. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides so that he can optimally maintain his crops. In the future, he hopes to have the financial resources to plan improvement projects that will raise his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides

loans.name: Johanna Valeria

texts.es:
Johanna A. es una socia joven  del bankito Las Flores, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca cuna de deportistas, escritores que han puesto muy en alto no solo el nombre de esta ciudad sino del país entero, y es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador. 

Nuestra socia es tesorera en la junta Parroquial del agua potable labora en esta actividad hace cuatro años de lunes a viernes y en sus tiempos libres vende los productos Yanbal. Johana tiene 22 años de edad es casada y fruto de su unión matrimonial concibió un hijo de apenas un mes de nacido, su esposo tiene una mecánica industrial en sociedad y como aun no tienen viven  en casa de un familiar.

 Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace un año y fue gracias a su mamá  que  la incentivo a que ingrese a este hermoso grupo de mujeres carismáticas y luchadoras, con su crédito  comprará cremas, perfumes, maquillajes, esmaltes, sombras  y más productos cosméticos Yanbal.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Johanna A. is a young member of the bank Las Flores. She lives in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the cradle of athletes and writers who have brought fame not only to the city but the entire country. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. Our member is the treasurer of the parrish board of potable water. She has been working at this activity for four years from Monday to Friday. In her free time, she sells Yanbal products. Johana is 22 years old, married, and has a son who is barely a month old. Her husband is an industrial mechanic in a business and since they still don't have their own house, they live in a relative's. She has been in the communal bank for a year and it was her mother who motivated her to join this beautiful group of charismatic, fighter women. With the loan, she will buy creams, perfume, makeup, nail polish, eyeshadow, and more Yanbal cosmetic products. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, makeup, nail polish, eyeshadow and more Yanbal products.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es:
Orlando Antonio L. T., es un joven de 27 años de edad que habita con su pareja en el barrio El Edén, su esposa se dedica a las tareas domesticas, uno de los planes que con mas afán los tienen es la construcción de un cuarto que le permita mejores comodidades para todos, ellos tienen un hijo de la edad de 2 años, se dedica a la agricultura y fue gracias al apoyo de su padre, quien le enseño a labrar las tierras desde hace 15 años atrás.

Dentro de sus principales proyectos, esta la compra de insumos para realizar un mantenimiento  a las tierras de su finca, es por tal razón que solicita un préstamo para la adquisición de insumos vegetativo, fertilizantes, y pesticidas que favorezcan a los sembradillos y a futuro la economía de la familia brindando los recursos necesarios para la inversión a nuevas inversiones tales ocmo la diversificación de los cultivos por los de café y plátano, estos dos se comercializan muy bien debido al consumo que tienen a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Orlando Antonio L. T. is a young man who is 27 years of age and lives in the neighborhood of El Edén. His wife is in charge of the household duties. One of his plans that he is eager about is the construction of a room that will make everyone more comfortable. Orlando and his wife have a two year old son. He earns a living by farming and has the help of his father, who taught him how to work on the land when he was 15 years old.

Among his main projects is the purchase of supplies so that he can maintain his farmland. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can acquire farming supplies, fertilizers, and pesticides to promote the development of his crops and provide for his family’s financial future. He hopes to have the necessary resources to invest in new projects such as diversifying his crops by planting coffee and bananas. These two crops sell very well since they are consumed throughout the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Olga Yolanda

texts.es:
La  señora  Olga P. es socia del bankito Las Flores, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, metrópoli reconocida por ser la  tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua, dentro de  sus atractivos turísticos tenemos su centro histórico que  fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta en un almacén de pernos y accesorios de automóviles, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años,  labora de lunes a viernes y le va muy bien en su negocio.  Se encuentra en el  segundo ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal y con el dinero que reciba comprará pernos, plumas, espejos, entre otros accesorios de autos para incrementar su negocio 

Olga tiene 43 años, es casada y madre de dos  hijos que se encuentran de 22 y 16 años, su primera hija es profesional en medicina mientras que su otro hijo  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad,  su esposo tiene un taller propio de mecánica y latonería (endereza las latas de los vehículos) y  gracias a su trabajo cuenta con su casa propia.

Su meta es comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
Olga P. is a member of the bank Las Flores. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for being the third most important city of Ecuador. It is characterized by maintaining the beauty and tranquility of an old city. Among its tourist attractions are its historical center, declared Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO in 1999. Our member sells in a hardware and car accesories store. She has been doing this for 6 years. She works Mondays through Fridays and the business is going very well. She is in her second cycle with the communal bank and with the money she receives she will buy bolts, wipers, and mirrors, among other car accessories, to increase her business. Olga is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of two children who are 22 and 16 years old. Her oldest daughter is a medical professoinal while her son studies at a high school in town. Her husband has his own garage and bodyshop (he repairs autobodies). Thanks to their work, they have their own home. Her goal is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts, wipers, and mirrors, among other car accessories.

loans.name: Lucila Del Socorro

texts.es: Lucila Del Socorro tiene 56 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable pues siempre se ha dedicado a ofrecerle a su familia el bienestar necesario. Ella mantiene a sus 3 hijos, pues siempre está pendiente lo que ellos necesitan. Es por eso que está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su pulpería. El deseo de Lucila es ampliar su negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Lucila Del Socorro is 56 years old and manages her own store. She has been in business for more than five years. Lucila has always been a responsible person who tries to provide what is needed for her family’s welfare. She has three children to support and is always concerned about their needs. For this reason, she is requesting this loan so that she can buy materials for her store. Lucila wants to expand her business and keep it active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un padre de familia que tiene 70 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a un nieto menor de edad en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, un distrito ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de ropa, zapatillas y maletines en su vivienda, adicionalmente ofrece su mercadería los dias domingo en el mercado del cercano distrito de Oyotún ( ubicado a unos 8 km de distancia de su vivienda), el compra sus productos al por mayor en la ciudad de Chiclayo y siempre trata de obtener productos de calidad para mantener a su clientela fiel ya que esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para mantener a su familia.

Roberto desea ampliar su negocio para captar mas clientes y así poder percibir mas ingresos que le permitan salir adelante, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Roberto es una persona emprendedora y que a pesar de su edad aún tiene ansias de trabajar  para ganarse el sustento, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder tener un negocio mas estable y tener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es una persona querida y estimada.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 70 year old father who lives with his wife and young grandson in the farming district of Nueva Arica, which is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Roberto has been selling clothes, shoes, and satchels from his home. He also sells merchandise on Sundays at the market near the district of Oyotún (which is approximately 8km from his home). Roberto buys his products wholesale in the city of Chiclayo and always tries to acquire high quality products so that he maintains a loyal customer base. His business is the only source of income that goes to support his family.

Roberto wants to expand his business and attract more customers so that he can generate more income to get ahead. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can achieve his goal.

Roberto is an enterprising individual who still yearns to work and earn a living despite his age. His greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that he can have a more stable business and a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, Robert is someone who is admired and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand his business

loans.name: Mildred Patricia

texts.es:
En Malambo una tierra fundada por indígenas bajo el mando del cacique que lleva su nombre, vive Mildred R. D. 35 años, ella  tiene una farmacia donD. venD. medicamentos en general, como antigripales, purgantes y analgésicos. Como en los ambientes tropicales  es muy común  que aparezcan enfermedades virales, gripales y diarreicas, y a la farmacia con mucha frecuencia le solicitan medicamentos ordenados por los médicos  para este fin, ella está aplicando a su primer credito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor D. $1.500.000 para comprar antigripales, analgésicos y purgantes principalmente. 
Su negocio nació hace mas D. un año aprovechando la experiencia D. su hermano, quien se desempeña hace mas D. 15 como farmaceuta y le ayudó a conseguir los créditos iniciales para poner en marcha su negocio, y aun la sigue asesorando.  Mildred espera que además D. tener la línea D. droguería, pueda también implementar sus conocimientos D. salud e higiene cosmética, surtiendo en esta línea y adquiriendo poco a poco  equipos especializados para estos tratamientos. 
El principal desafío que se le ha presentado en algunas ocasiones, es que ha perdido ventas por no tener ciertos medicamentos, porque la farmacia requiere tener D. todo un poco para responder a la comunidad.
Mildred es una mujer trabajadora, tambien obtiene ingresos adicionales como auxiliar fisioterapeuta visitando empresas y es muy conocida en su barrio Bellavista, muy cerca al parque la Convivencia D. Malambo, donD. se promueve la cultura del buen   trato con madres comunitarias y los niños D. esta comunidad,
por eso se presentan muestras teatrales, artísticas y culturales.
texts.en:
Malambo is named after the chief of the indigenous people who founded the town. This is where 35 year old Mildred R. lives. She manages a pharmacy where she sells general medicines such as influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics. Viral illnesses, influenza, and diarrhea are very common in tropical environments so her pharmacy receives many orders for medicines prescribed by doctors. Mildred is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 1,500,000 COP to buy primarily influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics.

She started her business more than a year ago in order to take advantage of her brother’s experience. He worked as a pharmacist for more than 15 years and helped her secure the loans needed to start her business. Mildred continues to receive advice from him. She hopes to have a chain of drugstores so that she can utilize her knowledge of health, hygiene, and cosmetics. In order to do this, she wants to gradually acquire specialized equipment to proviD. these treatments. Her main challenge is not having certain medications, which has resulted in a loss of sales on a few occasions. Pharmacies are required to have a little bit of everything in order to respond to the community.

Mildred is a hardworking woman who earns extra income working as an assistant physiotherapist. She visits businesses and is well-known in her neighborhood of Bellavista, which is near Convivencia Park in Malambo. This community is known for promoting a culture that encourages the good treatment of mothers and their children. The area is also recognized for its theatrical, artistic, and cultural events.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is 42 years old. Lilibeth is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for this activity. 

In 2002, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lilibeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 59 years old. Anita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a hog fattening business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia B. is from the village of Lower Langcangan. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a "sari-sari" (convenience) store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from this activity. In 2007, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita L. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Pedrita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Pedrita operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish, in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Pedrita joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Pedrita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lydia

loans.name: Joynie

texts.en:
33 year old Joynie B. is a very industrious and loving wife to her husband. Because her husband’s income from being a farmer is just small and seasonal, she wants to earn in her own way to augment her husband’s earnings.  This is the reason why she raises pigs as her business.

The loans she has availed herself of from ASHI since the start of her membership supports her financial need to grow her pigs until they are ready for selling in the market, either alive or slaughtered. The profit she gains from this business is her means to support the need of her only child, who is now five years old. 

Joynie and her husband are very enthusiastic to grow their hog raising business into a piggery which raises a large number of pigs in their backyard because they realize their profit would be much larger once a large volume of pigs are sold at the same time. With that level of business, Joynie believes that she would be able to put aside a savings fund for the future education of her child until graduation from college.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and necessary feeds for growing and fattening.

loans.name: Theoung

texts.en:
Theoung V., 48, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples.

V. produces Cambodian noodles for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a teacher for a Christian organization, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.

V. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new machine for making the noodles. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for making noodles

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Mrs. N., 36, lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She currently stays at home to either care for two young school-aged children or to do daily tasks for her family. Sometimes she needs to work as a laborer and is hired by people to assist them with things that need to be done. 

Mrs. N. depends on her husband for the main source of income. He appears in the photo above. He is a truck driver in a small firm and gets a suitable monthly salary to provide food for the entire family. Mrs. N. has requested a loan to add to the money she has saved in order to purchase a little piece of land, on which she plans to build a new house in which to live.

loans.use: To purchase land on which to build a house

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.ru:
Исмаилова Айнура – лидер этой группы. Для Айнуры каждый будний день начинается с того, что она рано утром, доет своих коров и сдаёт молоко на продажу. Вот уже пятнадцать лет Айнура за счёт молока, зарабатывает около пяти тысяч сомов в месяц. Для Айнуры, у которой трое детей, это конечно же очень малые деньги, и поэтому все эти годы Айнура старалась искать себе дополнительный источник заработков. А именно, она помимо коров, держит ещё кое – какую живность: несколько овец и бычков. По мере необходимости, Айнура может выводить скотину на базар, продавать её и использовать деньги на повседневные или срочные нужды. У Айнуры сейчас ребёнок дошкольного возраста, и ей вскоре придётся увеличить расходы, и Айнура прекрасно это осознаёт. Поэтому она вместе с мужем, который имел издавна опыт в земледелии , решила параллельно заниматься выращиванием сельскохозяйственной продукции. Айнура приняла очень важное решение, так как последующее развитие дел показало значимость диверсификации источников заработка. Айнуре и её мужу удалось увеличить поголовье скота, отремонтировать дом и значительно улучшить свои жилищные условия. К тому же Айнура смело идёт на дело, зная, что всегда найдёт нужную поддержку со стороны мужа, который активно ей помогает по хозяйству и всегда рядом. Сейчас Айнура нуждается в кредите, чтобы вложить средства для обработки земли. 

Партнёры Айнуры по группе: 

Макишевой Айнуре тридцать восемь. Она замужем и у неё пятеро детей. Старшему сыну девятнадцать, а самому младшему сыну всего полтора года. Айнура держит скот и продаёт молоко, а её муж работает таксистом. Айнура с мужем с недавних пор занимаются также и выращиванием сельхоз продукции и теперь им нужен кредит, чтобы провести обработку земли.

Жоомартовой Динаре двадцать девять. Динара – мать троих детей. Муж Динары – работник правоохранительных органов. Сама же Динара предоставляет услуги парикмахера. Недавно Динара с мужем начали грандиозную постройку сарая. Сейчас им необходимо закупить стройматериалы, однако заработков Динары и её мужа не хватает. Они очень надеются на этот кредит. A

Абакирову Жолочу сорок четыре года. Он – отец пятерых детей. Для того, чтобы кормить семью он занимается перепродажей и откормом овец. Его жена работает на вино – водочном заводе. Трое детей школьного и дошкольного возраста, и поэтому Жолочу решил параллельно заниматься земледелием. Он надеется получить этот кредит для сельскохозяйственных работ. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ainura I. is the leader of her group. Her day begins early in the morning, when she milks the cows and takes the milk for sale. For fifteen years the milk has provided her an income of around five thousand soms per month. This isn’t a whole lot of money considering the fact that she’s got three children, so for the past year she has been trying to find herself an additional source of income. Aside from the cattle, Ainura has all manner of poultry, and some sheep and bulls. If the need arises, she can take her cattle to the bazaar and sell them to get money for everyday needs or emergencies. She has a preschooler right now and she realizes that before long her expenses will go up, so, she and her husband, who has farming experience from way back, decided that they would raise crops, too. It was quite a significant decision because they were at the point of really needing to diversify their sources of income. Ainura and her husband have managed to expand their herd of cattle, fix up their house and substantially improve their living conditions. Ainura goes about her work gamely, too, knowing that she’ll always have the support she needs from her husband, who helps her diligently with the business and sticks by her side. She needs a loan at this time to get the items she needs for farming. Ainura’s partners in the group are: Ainura M. is thirty-eight, married, and has five children. Her eldest son is twenty and the youngest is only a year and a half old. She raises cattle and sells the milk. Her husband is a cab driver. Not long ago, she and her husband started raising crops and now they are in need of a loan so they can proceed to work their land. Dinara Z. is twenty-nine and the mother of three children. Her husband works in law-enforcement and she’s a hair stylist. Recently she and her husband began the huge undertaking of building a barn. Now they really need building materials, but their combined incomes don’t suffice. They really need the loan. Zholochu A. is forty-four-years-old and the father of five children. In order to feed his family he raises and sells sheep. His wife works at a vodka factory. Three of the children are preschool and school-aged, so Zholochu decided that he would farm, too. He hopes to receive this loan for his agricultural work.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to sow the land with agricultural products

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 46 years old. He is married with 5 children  between 8 and 20 years old. Three of his children are attending school. Charles is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. His main products are maize, beans, millet and milk which he sells to institutions like schools and at the local market. His main challenges are lack of an organized market and transport and communication problems. 

Charles has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30, 000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. In future, he hopes practice dairy farming on a larger scale and to produce over 20 litres of milk daily. 

Charles  is grateful to Kiva lenders  for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie E. wants to increase the production of her rice farm and fishing business in partnership with her husband. They want to be able to earn more profit and build up a savings fund for the future education of their two children, ages 13 and 16 years old. They hope their children can go to college until they graduate and have their own stable careers. The rice they harvest is sold wholesale to a rice retailer at the market, while Vergie sells the fish her husband catches from the ocean to people around their village and in the marketplace of their town.

In spite of being poor, Vergie is hopeful that her life's aspirations for her family and business will be achieved. She is happy that through ASHI she has had the opportunity to obtain a loan which will financially support the needs of her business to grow and become sustainable one day.

loans.use: For farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and rental of equipment; and for fishing gear and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert M. is 30 years old, married with  a 1 year old child. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift Valley in Kenya. 

Gilbert has been farming for 3 years. He  employs one person from the community. His main product is milk which he sells to Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Litein town. He also operates a retail shop in the same area and sells tea in the local market. His main challenges in farming are the fluctuation in prices of milk and climate changes.

Gilbert has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.45,00 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and consumption. In future he would like to build a dairy unit and purchase extra land to plant grass and increase the number of his dairy cows.

Gilbert is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Bulenga Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Josephine is a 40-year-old, happy-go-lucky, married mother to five buoyant children. She has a real estate business which has been in existence for the last four years in Bulenga, Mpigi. It’s with profits out of this business that this diligently hardworking woman has sustained her family for all these years. All her boisterous children are in good schools.

After saving some cash from her erstwhile produce business, Josephine decided to venture into a much tougher and more engaging business challenge. Real estate was her preference and, with enough reserves of courage and conviction, she started this new business.  Since then she has never looked back.

In a month, Josephine makes profits in the range of 1,000,000 shillings. This is all down to her resilience, hard work ethic and experience that she has built up over these years. This loan, she reveals, will come in handy significantly in helping her finish up her new housing projects.

loans.use: To complete construction of her new low-cost rental houses

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma W/g, Mpigi Group

texts.en:
S. Christine is a happily married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. 48-year-old Christine is the perfect personification of hard work. She has, for the last fourteen years, been multi-tasking, plying her produce sales and grocery business in Mpigi Township. Before she ventured into this business, she was inclined to low-key subsistence farming.

Throughout these years of operating, Christine has painstakingly taken measures aimed at getting into her customers good graces. She attributes her good customer handling line of operation as one of the reasons for her business’s longevity. She is optimistic the future will be even brighter on the acquisition of this loan.

Currently Christine makes weekly profits totaling up to 40,000 shillings. With this loan, she is intent on expanding her business. She wants to buy more of the produce that is in high favor with most of her clientele like maize, avocados, tomatoes, apples, and cassava.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell like cassava, tomatoes and maize

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with five children and four of her children go to school. The fifth one is still young.  Florence doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Florence owns a stall in Kalerwe selling tomatoes and onions. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions.  She has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for one and one half years, servicing her third loan. Besides this tomato business, she owns bicycles for hire. Florence sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale.  Florence works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are seasonality (when tomatoes are scarce and when it rains and her customer cannot reach her because she works in a muddy place). She aspires to buy her products directly from the farmers. Florence joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by acquiring more capital. Florence resides in and rents a one-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and  onions

loans.name: Hope Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
Working hard at achieving her set goals in her five-year-old farming business was to B. Esther, a means to an end in her narrow circumstances. With her hard work ethic in tow, her business took a favorable turn.

This 38-year-old married mother of six boisterous children broke new ground with this determination. Before Esther got to this place of vantage in this business, she was a pump attendant at a local petrol (gasoline) station in her locality. She also ekes out supplementary income from a business selling art crafts.

By and large, Esther’s profits, too, have gained momentum as she has steadily, over the last four years, been making profits totaling up to 150,000 shillings a month. With this loan, she anticipates she will be in position to purchase more poultry and poultry feed for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed for her farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Jane owns a stall in Kibuye market selling second hand clothes in the outskirts of Kampala. She buys clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Jane uses public transport to and from Owino to Kibuye. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Besides this clothing business, she is a part-time tailor. She has been in this business for 14 years now. She sells to all categories of people but mainly women.  Jane works five days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She aspires to sell at wholesale only.  Jane decided to work with MCDT because it was near her home. She resides in and rents a two-room house where she stays with four people and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, market dues and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu. Patrick has beeen farming for six years; his product is bananas which he sells to the middlemen who later sell them to the local market. He also operates a shop in the same area.

He recently completed repayment of a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 40,000 KES and has requested a new loan for 80,000 KES to constuct a better cowshed and upgrade his banana farming. The income from this loan will help him buy more land and later buy a car that will help boost his income.

His main challenges in farming are the low banana prices during the rainy season and natural hazards, like wind which causes banana stems to break. He plans to start potato farming bacause he has already identified a ready market for it.

He says that Juhudi gives loans through the group-guarantee mechanism and this makes it easier to access credit to boost his farming.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed and upgrade his banana farming

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 25, married, and the mother of two children aged 5 and 8 years old both of whom attend school.

Linet is a hard-working farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya, where she has been farming for 7 years. Her main product is eggs which she sells in the local market. She also operates a kiosk (small shop) where she sells vegetables. Her main challenge has been poultry diseases  and she has been unable to obtain a loan to expand her poultry farm.

Linet has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.20,000 to expand her poultry farming and intends to use it to buy more chickens. The proceeds from the poultry farm will help her educate her children. In future, she would like to acquire a dairy cow as well as growing her poultry farm.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 37 years old and married with two children, 15 and 17. Both children attend school.

Zipporah is a hard-working farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been practising mixed farming for 19 years and her main products are milk, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, and cabbages that she sells in the local market. She also raises poultry. Her biggest challenge is pests and diseases that affect her produce, resulting in poor prices.

Zipporah recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.45,000 and has requested this new loan for KES.70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help educate her children and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes to acquire three more dairy cows producing at least 30 litres of milk daily, and increase her chicken stock to 200.

She is grateful of Juhudi because it is helping her acquire a dairy cow which will positively change her life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

He says that through Juhudi he has realized that dairy farming is a business like any other.

The 50-year-old married mother of five school-going children sweats her guts out buying and selling animals like cows as well as selling milk from the cows and selling matooke (green plantain) from her plantation. She operates in the small rural area of Rubimbiri, Ntungamo district, and she has been doing this for the last ten years.

Alice is able to make 450,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is quite modest by any standards and, as such, she requires a loan that will help her buy more cows for her business. Then she will be able to meet her customers’ demand and also earn more revenue.

Alice belongs to a group of members and they insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 24-32, one of whom is still attending school.  He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He is also a retired teacher, and is still enjoying the benefits of his pension. For the past 11 years, Isaac has been producing maize, beans, bananas and milk, which he sells to the local market. His main challenges in farming are the unpredictable weather conditions, lack of enough water and proper veterinary services.

Isaac has requested a loan of KES 70,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The income generated by this loan will enable him to better provide for his family and educate his child who is still in school. In the future, he hopes to expand his farming activities by purchasing 2 more dairy cows and increasing his cereal stocks.

He appreciates the help given and appeals for more funds to boost production.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of her old father. She owns a stall in Kanyanya in the outskirts of Kampala selling bananas, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava. She buys these foodstuffs from Kalerwe market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Deborah  goes shopping on a daily basis.  She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas, boxes of tomatoes, one bag of Irish potatoes and cassava. She has been in this business for 20 years.  Besides this food business, she also sells piped water to the community at 100/= per jerrycan.  Her major customers are the community around her. Deborah works seven days a week and her business challenges are transportation and thieves. She aspires to buy directly from the farmers. She joined MCDT because she wanted money for her business. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava

He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP whenever he sells his harvested rice. His earned income from the business is of great help in supporting his family’s needs especially the education of his children. In 2006, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is widowed with four children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister’s children who are school going.  Alice owns a stall  in Owino market selling second hand shoes. She uses public transport to and from home. Alice buys from  the same market where she works. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years now and with MCDT for two and one half years, servicing her sixth loan.  She pays market dues of 25,000/= per month and 1,000 per day worked.  Alice works six days a week and her business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of second hand shoes.  Alice aspires to see her business grow big and to start going to Mombasa and Nairobi for shoes. Alice joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base.  She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

texts.en: Robinah is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Kawempe selling all types of merchandise like soap, sugar, cooking oil and salt.  She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like one bag of sugar, a carton of salt one jerycan of cooking oil and box soap. She has been in this business for seven years and besides this retail shop she also sells tap (piped) water.  Her major customers are her village mates. She works seven days a week. Robinah‘s business challenges includes seasonality and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her shop in Kawempe Nabukalu zone.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and own a whole sale shop.  She joined MCDT to acquire more capital as it was giving out timely loans.  Robinah owns and resides in a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Monthly expenses includes food medical and school fees

loans.name: Zakari

texts.fr:
Cet homme a 54 ans, marié. Il est propriétaire d’une boutique de vente de produits d'alimentations générale auquel il a associé la vente de téléphones portables et accessoires. Sa boutique « Ets ALULUX » est située à un  carrefour bien en vue à Adidogomé et attire beaucoup de clients.
Le microcrédit sollicité est destiné à l'achat de divers produits alimentaires et d’un nouvel arrivage de téléphones portables pour attirer plus de clients et les fidéliser.
texts.en:
This man is 54 years old and is married. He owns a general food store where he also sells mobile phones and related accessories. His store “Ets ALULUX” is located at a well-situated crossroad in Adidogomé and attracts many customers. The requested micro-loan is destined to buy a variety of food products and a new arrival of mobile phones, to attract more customers and ensure their loyalty.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy mobile phones

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony M. is a Palestinian from Bethlehem, a city known as a religious and tourist attraction, being the place where Christ was born. M. owned an auto repair workshop, which was located next to the Apartheid Wall in Bethlehem. Before the construction of the wall, his workshop was prospering, but after the blockade that was caused by the wall, his business was doing poorly, so he closed it. Then he rented another store next to Rachel's Tomb and started a gift and souvenir store, because Bethlehem is a magnet for tourists.

The store has been opened for a year and a half and is doing very well. Tony wanted to expand his business and purchase more gifts and souvenirs, because summer, the tourism season, is around the corner. A $3000 loan will help him increase the profits of the season.

Tony is married and has three children. In the photograph, you can see Tony in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing gifts and ornaments

loans.name: Kyagalanyi Masajja Development Group, Kampala

texts.en:
Self-assured and hardworking, 30-year-old N. Florence has, for the last eight years, sold bananas and charcoal in Masajja, Kampala, to earn a livelihood. Out of her narrow circumstances as a housewife evolved the idea to start up her own business.

This married mother of four has educated all her children with earnings from this business. Her business generates her profits in the range of 100 to 120 thousand shillings a week. She also ekes out additional profits operating a local commercial motorcycle business.

With this loan, Florence wants to buy more bananas and charcoal that she can later sell to her customers. She also wants to buy another commercial motorcycle or boda-boda as they are known here. Florence hopes to be the leading supplier of foodstuffs in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more yellow bananas and, later, another commercial motorcycle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce W. N. is thirty eight years old. Her husband works with Chartis Insurance and they have 2 children. Her business is located at the third floor of a building in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She sells beaded baskets to walk-in and repeat customers. She also sells the baskets to tourists. She has been in this business for the past three years and she says the business is profitable. She says the major challenge she has is lack of enough space to do her business and also small market share. She wishes to get to the international market where she can sell the baskets, as they are really loved by many white people. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more materials for making the baskets. She hopes to provide employment to many people and increase her clientele base. She describes herself as hardworking and kindhearted.

loans.use: Materials for baskets: e.g beads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Nima

texts.en:
Madame Nima K. S. is 35 years old. She is married to a carpenter, and together they have one child. Nima was born in Tchamba, Togo, and she sells rice out of her home in Lomé. She's been working at this business for 20 years already. 

This is Nima's first loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner. She requested 350,000 CFA to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El S. is a married mother (her husband is pictured here). They are blessed with four children, all four of whom are single. To help with the family’s living expenses, two of the children are employed at different occupations. To pursue a daily income, El S. rents a shop inside the market where she sell meatballs to people who come to buy things for cooking. Her husband drives a taxi to earn a living. 

Mrs. El S. will be using her first loan to improve the capital of her meatball business.

loans.use: To improve the capital of the meatball business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad A. is a young man from Bethlehem. Ahmad is the father of three sons. He owns a poultry farm where he raises and sells chickens. He  $500 a month. To expand his business and his profits, he decided to start raising and selling goats on his farm.

Ahmad bought 10 goats to start and then came to FATEN and took a $2000 loan to buy more goats. This endeavor will increase his returns, provide Ahmad and his family with better living conditions, and will cover the household expenses.

In the photograph, Ahmad appears in the FATEN's office.

loans.use: Purchase goats to add to the farm

loans.name: Daariimaa

texts.en:
Daariimaa B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her oldest two daughters attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in primary school. Her husband, Balsanjav, works as a solderer for a private company.
Daariimaa operates a shoe trading business at Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in the city. She started her business in 2005 with capital of 500,000 MNT after moving to the city from Hovd province in far western Mongolia where she operated a cashmere business. Since 2005, she has grown her business successfully and today her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT.
Daariimaa is an industrious person with good business sense. She has used her business to greatly improve her family's quality of life. She has used her profits to build a new house for her family. Daariimaa has many plans for the future and hopes to save money this summer so she can pay her children's education fees. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase another counter at the market as well as new shoes to sell that she will import from China.

loans.use: To purchase another counter at the market and new shoes for resale
